Name: Citizen Kane
One-line: Following the death of publishing tycoon Charles Foster Kane, reporters scramble to uncover the meaning of his final utterance: 'Rosebud.'

Name: The Passion of Joan of Arc
One-line: In 1431, Jeanne d'Arc is placed on trial on charges of heresy. The ecclesiastical jurists attempt to force Jeanne to recant her claims of holy visions.

Name: City Lights
One-line: With the aid of a wealthy erratic tippler, a dewy-eyed tramp who has fallen in love with a sightless flower girl accumulates money to be able to help her medically.

Name: Metropolis
One-line: In a futuristic city sharply divided between the working class and the city planners, the son of the city's mastermind falls in love with a working-class prophet who predicts the coming of a savior to mediate their differences.

Name: Man with a Movie Camera
One-line: A man travels around a city with a camera slung over his shoulder, documenting urban life with dazzling invention.

Name: Sunrise
One-line: A sophisticated city woman seduces a farmer and convinces him to murder his wife and join her in the city, but he ends up rekindling his romance with his wife when he changes his mind at the last moment.

Name: Casablanca
One-line: A cynical expatriate American cafe owner struggles to decide whether or not to help his former lover and her fugitive husband escape the Nazis in French Morocco.

Name: Seven Samurai
One-line: Farmers from a village exploited by bandits hire a veteran samurai for protection, who gathers six other samurai to join him.

Name: The Godfather
One-line: The aging patriarch of an organized crime dynasty transfers control of his clandestine empire to his reluctant son.

Name: 12 Angry Men
One-line: The jury in a New York City murder trial is frustrated by a single member whose skeptical caution forces them to more carefully consider the evidence before jumping to a hasty verdict.

Name: Vertigo
One-line: A former San Francisco police detective juggles wrestling with his personal demons and becoming obsessed with the hauntingly beautiful woman he has been hired to trail, who may be deeply disturbed.

Name: Battleship Potemkin
One-line: In the midst of the Russian Revolution of 1905, the crew of the battleship Potemkin mutiny against the brutal, tyrannical regime of the vessel's officers. The resulting street demonstration in Odessa brings on a police massacre.

Name: Modern Times
One-line: The Tramp struggles to live in modern industrial society with the help of a young homeless woman.

Name: Tokyo Story
One-line: An old couple visit their children and grandchildren in the city, but receive little attention.

Name: Rear Window
One-line: A photographer in a wheelchair spies on his neighbors from his Greenwich Village courtyard apartment window, and becomes convinced one of them has committed murder, despite the skepticism of his fashion-model girlfriend.

Name: Singin' in the Rain
One-line: A silent film star falls for a chorus girl just as he and his delusionally jealous screen partner are trying to make the difficult transition to talking pictures in 1920s Hollywood.

Name: The Rules of the Game
One-line: A bourgeois life in France at the onset of World War II, as the rich and their poor servants meet up at a French chateau.

Name: Psycho
One-line: A Phoenix secretary embezzles $40,000 from her employer's client, goes on the run and checks into a remote motel run by a young man under the domination of his mother.

Name: It's a Wonderful Life
One-line: An angel is sent from Heaven to help a desperately frustrated businessman by showing him what life would have been like if he had never existed.

Name: Sunset Blvd.
One-line: A screenwriter develops a dangerous relationship with a faded film star determined to make a triumphant return.

Name: Rashomon
One-line: The rape of a bride and the murder of her samurai husband are recalled from the perspectives of a bandit, the bride, the samurai's ghost and a woodcutter.

Name: Lawrence of Arabia
One-line: The story of T.E. Lawrence, the English officer who successfully united and led the diverse, often warring, Arab tribes during World War I in order to fight the Turks.

Name: Double Indemnity
One-line: A Los Angeles insurance representative lets an alluring housewife seduce him into a scheme of insurance fraud and murder that arouses the suspicion of his colleague, an insurance investigator.

Name: The Godfather Part II
One-line: The early life and career of Vito Corleone in 1920s New York City is portrayed, while his son, Michael, expands and tightens his grip on the family crime syndicate.

Name: The Third Man
One-line: Pulp novelist Holly Martins travels to shadowy, postwar Vienna, only to find himself investigating the mysterious death of an old friend, Harry Lime.

Name: All About Eve
One-line: A seemingly timid but secretly ruthless ingénue insinuates herself into the lives of an aging Broadway star and her circle of theater friends.

Name: The Apartment
One-line: A Manhattan insurance clerk tries to rise in his company by letting its executives use his apartment for trysts, but complications and a romance of his own ensue.

Name: Children of Paradise
One-line: The theatrical life of a beautiful courtesan in 1830s Paris and the four men who love her.

Name: The Wizard of Oz
One-line: Young Dorothy Gale and her dog Toto are swept away by a tornado from their Kansas farm to the magical Land of Oz, and embark on a quest with three new friends to see the Wizard, who can return her to her home and fulfill the others' wishes.

Name: Gone with the Wind
Actors: ['George Cukor', 'Sam Wood', 'Clark Gable', 'Vivien Leigh', 'Thomas Mitchell', "Barbara O'Neil"]
One-line: A sheltered and manipulative Southern belle and a roguish profiteer face off in a turbulent romance as the society around them crumbles with the end of slavery and is rebuilt during the Civil War and Reconstruction periods.

Name: Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb
One-line: An insane American general orders a bombing attack on the Soviet Union, triggering a path to nuclear holocaust that a war room full of politicians and generals frantically tries to stop.

Name: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
One-line: A bounty hunting scam joins two men in an uneasy alliance against a third in a race to find a fortune in gold buried in a remote cemetery.

Name: Some Like It Hot
One-line: After two male musicians witness a mob hit, they flee the state in an all-female band disguised as women, but further complications set in.

Name: All Quiet on the Western Front
One-line: A German youth eagerly enters World War I, but his enthusiasm wanes as he gets a firsthand view of the horror.

Name: The Grapes of Wrath
One-line: An Oklahoma family, driven off their farm by the poverty and hopelessness of the Dust Bowl, joins the westward migration to California, suffering the misfortunes of the homeless in the Great Depression.

Name: Notorious
One-line: The daughter of a convicted German spy is asked by American agents to gather information on a ring of German scientists in South America. How far will she have to go to ingratiate herself with them?

Name: The Best Years of Our Lives
One-line: Three World War II veterans, two of them traumatized or disabled, return home to the American midwest to discover that they and their families have been irreparably changed.

Name: North by Northwest
Actors: ['Cary Grant', 'Eva Marie Saint', 'James Mason', 'Jessie Royce Landis']
One-line: A New York City advertising executive goes on the run after being mistaken for a government agent by a group of foreign spies, and falls for a woman whose loyalties he begins to doubt.

Name: Sansho the Bailiff
One-line: In medieval Japan, a compassionate governor is sent into exile. His wife and children try to join him, but are separated, and the children grow up amid suffering and oppression.

Name: It Happened One Night
One-line: A renegade reporter trailing a young runaway heiress for a big story joins her on a bus heading from Florida to New York, and they end up stuck with each other when the bus leaves them behind at one of the stops.

Name: Brief Encounter
One-line: Meeting a stranger in a railway station, a woman is tempted to cheat on her husband.

Name: Ikiru
One-line: A bureaucrat tries to find meaning in his life after he discovers he has terminal cancer.

Name: Late Spring
One-line: Several people try to talk 27-year-old Noriko into marrying, but all she wants is to keep on caring for her widowed father.

Name: The Treasure of the Sierra Madre
One-line: Two down-on-their-luck Americans searching for work in 1920s Mexico convince an old prospector to help them mine for gold in the Sierra Madre Mountains.

Name: The Night of the Hunter
One-line: A self-proclaimed preacher marries a gullible widow whose young children are reluctant to tell him where their real dad hid the $10,000 he'd stolen in a robbery.

Name: 8½
One-line: A harried movie director retreats into his memories and fantasies.

Name: M
One-line: When the police in a German city are unable to catch a child-murderer, other criminals join in the manhunt.

Name: The Battle of Algiers
One-line: In the 1950s, fear and violence escalate as the people of Algiers fight for independence from the French government.

Name: La Dolce Vita
One-line: A series of stories following a week in the life of a philandering tabloid journalist living in Rome.

Name: Apocalypse Now
One-line: A U.S. Army officer serving in Vietnam is tasked with assassinating a renegade Special Forces Colonel who sees himself as a god.

Name: Taxi Driver
One-line: A mentally unstable veteran works as a nighttime taxi driver in New York City, where the perceived decadence and sleaze fuels his urge for violent action.

Name: 2001: A Space Odyssey
One-line: After uncovering a mysterious artifact buried beneath the Lunar surface, a spacecraft is sent to Jupiter to find its origins: a spacecraft manned by two men and the supercomputer HAL 9000.

Name: The Maltese Falcon
One-line: San Francisco private detective Sam Spade takes on a case that involves him with three eccentric criminals, a gorgeous liar and their quest for a priceless statuette, with the stakes rising after his partner is murdered.

Name: Touch of Evil
One-line: A stark, perverse story of murder, kidnapping and police corruption in a Mexican border town.

Name: Intolerance
One-line: The story of a poor young woman separated by prejudice from her husband and baby is interwoven with tales of intolerance from throughout history.

Name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest
One-line: In the Fall of 1963, a Korean War veteran and criminal pleads insanity and is admitted to a mental institution, where he rallies up the scared patients against the tyrannical nurse.

Name: The Philadelphia Story
One-line: When a rich woman's ex-husband and a tabloid-type reporter turn up just before her planned remarriage, she begins to learn the truth about herself.

Name: Paths of Glory
One-line: After a failed attack on a German position, a general orders three soldiers, chosen at random, court-martialed for cowardice and their commanding officer must defend them.

Name: Bicycle Thieves
One-line: In post-war Italy, a working-class man's bicycle is stolen, endangering his efforts to find work. He and his son set out to find it.

Name: On the Waterfront
One-line: An ex-prize fighter turned New Jersey longshoreman struggles to stand up to his corrupt union bosses, including his older brother, as he starts to connect with the grieving sister of one of the syndicate's victims.

Name: Bride of Frankenstein
One-line: Mary Shelley reveals the main characters of her novel survived: Baron Henry Frankenstein, goaded by an even madder scientist, builds his monster a mate.

Name: The Circus
One-line: The Tramp finds work and the girl of his dreams at a circus.

Name: The Leopard
One-line: The Prince of Salina, a noble aristocrat of impeccable integrity, tries to preserve his family and class amid the tumultuous social upheavals of 1860s Sicily.

Name: Sweet Smell of Success
One-line: Powerful but unethical Broadway columnist J.J. Hunsecker coerces unscrupulous press agent Sidney Falco into breaking up his sister's romance with a jazz musician.

Name: Star Wars: Episode IV - A New Hope
One-line: Luke Skywalker joins forces with a Jedi Knight, a cocky pilot, a Wookiee and two droids to save the galaxy from the Empire's world-destroying battle station, while also attempting to rescue Princess Leia from the mysterious Darth Vader.

Name: Duck Soup
One-line: Rufus T. Firefly is named the dictator of bankrupt Freedonia and declares war on neighboring Sylvania over the love of his wealthy backer Mrs. Teasdale, contending with two inept spies who can't seem to keep straight which side they're on.

Name: To Be or Not to Be
One-line: During the German occupation of Poland, an acting troupe becomes embroiled in a Polish soldier's efforts to track down a German spy.

Name: Persona
One-line: A nurse is put in charge of a mute actress and finds that their personae are melding together.

Name: Bringing Up Baby
One-line: While trying to secure a $1 million donation for his museum, a befuddled paleontologist is pursued by a flighty and often irritating heiress and her pet leopard, Baby.

Name: The Seventh Seal
One-line: A knight returning to Sweden after the Crusades seeks answers about life, death, and the existence of God as he plays chess against the Grim Reaper during the Black Plague.

Name: The Lady Vanishes
One-line: While travelling in continental Europe, a rich young playgirl realizes that an elderly lady seems to have disappeared from the train.

Name: Playtime
One-line: Monsieur Hulot curiously wanders around a high-tech Paris, paralleling a trip with a group of American tourists. Meanwhile, a nightclub/restaurant prepares its opening night, but it's still under construction.

Name: Harakiri
One-line: When a ronin requesting seppuku at a feudal lord's palace is told of the brutal suicide of another ronin who previously visited, he reveals how their pasts are intertwined - and in doing so challenges the clan's integrity.

Name: The Shop Around the Corner
One-line: Two employees at a gift shop can barely stand each other, without realizing that they are falling in love through the post as each other's anonymous pen pal.

Name: Sherlock Jr.
One-line: A film projectionist longs to be a detective, and puts his meagre skills to work when he is framed by a rival for stealing his girlfriend's father's pocketwatch.

Name: The Bridge on the River Kwai
One-line: British POWs are forced to build a railway bridge across the river Kwai for their Japanese captors in occupied Burma, not knowing that the allied forces are planning a daring commando raid through the jungle to destroy it.

Name: Army of Shadows
One-line: An account of underground resistance fighters in Nazi-occupied France.

Name: High and Low
One-line: An executive of a Yokohama shoe company becomes a victim of extortion when his chauffeur's son is kidnapped by mistake and held for ransom.

Name: Barry Lyndon
One-line: An Irish rogue wins the heart of a rich widow and assumes her dead husband's aristocratic position in 18th-century England.

Name: Fanny and Alexander
One-line: Two young Swedish children in the 1900s experience the many comedies and tragedies of their lively and affectionate theatrical family, the Ekdahls.

Name: The Lady Eve
One-line: A trio of classy card sharks targets a socially awkward brewery heir, until one of them falls in love with him.

Name: The Searchers
One-line: An American Civil War veteran embarks on a years-long journey to rescue his niece from the Comanches after the rest of his brother's family is massacred in a raid on their Texas farm.

Name: Stagecoach
One-line: A group of people traveling on a stagecoach find their journey complicated by the threat of Geronimo and learn something about each other in the process.

Name: The General
One-line: After being rejected by the Confederate military, not realizing it was due to his crucial civilian role, an engineer must single-handedly recapture his beloved locomotive after it is seized by Union spies and return it through enemy lines.

Name: Wild Strawberries
One-line: After living a life marked by coldness, an aging professor is forced to confront the emptiness of his existence.

Name: Yojimbo
One-line: A crafty ronin comes to a town divided by two criminal gangs and decides to play them against each other to free the town.

Name: King Kong
Actors: ['Ernest B. Schoedsack', 'Fay Wray', 'Robert Armstrong', 'Bruce Cabot', 'Frank Reicher']
One-line: A film crew goes to a tropical island for a location shoot, where they capture a colossal ape who takes a shine to their blonde starlet, and bring him back to New York City.

Name: Fantasia
Actors: ['Samuel Armstrong', 'Ford Beebe Jr.', 'Norman Ferguson', 'David Hand', 'Jim Handley', 'T. Hee', 'Wilfred Jackson', 'Hamilton Luske', 'Bill Roberts', 'Paul Satterfield', 'Ben Sharpsteen', 'Leopold Stokowski', 'Deems Taylor', 'The Philadelphia Orchestra', 'Corey Burton']
One-line: A series of eight famous pieces of classical music, conducted by Leopold Stokowski and interpreted in animation by Walt Disney's team of artists.

Name: The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance
One-line: A senator returns to a Western town for the funeral of an old friend and tells the story of his origins.

Name: Umberto D.
One-line: An elderly man and his dog struggle to survive on his government pension in Rome.

Name: Balthazar
One-line: The story of a mistreated donkey and the people around him. A study on saintliness and a sister piece to Bresson's Mouchette.

Name: A Streetcar Named Desire
One-line: Disturbed Blanche DuBois moves in with her sister in New Orleans and is tormented by her brutish brother-in-law while her reality crumbles around her.

Name: I Was Born, But...
One-line: Two young brothers throw a tantrum when they discover that their father isn't the most important man in his workplace.

Name: Chinatown
One-line: A private detective hired to expose an adulterer in 1930s Los Angeles finds himself caught up in a web of deceit, corruption, and murder.

Name: How Green Was My Valley
One-line: At the turn of the century in a Welsh mining village, the Morgans, he stern, she gentle, raise coal-mining sons and hope their youngest will find a better life.

Name: Shoah
One-line: Claude Lanzmann's epic documentary recounts the story of the Holocaust through interviews with witnesses - perpetrators as well as survivors.

Name: The Great Dictator
One-line: Dictator Adenoid Hynkel tries to expand his empire while a poor Jewish barber tries to avoid persecution from Hynkel's regime.

Name: Annie Hall
One-line: Alvy Singer, a divorced Jewish comedian, reflects on his relationship with ex-lover Annie Hall, an aspiring nightclub singer, which ended abruptly just like his previous marriages.

Name: Rio Bravo
One-line: A small-town sheriff in the American West enlists the help of a disabled man, a drunk, and a young gunfighter in his efforts to hold in jail the brother of the local bad guy.

Name: Top Hat
One-line: An American dancer comes to Britain and falls for a model whom he initially annoyed, but she mistakes him for his goofy producer.

Name: The Magnificent Ambersons
Actors: ['Fred Fleck', 'Robert Wise', 'Tim Holt', 'Joseph Cotten', 'Dolores Costello', 'Anne Baxter']
One-line: The spoiled young heir to the decaying Amberson fortune comes between his widowed mother and the man she has always loved.

Name: The Hustler
One-line: An up-and-coming pool player plays a long-time champion in a single high-stakes match.

Name: Beauty and the Beast
One-line: A beautiful young woman takes her father's place as the prisoner of a mysterious beast, who wishes to marry her.

Name: Rififi
One-line: Four men plan a technically perfect crime, but the human element intervenes...

Name: The Wild Bunch
One-line: An aging group of outlaws look for one last big score as the "traditional" American West is disappearing around them.

Name: The Thin Man
One-line: Former detective Nick Charles and his wealthy wife Nora investigate a murder case, mostly for the fun of it.

Name: Jeanne Dielman, 23, quai du commerce, 1080 Bruxelles
One-line: A lonely widowed housewife does her daily chores, takes care of her apartment where she lives with her teenage son, and turns the occasional trick to make ends meet. However, something happens that changes her safe routine.

Name: Anatomy of a Murder
One-line: An upstate Michigan lawyer defends a soldier who claims he killed an innkeeper due to temporary insanity after the victim raped his wife. What is the truth, and will he win his case?

Name: Pépé le Moko
One-line: A wanted gangster is both king and prisoner of the Casbah. He is protected from arrest by his friends, but is torn by his desire for freedom outside. A visiting Parisian beauty may just tempt his fate.

Name: The 400 Blows
One-line: A young boy, left without attention, delves into a life of petty crime.

Name: The Red Shoes
One-line: A young ballet dancer is torn between the man she loves and her pursuit to become a prima ballerina.

Name: The Wages of Fear
One-line: In a decrepit South American village, four men are hired to transport an urgent nitroglycerine shipment without the equipment that would make it safe.

Name: Schindler's List
One-line: In German-occupied Poland during World War II, industrialist Oskar Schindler gradually becomes concerned for his Jewish workforce after witnessing their persecution by the Nazis.

Name: The Grand Illusion
One-line: During WWI, two French soldiers are captured and imprisoned in a German P.O.W. camp. Several escape attempts follow until they are eventually sent to a seemingly inescapable fortress.

Name: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs
Actors: ['David Hand', 'Wilfred Jackson', 'Larry Morey', 'Perce Pearce', 'Ben Sharpsteen', 'Adriana Caselotti', 'Harry Stockwell', 'Lucille La Verne', 'Roy Atwell']
One-line: Exiled into the dangerous forest by her wicked stepmother, a princess is rescued by seven dwarf miners who make her part of their household.

Name: Shadow of a Doubt
One-line: A teenage girl, overjoyed when her favorite uncle comes to visit the family in their quiet California town, slowly begins to suspect that he is in fact the "Merry Widow" killer sought by the authorities.

Name: Nashville
One-line: Over the course of a few hectic days, numerous interrelated people prepare for a political convention.

Name: The Awful Truth
One-line: A married couple file an amicable divorce, but find it harder to let go of each other than they initially thought.

Name: Goodfellas
One-line: The story of Henry Hill and his life in the mafia, covering his relationship with his wife Karen and his mob partners Jimmy Conway and Tommy DeVito.

Name: The Conformist
One-line: A weak-willed Italian man becomes a fascist flunky who goes abroad to arrange the assassination of his old teacher, now a political dissident.

Name: Star Wars: Episode V - The Empire Strikes Back
One-line: After the Rebels are overpowered by the Empire, Luke Skywalker begins his Jedi training with Yoda, while his friends are pursued across the galaxy by Darth Vader and bounty hunter Boba Fett.

Name: To Kill a Mockingbird
One-line: Atticus Finch, a widowed lawyer in Depression-era Alabama, defends a Black man against an undeserved rape charge, and tries to educate his young children against prejudice.

Name: Red River
One-line: Dunson leads a cattle drive, the culmination of over 14 years of work, to its destination in Missouri. But his tyrannical behavior along the way causes a mutiny, led by his adopted son.

Name: Raging Bull
One-line: The life of boxer Jake LaMotta, whose violence and temper that led him to the top in the ring destroyed his life outside of it.

Name: An Autumn Afternoon
One-line: An aging widower arranges a marriage for his only daughter.

Name: Andrei Rublev
One-line: The life, times and afflictions of the fifteenth-century Russian iconographer St. Andrei Rublev.

Name: West Side Story
One-line: Two youngsters from rival New York City gangs fall in love, but tensions between their respective friends build toward tragedy.

Name: Z
One-line: The public murder of a prominent politician and doctor amid a violent demonstration is covered up by military and government officials. A tenacious magistrate is determined not to let them get away with it.

Name: The Gold Rush
One-line: A prospector goes to the Klondike during the 1890s gold rush in hopes of making his fortune, and is smitten with a girl he sees in a dance hall.

Name: The Human Condition III: A Soldier's Prayer
One-line: His ideals challenged by life as a conscript in war-time Japan's military, a pacifist faces ever greater tests in his fight for survival.

Name: Only Angels Have Wings
One-line: At a remote South American trading port, the manager of an air-freight company is forced to risk his pilots' lives in order to win an important contract as a traveling American showgirl stops in town.

Name: A Woman Under the Influence
One-line: Although wife and mother Mabel is loved by her husband Nick, her mental illness places a strain on the marriage.

Name: Meet Me in St. Louis
One-line: Young love and childish fears highlight a year in the life of a turn-of-the-century family.

Name: Jules and Jim
One-line: Decades of a love triangle concerning two friends and an impulsive woman.

Name: Journey to Italy
One-line: An unhappily married couple attempts to find direction and insight while vacationing in Naples.

Name: Red Beard
One-line: In 19th-century Japan, a rough-tempered yet charitable town doctor trains a young intern.

Name: Dog Day Afternoon
One-line: Three amateur bank robbers plan to hold up a bank. A nice simple robbery: Walk in, take the money, and run. Unfortunately, the supposedly uncomplicated heist suddenly becomes a bizarre nightmare as everything that could go wrong does.

Name: Ran
One-line: In Medieval Japan, an elderly warlord retires, handing over his empire to his three sons. However, he vastly underestimates how the new-found power will corrupt them and cause them to turn on each other...and him.

Name: Mutiny on the Bounty
One-line: First mate Fletcher Christian leads a revolt against his sadistic commander, Captain Bligh, in this classic seafaring adventure, based on the real-life 1789 mutiny.

Name: Alien
One-line: The crew of a commercial spacecraft encounters a deadly lifeform after investigating a mysterious transmission of unknown origin.

Name: L'Atalante
One-line: Newly married couple Juliette and a ship captain Jean struggle through marriage as they travel on the L'atalante along with the captain's first mate Le père Jules and a cabin boy.

Name: Rocco and His Brothers
One-line: Having recently been uprooted to Milan, Rocco and his four brothers each look for a new way in life when a prostitute comes between Rocco and his brother Simone.

Name: The Deer Hunter
One-line: An in-depth examination of the ways in which the Vietnam War impacts and disrupts the lives of several friends in a small steel mill town in Pennsylvania.

Name: Jaws
One-line: When a killer shark unleashes chaos on a beach community off Cape Cod, it's up to a local sheriff, a marine biologist, and an old seafarer to hunt the beast down.

Name: Once Upon a Time in the West
One-line: A mysterious stranger with a harmonica joins forces with a notorious desperado to protect a beautiful widow from a ruthless assassin working for the railroad.

Name: The Big Sleep
One-line: Private detective Philip Marlowe is hired by a wealthy family. Before the complex case is over, he's seen murder, blackmail and what might be love.

Name: Solaris
One-line: A psychologist is sent to a station orbiting a distant planet in order to discover what has caused the crew to go insane.

Name: Cool Hand Luke
One-line: A laid-back Southern man is sentenced to two years in a rural prison, but refuses to conform.

Name: Early Summer
One-line: A family chooses a match for their daughter Noriko, but she, surprisingly, has her own plans.

Name: Out of the Past
One-line: A private eye escapes his past to run a gas station in a small town, but his past catches up with him. Now he must return to the big city world of danger, corruption, double crosses, and duplicitous dames.

Name: Woman in the Dunes
One-line: An entomologist on vacation is trapped by local villagers into living with a woman whose life task is shoveling sand for them.

Name: Frankenstein
One-line: Dr Henry Frankenstein is obsessed with assembling a living being from parts of several exhumed corpses.

Name: My Fair Lady
One-line: In 1910s London, snobbish phonetics professor Henry Higgins agrees to a wager that he can make crude flower girl, Eliza Doolittle, presentable in high society.

Name: A Man Escaped
One-line: A captured French Resistance fighter during World War II engineers a daunting escape from a German prison in France.

Name: Viridiana
One-line: Viridiana, a young nun about to take her final vows, pays a visit to her widowed uncle at the request of her Mother Superior.

Name: Days of Heaven
One-line: A hot-tempered farm laborer convinces the woman he loves to marry their rich but dying boss so that they can have a claim to his fortune.

Name: Cléo from 5 to 7
One-line: Cleo, a singer and hypochondriac, becomes increasingly worried that she might have cancer while awaiting test results from her doctor.

Name: Rosemary's Baby
One-line: A young couple trying for a baby moves into an aging, ornate apartment building on Central Park West, where they find themselves surrounded by peculiar neighbors.

Name: Der blaue Engel
One-line: An elderly professor's ordered life spins dangerously out of control when he falls for a nightclub singer.

Name: Ordet
Actors: ['Henrik Malberg', 'Emil Hass Christensen', 'Preben Lerdorff Rye', 'Hanne Aagesen']
One-line: Follows the lives of the Borgen family, as they deal with inner conflict, as well as religious conflict with each other, and the rest of the town.

Name: Napoleon
One-line: A film about the French general's youth and early military career.

Name: Network
One-line: A television network cynically exploits a deranged former anchor's ravings and revelations about the news media for its own profit, but finds that his message may be difficult to control.

Name: A Matter of Life and Death
One-line: A British wartime aviator who cheats death must argue for his life before a celestial court, hoping to prolong his fledgling romance with an American girl.

Name: The 39 Steps
One-line: A man in London tries to help a counter-espionage agent, but when the agent is killed and the man stands accused, he must go on the run to save himself and stop a spy ring that is trying to steal top-secret information.

Name: Pather Panchali
One-line: Impoverished priest Harihar Ray, dreaming of a better life for himself and his family, leaves his rural Bengal village in search of work.

Name: High Noon
One-line: A town Marshal, despite the disagreements of his newlywed bride and the townspeople around him, must face a gang of deadly killers alone at "high noon" when the gang leader, an outlaw he "sent up" years ago, arrives on the noon train.

Name: Black Narcissus
One-line: A group of nuns struggle to establish a convent in the Himalayas, while isolation, extreme weather, altitude, and culture clashes all conspire to drive the well-intentioned missionaries mad.

Name: The Sting
One-line: Two grifters team up to pull off the ultimate con.

Name: The French Connection
One-line: A pair of NYPD detectives in the Narcotics Bureau stumble onto a heroin smuggling ring based in Marseilles, but stopping them and capturing their leaders proves an elusive goal.

Name: Strangers on a Train
One-line: A psychopathic man tries to forcibly persuade a tennis star to agree to his theory that two strangers can get away with murder by submitting to his plan to kill the other's most-hated person.

Name: The Cranes Are Flying

One-line: A living puppet, with the help of a cricket as his conscience, must prove himself worthy to become a real boy.

Name: The Conversation

Name: Scarface
One-line: An ambitious and nearly insane violent gangster climbs the ladder of success in the mob, but his weaknesses prove to be his downfall.

Name: Patton

Name: The Shawshank Redemption

Name: The Discreet Charm of the Bourgeoisie

Name: Celine and Julie Go Boating

Name: Witness for the Prosecution

Name: Trouble in Paradise

Name: Dumbo

Name: The Invisible Man

Name: The Innocents

Name: Shanghai Express
One-line: A notorious woman rides a train through a dangerous situation with a British captain she loved.

One-line: A Japanese pacifist, unable to face the dire consequences of conscientious objection, is transformed by his attempts to compromise with the demands of war-time Japan.

Name: L'Avventura

Name: La Notte

Name: The Kid

Name: Dragon Inn
One-line: When the children of an executed General are pursued in 1457 China, some heroic martial arts swordsmen intervene.

Name: Little Women

Name: His Girl Friday

Name: Amarcord

Name: A Brighter Summer Day

One-line: Gandalf and Aragorn lead the World of Men against Sauron's army to draw his gaze from Frodo and Sam as they approach Mount Doom with the One Ring.

One-line: As a conscript in war-time Japan's military, a pacifist struggles to maintain his determination to keep his ideals.

Name: The Exorcist

One-line: When a young girl is possessed by a mysterious entity, her mother seeks the help of two Catholic priests to save her life.

Name: Nosferatu
One-line: Vampire Count Orlok expresses interest in a new residence and real estate agent Hutter's wife.

Name: The Hidden Fortress

Name: Spirited Away

Name: Johnny Guitar

Name: Gaslight

Name: Day of Wrath

Name: Hoop Dreams

Name: Bambi
Actors: ['Samuel Armstrong', 'David Hand', 'Graham Heid', 'Bill Roberts', 'Paul Satterfield', 'Norman Wright', 'Arthur Davis', 'Clyde Geronimi', 'Hardie Albright', 'Stan Alexander', 'Bobette Audrey', 'Peter Behn']
One-line: The story of a young deer growing up in the forest.

Name: Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid

Name: An American in Paris

Name: The Asphalt Jungle

Name: The African Queen

Name: The Passenger

Name: Rebel Without a Cause

Name: Stalag 17

Name: Don't Look Now

Name: Kind Hearts and Coronets

Name: Odd Man Out
One-line: A wounded Irish nationalist leader attempts to evade police following a failed robbery in Belfast.

Name: The Earrings of Madame De...
One-line: When an aristocratic woman known only as "Madame de . . ." sells a pair of earrings given to her by her husband in order to pay some debts, she sets off a chain reaction of financial and carnal consequences that can end only in despair.

Name: The Lavender Hill Mob

Name: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
One-line: A meek Hobbit from the Shire and eight companions set out on a journey to destroy the powerful One Ring and save Middle-earth from the Dark Lord Sauron.

Name: Dersu Uzala
One-line: The Russian army sends an explorer on an expedition to the snowy Siberian wilderness where he makes friends with a seasoned local hunter.

Name: Killer of Sheep

Name: Cat on a Hot Tin Roof

Name: Shane
One-line: A weary gunfighter in 1880s Wyoming begins to envision a quieter life after befriending a homestead family with a young son who idolizes him, but a smoldering range war forces him to act.

Name: Marty

Name: The Lost Weekend

Name: A Man for All Seasons

Name: Night of the Living Dead

Name: Kagemusha: The Shadow Warrior

Name: The Given Word

Name: Horse Feathers

Name: Repulsion

Name: I Am Cuba

Name: Orpheus

Name: A Place in the Sun

Name: Early Spring

Name: Charulata

Name: The Virgin Spring

Name: Spellbound

Name: American Beauty

Name: L.A. Confidential

Name: Peeping Tom

Name: The Texas Chain Saw Massacre

Name: The Travelling Players

Name: Fargo

One-line: Minnesota car salesman Jerry Lundegaard's inept crime falls apart due to his and his henchmen's bungling and the persistent police work of the quite pregnant Marge Gunderson.

Name: The Scarlet Empress

Name: Fitzcarraldo

Name: Lifeboat

Name: Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse

Name: Ashes and Diamonds

Name: Stage Door

Name: Contempt

Name: The Ladykillers

Name: Mafioso

Name: My Neighbor Totoro

Name: Planet of the Apes

Name: The Only Son
One-line: A widow sends her only son away to receive a better education. Years later, she visits him, finding him a poor school teacher with a wife and son.

Name: Fail Safe
One-line: A technical malfunction sends American planes to Moscow to deliver a nuclear attack. Can all-out war be averted?

Name: Dead Poets Society
One-line: Maverick teacher John Keating returns in 1959 to the prestigious New England boys' boarding school where he was once a star student, using poetry to embolden his pupils to new heights of self-expression.

Name: The Lion King
Actors: ['Rob Minkoff', 'Matthew Broderick', 'Jeremy Irons', 'James Earl Jones', 'Whoopi Goldberg']
One-line: Lion prince Simba and his father are targeted by his bitter uncle, who wants to ascend the throne himself.

Name: Bonnie and Clyde
One-line: Bored waitress Bonnie Parker falls in love with an ex-con named Clyde Barrow and together they start a violent crime spree through the country, stealing cars and robbing banks.

Name: No Country for Old Men
Actors: ['Joel Coen', 'Tommy Lee Jones', 'Javier Bardem', 'Josh Brolin', 'Woody Harrelson']
One-line: Violence and mayhem ensue after a hunter stumbles upon the aftermath of a drug deal gone wrong and over two million dollars in cash near the Rio Grande.

Name: The Double Life of Véronique
One-line: Two parallel stories about two identical women; one living in Poland, the other in France. They don't know each other, but their lives are nevertheless profoundly connected.

Name: The Little Soldier
One-line: During the Algerian War, a man and woman from opposing sides fall in love with one another.

Name: Sans Soleil
One-line: A woman narrates the contemplative writings of a seasoned world traveler, focusing on contemporary Japan.

Name: Splendor in the Grass
One-line: The love of high school sweethearts Deanie and Bud is weighed down by the oppressive expectations of their parents and society in smalltown Kansas in 1928, threatening the future of their relationship.

Name: Koyaanisqatsi
One-line: A collection of expertly photographed phenomena with no conventional plot. The footage focuses on the relationship between nature, humanity, and technology.

Name: The Ten Commandments
One-line: Moses, raised as a prince of Egypt in the Pharaoh's household, learns of his true heritage as a Hebrew and his divine mission as the deliverer of his people from slavery.

Name: In the Name of the Father
One-line: An Irish man's coerced confession to an I.R.A. bombing he did not commit results in the imprisonment of his father as well. Meanwhile, a British lawyer fights to clear their names and free them.

Name: Deep Red
One-line: A jazz pianist and a wisecracking journalist are pulled into a complex web of mystery after the former witnesses the brutal murder of a psychic.

Name: The Little Foxes
One-line: The ruthless, moneyed Hubbard clan lives in, and poisons, their part of the Deep South at the turn of the twentieth century.

Name: City of God
One-line: In the slums of Rio, two kids' paths diverge as one struggles to become a photographer and the other a kingpin.

Name: Mouchette
One-line: A young girl living in the French countryside suffers constant indignities at the hand of alcoholism and her fellow man.

Name: Germany Year Zero
One-line: A young German boy faces the problems of the tough life in the immediate post-WWII Berlin.

Name: The Adventures of Prince Achmed
One-line: A handsome prince rides a flying horse to faraway lands and embarks on magical adventures, which include befriending a witch, meeting Aladdin, battling demons and falling in love with a princess.

Name: Crumb
One-line: An intimate portrait of controversial cartoonist Robert Crumb and his traumatized family.

Name: The Strawberry Blonde
One-line: Quick-tempered yet likable Biff Grimes falls for the beautiful Virginia Brush, but he is not the only young man in the neighborhood who is smitten with her.

Name: My Dinner with Andre
One-line: Two old friends meet for dinner; as one tells anecdotes detailing his experiences, the other notices their differing worldviews.

Name: Grey Gardens
Actors: ['Albert Maysles', 'David Maysles', 'Muffie Meyer', 'Edith Bouvier Beale', "Edith 'Little Edie' Bouvier Beale", 'Brooks Hyers']
One-line: Meet a mother and daughter, high-society dropouts, reclusive cousins of Jackie O., managing to thrive together amid the decay and disorder of their East Hampton, NY, mansion, making for an eerily ramshackle echo of the American Camelot.

Name: Blue Velvet
One-line: The discovery of a severed human ear found in a field leads a young man on an investigation related to a beautiful, mysterious nightclub singer and a group of psychopathic criminals who have kidnapped her child.

Name: The Cremator
One-line: Set in Central Europe during World War II, a demented cremator believes cremation relieves earthly suffering and sets out to save the world.

Name: A Separation
One-line: A married couple are faced with a difficult decision - to improve the life of their child by moving to another country or to stay in Iran and look after a deteriorating parent who has Alzheimer's disease.

Name: Dirty Harry
One-line: When a man calling himself "the Scorpio Killer" menaces San Francisco, tough-as-nails Police Inspector "Dirty" Harry Callahan is assigned to track down the crazed psychopath.

Name: La haine
One-line: 24 hours in the lives of three young men in the French suburbs the day after a violent riot.

Name: Our Hospitality
One-line: A man returns to his Appalachian homestead. On the trip, he falls for a young woman. The only problem is her family has vowed to kill every member of his family.

Name: Pixote
Actors: ['Fernando Ramos da Silva', 'Jorge Julião', 'Gilberto Moura', 'Edilson Lino']
One-line: The life of a boy on the streets of Sao Paulo, involved with crimes, prostitution, and drugs.

Name: My Left Foot
One-line: Christy Brown, born with cerebral palsy, learns to paint and write with his only controllable limb - his left foot.

Name: Two-Lane Blacktop
One-line: While drag-racing through the American Southwest in a Chevrolet 150, a driver and his mechanic cross paths with an enigmatic hitchhiker and the tall tale-spinning driver of a GTO.

Name: Vampyr
One-line: A drifter obsessed with the supernatural stumbles upon an inn where a severely ill adolescent girl is slowly becoming a vampire.

Name: The Silence
One-line: Two estranged sisters, Ester and Anna, and Anna's 10-year-old son travel to the Central European country on the verge of war. Ester becomes seriously ill and the three of them move into a hotel in a small town called Timoka.

Name: Le Bonheur
One-line: François, a young carpenter, lives a happy, uncomplicated life with his wife Thérèse and their two small children. One day he meets Emilie, a clerk in the local post office.

Name: The Phantom Carriage
One-line: On New Year's Eve, the driver of a ghostly carriage forces a drunken man to reflect on his selfish, wasted life.

Name: The Cloud-Capped Star
One-line: A selfless young woman (Supriya Choudhury) sacrifices her own happiness for her unappreciative family.

Name: Bob the Gambler
One-line: After losing big, an aging gambler decides to assemble a team to rob a casino.

Name: Die Nibelungen: Kriemhild's Revenge
One-line: Princess Kriemhild vows to avenge her husband's murder but must overcome her brothers who swore allegiance to Hagen. She marries Etzel, King of the Huns, and persuades his army to attack Hagen, but she loses more than she bargained for.

Name: The Burmese Harp
One-line: A conscience-driven Japanese soldier traumatized by the events of WWII adopts the lifestyle of a Buddhist monk.

Name: The Manchurian Candidate
One-line: An American POW in the Korean War is brainwashed as an unwitting assassin for an international Communist conspiracy.

Name: Godzilla
One-line: American nuclear weapons testing results in the creation of a seemingly unstoppable dinosaur-like beast.

Name: Suspiria
One-line: An American newcomer to a prestigious German ballet academy comes to realize that the school is a front for something sinister amid a series of grisly murders.

Name: Desire
One-line: An automotive engineer bound for a holiday in Spain meets a sultry jewel thief.

Name: The Informer
One-line: In 1922, an Irish rebel informs on his friend, then feels doom closing in.

Name: Red Desert
One-line: In an industrial area, unstable Giuliana attempts to cope with life by starting an affair with a co-worker at the plant her husband manages.

Name: Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind
One-line: Warrior and pacifist Princess Nausicaä desperately struggles to prevent two warring nations from destroying themselves and their dying planet.

Name: Faces
One-line: A middle-aged man leaves his wife for another woman. Shortly after, his ex-wife also begins a relationship with a younger partner. The film follows their struggles to find love amongst each other.

Name: Amour
One-line: Georges and Anne are an octogenarian couple. They are cultivated, retired music teachers. Their daughter, also a musician, lives in Britain with her family. One day, Anne has a stroke, and the couple's bond of love is severely tested.

Name: Beauty and the Beast
One-line: A prince cursed to spend his days as a hideous monster sets out to regain his humanity by earning a young woman's love.

Name: They Shoot Horses, Don't They?
One-line: The lives of a disparate group of contestants intertwine in an inhumanely grueling dance marathon.

Name: The King of Comedy
One-line: A passionate yet unsuccessful comedian stalks and kidnaps his idol to take the spotlight for himself.

Name: Atlantic City
One-line: In a corrupt city, a small-time gangster and the estranged wife of a pot dealer find themselves thrown together in an escapade of love, money, drugs and danger.

Name: Young Frankenstein
One-line: An American grandson of the infamous scientist, struggling to prove that his grandfather was not as insane as people believe, is invited to Transylvania, where he discovers the process that reanimates a dead body.

Name: The Holy Mountain
One-line: In a corrupt, greed-fueled world, a powerful alchemist leads a messianic character and seven materialistic figures to the Holy Mountain, where they hope to achieve enlightenment.

Name: Love and Death
One-line: In czarist Russia, a neurotic soldier and his distant cousin formulate a plot to assassinate Napoleon.

Name: Picnic at Hanging Rock
One-line: During a rural summer picnic, a few students and a teacher from an Australian girls' school vanish without a trace. Their absence frustrates and haunts the people left behind.

Name: La Terra Trema
One-line: In rural Sicily, the fishermen live at the mercy of the greedy wholesalers. One family risks everything to buy their own boat and operate independently.

Name: The Sacrifice
One-line: At the dawn of World War III, a man searches for a way to restore peace to the world and finds he must give something in return.

Name: Pan's Labyrinth
One-line: In the Falangist Spain of 1944, the bookish young stepdaughter of a sadistic army officer escapes into an eerie but captivating fantasy world.

Name: The Life of Oharu
One-line: Follows a woman's fight and survival amid the vicissitudes of life and the cruelty of society.

Name: All About My Mother
One-line: A comedy-drama about a bereaved mother, and overwrought actress, her jealous lover, and a pregnant nun.

Name: Richard III
One-line: Shakespeare's powerful tale of the wicked deformed King and his conquests, both on the battlefield and in the boudoir.

Name: Mikey and Nicky
One-line: Nicky is on the run from the mob, and he turns to old pal Mikey for help.

Name: The New Land
One-line: A Swedish immigrant family struggle to establish a new life for themselves in the forest of Minnesota in the mid 19th Century.

Name: Wings of Desire
One-line: An angel tires of his purely ethereal life of merely overseeing the human activity of Berlin's residents, and longs for the tangible joys of physical existence when he falls in love with a mortal.

Name: Remember the Night
One-line: Love blooms between a sympathetic attorney and the comely shoplifter he has taken home for the Christmas holiday.

Name: Mulholland Drive
One-line: After a car wreck on Mulholland Drive renders a woman amnesiac, she and a Hollywood-hopeful search for clues and answers across Los Angeles in a twisting venture beyond dreams and reality.

Name: Streetwise
One-line: Gritty documentary that looks at the lives of teenagers living on the streets of Seattle.

Name: Ruggles of Red Gap
One-line: An English valet brought to the American west assimilates into the American way of life.

Name: The Departed
One-line: An undercover cop and a mole in the police attempt to identify each other while infiltrating an Irish gang in South Boston.

Name: The Wild Child
One-line: In a French forest in 1798, a child is found who cannot walk, speak, read or write. A doctor becomes interested in the child and patiently attempts to civilize him.

Name: Missing
One-line: When an idealistic American writer disappears during the Chilean coup d'état in September 1973, his wife and father try to find him.

Name: The Postman Always Rings Twice
One-line: A married woman and a drifter fall in love and then plot to murder her husband.

Name: White Heat
One-line: A psychopathic criminal with a mother complex makes a daring break from prison and leads his old gang in a chemical plant payroll heist.

Name: Hold Back the Dawn
One-line: Stopped in Mexico by U.S. Immigration, Georges Iscovescu hopes to get into the country by marrying a citizen.

Name: Footlight Parade
One-line: Chester Kent struggles against time, romance, and a rival's spy to produce spectacular live "prologues" for movie houses.

Name: The Big Heat
One-line: Tough cop Dave Bannion takes on a politically powerful crime syndicate.

Name: 3 Women
One-line: Two roommates/physical therapists, one a vain woman and the other an awkward teenager, share an increasingly bizarre relationship.

Name: Black Girl
Actors: ['Mbissine Thérèse Diop', 'Anne-Marie Jelinek', 'Robert Fontaine', 'Momar Nar Sene']
One-line: A black girl from Senegal becomes a servant in France.

Name: Animal Crackers
One-line: Mayhem and zaniness ensue when a valuable painting goes missing during a party in honor of famed African explorer Captain Spaulding.

Name: The Snake Pit
One-line: A detailed chronicle of a woman during her stay in a mental institution.

Name: Satantango
One-line: On the eve of a large payment, residents of a collapsing collective farm see their plans turn into desolation when they discover that Irimiás, a former co-worker who they thought was dead, is returning to the community.

Name: The Face of Another
One-line: A businessman with a disfigured face obtains a lifelike mask from his doctor, but the mask starts altering his personality.

Name: Taste of Cherry
Actors: ['Homayoun Ershadi', 'Abdolhosein Bagheri', 'Afshin Khorshid Bakhtiari', 'Safar Ali Moradi']
One-line: An Iranian man drives his car in search of someone who will quietly bury him under a cherry tree after he commits suicide.

Name: Closely Watched Trains
One-line: An apprentice train dispatcher at a village station seeks his first sexual encounter and becomes despondent when he is unable to perform.

Name: The Longest Day
Actors: ['Andrew Marton', 'Gerd Oswald', 'Bernhard Wicki', 'Darryl F. Zanuck', 'John Wayne', 'Robert Ryan', 'Richard Burton', 'Henry Fonda']
One-line: The events of D-Day, told on a grand scale from both the Allied and German points of view.

Name: Monsieur Verdoux
One-line: A suave but cynical man supports his family by marrying and murdering rich women for their money, but the job has some occupational hazards.

Name: Salesman
Actors: ['David Maysles', 'Charlotte Zwerin', 'Paul Brennan', 'Charles McDevitt', 'James Baker', 'Raymond Martos']
One-line: Four dogged door-to-door Bible salesmen travel from Boston to Florida on a seemingly futile quest to sell luxury editions of the Good Book to working-class Catholics.

Name: The Big Parade
Actors: ['George W. Hill', 'John Gilbert', 'Renée Adorée', 'Hobart Bosworth', 'Claire McDowell']
One-line: A young American soldier witnesses the horrors of the Great War.

Name: Nostalghia
One-line: A Russian poet and his interpreter travel to Italy researching the life of an 18th-century composer, and instead meet a ruminative madman who tells the poet how the world may be saved.

Name: Seven Chances
One-line: A man learns that he will inherit a fortune if he marries by 7PM that evening.

Name: The Defiant Ones
One-line: Two chained-together escaped convicts, White and Black, must learn to get along in order to elude capture.

Name: Reservoir Dogs
One-line: When a simple jewelry heist goes horribly wrong, the surviving criminals begin to suspect that one of them is a police informant.

Name: Blow Out
One-line: A movie sound recordist accidentally records the evidence that proves that a car accident was actually murder and consequently finds himself in danger.

Name: The Decline of Western Civilization
One-line: A look into the Los Angeles punk rock scene, that was largely ignored by the rock music press of the time.

Name: A Story from Chikamatsu
One-line: Ishun is a wealthy but unsympathetic master printer who has wrongly accused his wife and best employee of being lovers. To escape punishment, the accused run away together, but Ishun is certain to be ruined if word gets out.

Name: Killers of the Flower Moon
One-line: When oil is discovered in 1920s Oklahoma under Osage Nation land, the Osage people are murdered one by one - until the FBI steps in to unravel the mystery.

Name: Oliver!
One-line: After being sold to a mortician, young orphan Oliver Twist runs away and meets a group of boys trained to be pickpockets by an elderly mentor in 1830s London.

Name: Marketa Lazarová
One-line: A grim portrayal of the shift from Paganism to Christianity in medieval central Europe - as a young virgin promised to God is kidnapped and raped by a marauder who her religious father seeks to kill in return.

Name: The Marriage of Maria Braun
One-line: Maria marries Hermann Braun in the last days of World War II, only for him to go missing in the war. Alone, Maria puts to use her beauty and ambition in order to find prosperity during Germany's "economic miracle" of the 1950s.

Name: Thelma & Louise
One-line: Two best friends set out on an adventure, but it soon turns around to a terrifying escape from being hunted by the police, as these two women escape for the crimes they committed.

Name: Random Harvest
One-line: An amnesiac World War I veteran falls in love with a music hall star, only to suffer an accident which restores his original memories but erases his post-war life.

Name: The Hill
One-line: In a North African military prison during World War II, five new prisoners struggle to survive in the face of brutal punishment and sadistic guards.

Name: Stroszek
One-line: In Berlin, an alcoholic man, recently released from prison, joins his elderly friend and a prostitute in a determined dream to leave Germany and seek a better life in Wisconsin.

Name: Life of Brian
One-line: Born on the original Christmas in the stable next door to Jesus Christ, Brian of Nazareth spends his life being mistaken for a messiah.

Name: Ivan the Terrible, Part II: The Boyars' Plot
One-line: As Ivan the Terrible attempts to consolidate his power by establishing a personal army, his political rivals, the Russian boyars, plot to assassinate their Tsar.

Name: Sanjuro
One-line: A crafty samurai helps a young man and his fellow clansmen trying to save his uncle, who has been framed and imprisoned by a corrupt superintendent.

Name: Magnolia
One-line: An epic mosaic of interrelated characters in search of love, forgiveness and meaning in the San Fernando Valley.

Name: The Hero
One-line: En route to Delhi to receive an award, a Bengali film star reevaluates his success through his fellow passengers, dreams, and past experiences.

Name: The Magician
One-line: A traveling magician and his assistants are persecuted by authorities in Sweden of the 19th century. Their capture, however, didn't bring victory to those in power.

Name: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind
One-line: When their relationship turns sour, a couple undergoes a medical procedure to have each other erased from their memories for ever.

Name: The Great War
One-line: The Italian Army fought against the Austrians during World War I.

Name: Stand by Me
One-line: A writer recounts a childhood journey with his friends to find the body of a missing boy.

Name: The Terminator
One-line: A human soldier is sent from 2029 to 1984 to stop an almost indestructible cyborg killing machine, sent from the same year, which has been programmed to execute a young woman whose unborn son is the key to humanity's future salvation.

Name: A Letter to Three Wives
One-line: A letter is addressed to three wives from their "best friend" Addie Ross, announcing that she is running away with one of their husbands - but she does not say which one.

Name: Scarface
One-line: In 1980 Miami, a determined Cuban immigrant takes over a drug cartel and succumbs to greed.

Name: Shadows of Forgotten Ancestors
One-line: A timeless Carpathian story - the young Ivan falls in love with the daughter of his father's killer among the Hutsul people of Ukraine.

Name: Elevator to the Gallows
One-line: A self-assured businessman murders his employer, the husband of his mistress, which unintentionally provokes an ill-fated chain of events.

Name: Parasite
One-line: Greed and class discrimination threaten the newly formed symbiotic relationship between the wealthy Park family and the destitute Kim clan.

Name: The Fire Within
One-line: Depressed Alain Leroy leaves the clinic where he was detoxified. He meets friends, acquaintances and women, trying to find a reason to continue living. Will this help him?

Name: A Night at the Opera
One-line: A sly business manager and the wacky friends of two opera singers in Italy help them achieve success in America while humiliating their stuffy and snobbish enemies.

Name: Dodsworth
One-line: A retired auto manufacturer and his wife take a long-planned European vacation only to find that they want very different things from life.

Name: Hamlet
One-line: After the death of the King of Denmark - Hamlet's father - his brother Claudius ascends the throne, who takes his widow Gertrude as his wife. Hamlet meets the ghost of his father and learns that he was killed by Claudius.

Name: Onibaba
One-line: Two women kill samurai and sell their belongings for a living. While one of them is having an affair with their neighbor, the other woman meets a mysterious samurai wearing a bizarre mask.

Name: Brute Force
One-line: At a tough penitentiary, prisoner Joe Collins plans to rebel against Captain Munsey, the power-mad chief guard.

Name: The Last Emperor
One-line: Bernardo Bertolucci's Oscar-winning dramatisation of the life story of China's last emperor, Pu Yi.

Name: Port of Shadows
One-line: A military deserter finds love and trouble (and a small dog) in a foggy, French port city.

Name: The Sorrow and the Pity
One-line: An in-depth exploration of the various reactions by the French people to the Vichy government's acceptance of the German invasion.

Name: The Executioner
Actors: ['Nino Manfredi', 'Emma Penella', 'José Isbert', 'José Luis López Vázquez']
One-line: An undertaker marries an old executioner's daughter and must continue his father-in-law's profession after his retirement, although he doesn't like it.

Name: El
Actors: ['Arturo de Córdova', 'Delia Garcés', 'Aurora Walker', 'Carlos Martínez Baena']
One-line: A husband's suave exterior unravels after his marriage, and he unleashes his paranoid and volatile temper on his wife, which escalates to more dangerous and unpredictable tantrums.

Name: Lola
One-line: A bored young man meets with his former girlfriend, now a cabaret dancer and single mother, and soon finds himself falling back in love with her.

Name: Drive My Car
One-line: A renowned stage actor and director learns to cope with a big personal loss when he receives an offer to direct a production of Uncle Vanya in Hiroshima.

Name: Sabotage
One-line: A Scotland Yard undercover detective is on the trail of a saboteur who is part of a plot to set off a bomb in London. But when the detective's cover is blown, the plot begins to unravel.

Name: Dr. Mabuse, the Gambler
One-line: Arch-criminal Dr. Mabuse sets out to make a fortune and run Berlin. Detective Wenk sets out to stop him.

Name: Fat City
One-line: Two men, working as professional boxers, come to blows when their careers each begin to take different directions.

Name: Terms of Endearment
One-line: Follows hard-to-please Aurora looking for love and her daughter's family problems.

Name: Diary of a Lost Girl
One-line: After falling pregnant by a pharmacist and refusing to marry, a young woman is ejected from her home and sent to a strict girls' reform school.

Name: Cinderella
Actors: ['Wilfred Jackson', 'Hamilton Luske', 'Ilene Woods', 'James MacDonald', 'Eleanor Audley', 'Verna Felton']
One-line: When Cinderella's cruel stepmother prevents her from attending the Royal Ball, she gets some unexpected help from the lovable mice Gus and Jaq and from her Fairy Godmother.

Name: Carrie
One-line: Carrie White, a shy, friendless teenage girl who is sheltered by her domineering, religious mother, unleashes her telekinetic powers after being humiliated by her classmates at her senior prom.

Name: Dances with Wolves
One-line: Lieutenant John Dunbar, assigned to a remote western Civil War outpost, finds himself engaging with a neighbouring Sioux settlement, causing him to question his own purpose.

Name: Vagabond
One-line: A young woman's body is found frozen in a ditch. Through flashbacks and interviews, we see the events that led to her inevitable death.

Name: Breakfast at Tiffany's
One-line: A young New York socialite becomes interested in a young man who has moved into her apartment building, but her past threatens to get in the way.

Name: The Lives of Others
One-line: In 1984 East Berlin, an agent of the secret police, conducting surveillance on a writer and his lover, finds himself becoming increasingly absorbed by their lives.

Name: Shadows
One-line: Cassavetes' jazz-scored improvisational film explores interracial friendships and relationships in Beat-Era (1950s) New York City.

Name: The Lion in Winter
One-line: 1183 A.D.: King Henry II's three sons all want to inherit the throne, but he won't commit to a choice. When he allows his imprisoned wife Eleanor of Aquitaine out for a Christmas visit, they all variously plot to force him into a decision.

Name: The Enigma of Kaspar Hauser
One-line: A young man named Kaspar Hauser suddenly appears in Nuremberg in 1828, barely able to talk or walk, and bearing a strange note.

Name: Kanal
One-line: In 1944, during the Warsaw uprising against the Nazis, Polish Lieutenant Zadra and his resistance fighters use Warsaw's sewer system to escape the German encirclement.

Name: Chungking Express
One-line: Two melancholic Hong Kong policemen fall in love: one with a mysterious female underworld figure, the other with a beautiful and ethereal waitress at a late-night restaurant he frequents.

Name: The Killing Fields
One-line: A journalist is trapped in Cambodia during tyrant Pol Pot's bloody 'Year Zero' cleansing campaign, which claimed the lives of two million 'undesirable' civilians.

Name: Se7en
One-line: Two detectives, a rookie and a veteran, hunt a serial killer who uses the seven deadly sins as his motives.

Name: When a Woman Ascends the Stairs
One-line: A middle-aged bar hostess, constantly in debt, is faced with numerous social constraints and challenges posed to her by her family, customers and friends.

Name: The Bad Sleep Well
One-line: A vengeful young man marries the daughter of a corrupt industrialist in order to seek justice for his father's suicide.

Name: Dracula
One-line: Transylvanian vampire Count Dracula bends a naive real estate agent to his will, then takes up residence at a London estate where he sleeps in his coffin by day and searches for potential victims by night.

Name: National Velvet
One-line: A jaded former jockey helps a young girl prepare a wild but gifted horse for England's Grand National Sweepstakes.

Name: Maratonci trce pocasni krug
One-line: The Topalovic family has been in the burial business for generations. When the old (150 yrs old) Pantelija dies, five generations of his heirs start to fight for the inheritance.

Name: 3:10 to Yuma
One-line: Broke small-time rancher Dan Evans is hired by the stagecoach line to put big-time captured outlaw leader Ben Wade on the 3:10 train to Yuma but Wade's gang tries to free him.

Name: Grand Hotel
One-line: A group of very different individuals staying at a luxurious hotel in Berlin deal with each of their respective dramas.

Name: M*A*S*H
One-line: The staff of a Korean War field hospital use humor and high jinks to keep their sanity in the face of the horror of war.

Name: Floating Weeds
One-line: The head of a Japanese theatre troupe returns to a small coastal town where he left a son who thinks he is his uncle, and tries to make up for the lost time, but his current mistress grows jealous.

Name: If....
One-line: In this allegorical story, a revolution led by pupil Mick Travis takes place at an old established private school in England.

Name: Heat
One-line: A group of high-end professional thieves start to feel the heat from the LAPD when they unknowingly leave a verbal clue at their latest heist.

Name: Daisies
One-line: After realizing that all world is spoiled, Marie and Marie are committed to be spoiled themselves. They rip off older men, feast in lavish meals and do all kinds of mischief. But what is all this leading to?

Name: Coal Miner's Daughter
One-line: The fictionalized life of singer Loretta Lynn, a girl who rose from humble beginnings to become a country music star in the 1960s/70s.

Name: Gladiator
One-line: A former Roman General sets out to exact vengeance against the corrupt emperor who murdered his family and sent him into slavery.

Name: Where Is the Friend's House?
Actors: ['Babek Ahmed Poor', 'Ahmed Ahmed Poor', 'Khodabakhsh Defaei', 'Iran Outari']
One-line: Eight-year-old Ahmed has mistakenly taken his friend Mohammad's notebook. He wants to return it, or else his friend will be expelled from school. The boy determinedly sets out to find Mohammad's home in the neighbouring village.

Name: 4 Months, 3 Weeks and 2 Days
One-line: A woman assists her friend in arranging an illegal abortion in 1980s Romania.

Name: Princess Mononoke
One-line: On a journey to find the cure for a Tatarigami's curse, Ashitaka finds himself in the middle of a war between the forest gods and Tatara, a mining colony. In this quest he also meets San, the Mononoke Hime.

Name: JFK
One-line: New Orleans District Attorney Jim Garrison discovers there's more to the Kennedy assassination than the official story.

Name: One, Two, Three
One-line: In West Berlin during the Cold War, a Coca-Cola executive is given the task of taking care of his boss' socialite daughter.

Name: Waterloo Bridge
One-line: Myra and Roy meet and fall in love on Waterloo Bridge during an air raid. Their love will be one of the war's unspoken casualties.

Name: Winter Light
One-line: A small-town priest struggles with his faith.

Name: All the King's Men
One-line: The rise and fall of a corrupt politician, who makes his friends richer and retains power by dint of a populist appeal.

Name: Earth
One-line: In the peaceful countryside, Vassily opposes the rich kulaks over the coming of collective farming.

Name: Fury
One-line: When a wrongly-accused prisoner barely survives a lynch-mob attack and is presumed dead, he vindictively decides to fake his death and frame the mob for his supposed murder.

Name: Mephisto
One-line: In early-1930s Germany, a passionate stage actor faces a dilemma: renounce his apolitical stance and comply with the Reich's doctrine, or face oblivion. But, Faustian bargains never end well. What is the price of success?

Name: Tess
One-line: A strong-willed young peasant girl attracts the affection of two men.

Name: The River
One-line: The growing pains of three young women contrast with the immutability of the holy Bengal River, around which their daily lives unfold.

Name: Gigi
One-line: Weary of the conventions of Parisian society, a rich playboy and a youthful courtesan-in-training enjoy a platonic friendship which may not stay platonic for long.

Name: Fiddler on the Roof
One-line: In pre-revolutionary Russia, a Jewish peasant with traditional values contends with marrying off three of his daughters with modern romantic ideals while growing anti-Semitic sentiment threatens his village.

Name: News from Home
One-line: Impersonal and beautiful images of Akerman's life in New York are combined with letters from her loving but manipulative mother, read by Akerman herself.

Name: The Day of the Jackal
One-line: In the aftermath of France allowing Algeria's independence, a group of resentful military veterans hire a professional assassin codenamed "Jackal" to kill President Charles de Gaulle.

Name: The Wrong Man
One-line: In 1953, an innocent man named Christopher Emanuel "Manny" Balestrero is arrested after being mistaken for an armed robber.

Name: A Tree Grows in Brooklyn
One-line: Encouraged by her idealistic if luckless father, a bright and imaginative young woman comes of age in a Brooklyn tenement during the early 1900s.

Name: Manila in the Claws of Light
One-line: Júlio Madiaga, a 'provinciano', arrives in Manila to search for his beloved, Ligaya.

Name: One Hundred and One Dalmatians
Actors: ['Hamilton Luske', 'Wolfgang Reitherman', 'Rod Taylor', 'Betty Lou Gerson', "J. Pat O'Malley", 'Martha Wentworth']
One-line: When a litter of Dalmatian puppies are abducted by the minions of Cruella De Vil, the owners must find them before she uses them for a diabolical fashion statement.

Name: Detective Story
One-line: On one day in the 21st Precinct squad room, assorted characters form a backdrop for the troubles of hard-nosed Detective Jim McLeod.

Name: A City of Sadness
One-line: The story of a family embroiled in the "White Terror" that was wrought on the Taiwanese people by the Kuomintang government after their arrival from mainland China in the late 1940s.

Name: Sundays and Cybèle
One-line: Story of a lonely young girl who is befriended by an innocent but emotionally disabled veteran of the French Indochina War.

Name: The Last Command
One-line: A former Imperial Russian general and cousin of the Czar ends up in Hollywood as an extra in a movie directed by a former revolutionary.

Name: Good Will Hunting
One-line: Will Hunting, a janitor at M.I.T., has a gift for mathematics, but needs help from a psychologist to find direction in his life.

Name: Wait Until Dark
One-line: A recently blinded woman is terrorized by a trio of thugs while they search for a heroin-stuffed doll they believe is in her apartment.

Name: Gertrud
One-line: In the elegant world of artists and musicians, Gertrud ends her marriage to Gustav and takes a lover, the composer Erland Jansson.

Name: The Easy Life
One-line: An impulsive braggart takes a shy law student with him for a two-day road trip from Rome to Tuscany.

Name: The Man Who Sleeps
One-line: A 25-year-old male student in Paris becomes indifferent to the world around him, and subsequently feels a strong sense of alienation and hopelessness.

Name: Before Sunset
One-line: Nine years after Jesse and Celine first met, they encounter each other again on the French leg of Jesse's book tour.

Name: Opening Night
One-line: A renowned actress teeters on the edge of a breakdown as she counts down the days toward a big Broadway opening.

Name: Beau Travail
One-line: An ex-Foreign Legion officer recalls his once-glorious life of leading troops in Djibouti.

Name: Fires on the Plain
One-line: In the closing days of WWII, remnants of the Japanese army in Leyte are abandoned by their command and face certain death by starvation.

Name: Twenty-Four Eyes
One-line: Schoolteacher Hisako Oishi forms an emotional bond with her pupils and teaches them various virtues, while at the same time worrying about their future.

Name: Vengeance Is Mine
One-line: Chronological exploits of Iwao Enokizu, a murderous thief on the run.

Name: Demons
One-line: After being robbed by a geisha, a ronin warrior carves a bloody path to seek revenge.

Name: Deliverance
One-line: Intent on seeing the Cahulawassee River before it's dammed and turned into a lake, outdoor fanatic Lewis Medlock takes his friends on a canoeing trip they'll never forget into the dangerous American back-country.

Name: America America
One-line: A young Greek stops at nothing to secure a passage to America.

Name: Braveheart
One-line: Scottish warrior William Wallace leads his countrymen in a rebellion to free his homeland from the tyranny of King Edward I of England.

Name: The Celebration
One-line: At Helge's 60th birthday party, some unpleasant family truths are revealed.

Name: The English Patient
One-line: At the close of World War II, a young nurse tends to a badly burned plane crash victim. His past is shown in flashbacks, revealing an involvement in a fateful love affair.

Name: Alice in the Cities
One-line: A German journalist is saddled with a nine-year-old girl after encountering her mother at a New York airport.

Name: The Bridge
One-line: In 1945, Germany is being overrun, and nobody is left to fight but teenagers.

Name: The Thin Red Line
One-line: Adaptation of James Jones' autobiographical 1962 novel, focusing on the conflict at Guadalcanal during the second World War.

Name: Strike
One-line: A group of oppressed factory workers go on strike in pre-revolutionary Russia.

Name: The Best of Youth
One-line: An Italian epic that follows the lives of two brothers from the 1960s to the 2000s.

Name: Serpico
One-line: An honest New York cop named Frank Serpico blows the whistle on rampant corruption in the force only to have his comrades turn against him.

Name: Pygmalion
One-line: A phonetics and diction expert makes a bet that he can teach a cockney flower girl to speak proper English and pass as a lady in high society.

Name: A Canterbury Tale
One-line: Three modern-day pilgrims investigate a bizarre crime in a small town while on their way to Canterbury.

Name: Boogie Nights
One-line: Back when sex was safe, pleasure was a business and business was booming, an idealistic porn producer aspires to elevate his craft to an art when he discovers a hot young talent.

Name: Gentleman's Agreement
One-line: A reporter pretends to be Jewish in order to cover a story on anti-Semitism, and personally discovers the true depths of bigotry and hatred.

Name: Naked
One-line: An unemployed Mancunian vents his rage on unsuspecting strangers as he embarks on a nocturnal London odyssey.

Name: Diabolique
One-line: The wife and mistress of a loathed school principal plan to murder him with what they believe is the perfect alibi.

Name: The Bitter Tears of Petra von Kant
One-line: A troubled fashion designer starts a relationship with a much younger woman.

Name: Zulu
One-line: Outnumbered British soldiers do battle with Zulu warriors at Rorke's Drift.

Name: Balkan Spy
One-line: Convinced that his subtenant is a spy and an enemy of the state, a man falls into deep paranoia which leads to absurd and destructive chain of events.

Name: Late Autumn
One-line: A widow tries to marry off her daughter with the help of her late husband's three friends.

Name: Blue Collar
One-line: When three automotive factory workers who're struggling financially try to steal from their own labor union, they discover corruption, and reluctantly decide to use this information for blackmail.

Name: Million Dollar Baby
One-line: Frankie, an ill-tempered old coach, reluctantly agrees to train aspiring boxer Maggie. Impressed with her determination and talent, he helps her become the best and the two soon form a close bond.

Name: The Naked City
One-line: A step-by-step look at a murder investigation on the streets of New York.

Name: Divorce Italian Style
One-line: A married Sicilian baron falls in love with his cousin and vows to wed her, but with divorce illegal he must concoct a crime of passion to do away with his wife.

Name: To Catch a Thief
One-line: A retired jewel thief sets out to prove his innocence after being suspected of returning to his former occupation.

Name: Before Sunrise
One-line: A young man and woman meet on a train in Europe, and wind up spending one evening together in Vienna. Unfortunately, both know that this will probably be their only night together.

Name: Billy Liar
One-line: A lazy, irresponsible young clerk (Sir Tom Courtenay) in provincial Northern England lives in his own fantasy world and makes emotionally immature decisions as he alienates friends and family.

Name: City Girl
One-line: A Chicago waitress falls in love with a Minnesota farmer, and decides to face a life in the country.

Name: Monsieur Hulot's Holiday
One-line: Monsieur Hulot comes to a beachside hotel for a vacation and accidentally, but good-naturedly, causes havoc.

Name: The Dark Knight
One-line: When the menace known as the Joker wreaks havoc and chaos on the people of Gotham, Batman must accept one of the greatest psychological and physical tests of his ability to fight injustice.

Name: The Odd Couple
One-line: A New Yorker newly separated from his wife moves in with his best friend, a divorced sportswriter, but their ideas of housekeeping and lifestyles are as different as night and day.

Name: The More the Merrier
One-line: During the World War II housing shortage in Washington, two men and a woman share a single apartment and the older man plays Cupid to the other two.

Name: Birdman of Alcatraz
One-line: A surly convicted murderer held in permanent isolation redeems himself when he becomes a renowned bird expert.

Name: The Roaring Twenties
One-line: Three men attempt to make a living in Prohibitionist America after returning home from fighting together in World War I.

Name: Medium Cool
One-line: A TV news reporter finds himself becoming personally involved in the violence that erupts around the 1968 Democratic National Convention.

Name: The Lusty Men
One-line: Retired rodeo champion Jeff McCloud agrees to mentor novice rodeo contestant Wes Merritt against the wishes of Merritt's wife who fears the dangers of this rough sport.

Name: Hellzapoppin'
One-line: Olsen and Johnson, a pair of stage comedians, try to turn their play into a movie and bring together a young couple in love, while breaking the fourth wall every step of the way.

Name: Goodbye, Mr. Chips
One-line: An aged teacher and former headmaster of a boarding school recalls his career and his personal life over the decades.

Name: Monkey Business
One-line: On a transatlantic crossing, The Marx Brothers get up to their usual antics and manage to annoy just about everyone on board the ship.

Name: The Sword of Doom
One-line: Through his unconscionable actions against others, a sociopath samurai builds a trail of vendettas that follow him closely.
