Name: The Palm Beach Story
One-line: A New York inventor needs cash to develop his big idea, so his adoring wife decides to raise it by divorcing him and marrying an eccentric Florida millionaire with a capricious high-society sister.

Name: Holiday
One-line: A young man in love with a girl from a rich family finds his unorthodox plan to go on holiday for the early years of his life met with skepticism by everyone except for his fiancée's eccentric sister and long-suffering brother.

Name: Wuthering Heights
One-line: A servant in the house of Wuthering Heights tells a traveler the unfortunate tale of lovers Cathy and Heathcliff.

Name: Harvey
One-line: Due to his insistence that he has an invisible six foot-tall rabbit for a best friend, a whimsical middle-aged man is thought by his family to be insane - but he may be wiser than anyone knows.

Name: Possession
One-line: A woman starts exhibiting increasingly disturbing behavior after asking her husband for a divorce. Suspicions of infidelity soon give way to something much more sinister.

Name: The Fugitive
One-line: Dr. Richard Kimble, unjustly accused of murdering his wife, must find the real killer while being the target of a nationwide manhunt led by a seasoned U.S. Marshal.

Name: Nightmare Alley
One-line: The rise and fall of Stanton Carlisle, a mentalist whose lies and deceit prove to be his downfall.

Name: The Ballad of Narayama
One-line: A kabuki theatre-inflected story about a poor village whose people have to be carried to a nearby mountain to die once they get old.

Name: Lady Snowblood
One-line: A strikingly beautiful young woman is trained from birth to be a deadly instrument of revenge against the swindlers who destroyed her family.

Name: 12 Years a Slave
One-line: In the antebellum United States, Solomon Northup, a free Black man from upstate New York, is abducted and sold into slavery.

Name: Chariots of Fire
One-line: Two British track athletes, one a determined Jew and the other a devout Christian, are driven to win in the 1924 Olympics as they wrestle with issues of pride and conscience.

Name: I Know Where I'm Going!
One-line: A young Englishwoman goes to the Hebrides to marry her older, wealthier fiancé. When the weather keeps them separated on different islands, she begins to have second thoughts.

Name: Bring Me the Head of Alfredo Garcia
One-line: An American barroom pianist and his prostitute girlfriend go on a trip through the Mexican underworld to collect the bounty on the head of a dead gigolo.

Name: After Life
One-line: After death, people have a week to choose only one memory to keep for eternity.

Name: Hearts of Darkness: A Filmmaker's Apocalypse
Actors: ['George Hickenlooper', 'Eleanor Coppola', 'Dennis Hopper', 'Martin Sheen', 'Marlon Brando', 'George Lucas']
One-line: Documentary that chronicles how Francis Ford Coppola's Apocalypse Now (1979) was plagued by extraordinary script, shooting, budget, and casting problems--nearly destroying the life and career of the celebrated director.

Name: Imitation of Life
One-line: A struggling widow and her daughter take in a Black housekeeper and her fair-skinned daughter; the two women start a successful business but face familial, identity, and racial issues along the way.

Name: Oppenheimer
One-line: The story of American scientist J. Robert Oppenheimer and his role in the development of the atomic bomb.

Name: Pale Flower
One-line: A gangster gets released from prison and has to cope with the recent shifts of power between the gangs, while taking care of a thrill-seeking young woman, who got in bad company while gambling.

Name: Pride and Prejudice
One-line: The arrival of wealthy bachelors in town causes an uproar when families with single daughters aggressively seek engagements, including the Bennet family, with five eligible daughters.

Name: The Man Who Laughs
One-line: When a proud noble refuses to kiss the hand of the despotic King James in 1690, he is cruelly executed and his son surgically disfigured.

Name: October (Ten Days that Shook the World)
One-line: A large-scale view on the events of 1917 in Russia, when the monarchy was overthrown.

Name: The Remains of the Day
One-line: A butler who sacrificed body and soul to service in the years leading up to World War II realizes too late how misguided his loyalty was to his lordly employer.

Name: Brokeback Mountain
One-line: Ennis and Jack are two shepherds who develop a sexual and emotional relationship. Their relationship becomes complicated when both of them get married to their respective girlfriends.

Name: El Dorado
One-line: Cole Thornton, a gunfighter for hire, joins forces with old friend, Sheriff J.P. Hara. Together with an old Indian fighter and a gambler, they help a rancher and his family fight a rival rancher who's trying to steal their water.

Name: Yol
One-line: When five Kurdish prisoners are granted one week's home leave, they find to their dismay that they face continued oppression outside of prison from their families, the culture, and the government.

Name: Big Deal on Madonna Street
One-line: A motley quintet of inept small-time thieves attempt the burglary of a local pawnshop in this Italian farce.

Name: Trainspotting
One-line: Renton, deeply immersed in the Edinburgh drug scene, tries to clean up and get out despite the allure of drugs and the influence of friends.

Name: Bo Burnham: Inside
One-line: A musical comedy special shot and performed by Bo Burnham, alone, over the course of a very unusual year.

Name: An Unmarried Woman
One-line: A wealthy woman from Manhattan's Upper East Side struggles to deal with her new identity and her sexuality after her husband of 16 years leaves her for a younger woman.

Name: Gun Crazy
One-line: Two disturbed young people release their fascination with guns through a crime spree.

Name: Distant Voices, Still Lives
One-line: The lives of an English working-class family are told out of order in a free-associative manner. The first part, "Distant Voices", focuses on the father's role in the family. The second part, "Still Lives", focuses on his children.

Name: Now, Voyager
One-line: A frumpy spinster blossoms under therapy and becomes an elegant, independent woman.

Name: Oldboy
One-line: After being kidnapped and imprisoned for fifteen years, Oh Dae-Su is released, only to find that he must find his captor in five days.

Name: Spring in a Small Town
One-line: A lonely housewife finds her monotonous life altered when her childhood sweetheart returns to town.

Name: Baby Doll
One-line: An immature, naive teenage bride holds her anxious husband at bay while flirting with an amorous Sicilian farmer.

Name: Kiss Me Deadly
One-line: A doomed female hitchhiker pulls Mike Hammer into a deadly whirlpool of intrigue, revolving around a mysterious "great whatsit".

Name: Elmer Gantry
One-line: A fast-talking traveling salesman with a charming, loquacious manner convinces a sincere evangelist that he can be an effective preacher for her cause.

Name: Léon Morin, Priest
One-line: Set during occupied France, a faithless woman finds herself falling in love with a young priest.

Name: Mädchen in Uniform
One-line: At an all-girls boarding school, Manuela falls in love with a teacher, to terrific consequences.

Name: A Page of Madness
One-line: A man takes a job at an asylum with hopes of freeing his imprisoned wife.

Name: Love Streams
One-line: Two closely bound, emotionally wounded souls reunite after years apart.

Name: Underground
One-line: Two underground black marketeers, Marko and Blacky, sell weapons to the Communist resistance in wartime Belgrade, living the good life along the way.

Name: The Unknown
One-line: A criminal on the run hides in a circus and seeks to possess the daughter of the ringmaster at any cost.

Name: The Naked Kiss
One-line: A former prostitute relocates to a buttoned-down suburb, determined to fit in with mainstream society. But perverse secrets simmer beneath the wholesome surface.

Name: The Long Good Friday
One-line: An up-and-coming gangster is tested by the insurgence of an unknown, very powerful threat.

Name: Aladdin
One-line: A kind-hearted street urchin and a power-hungry Grand Vizier vie for a magic lamp that has the power to make their deepest wishes come true.

Name: Yellow Submarine
One-line: The Beatles agree to accompany Captain Fred in his yellow submarine and go to Pepperland to free it from the music-hating Blue Meanies.

Name: Othello
One-line: The Moorish General Othello is manipulated into thinking that his new wife Desdemona has been carrying on an affair with his Lieutenant Michael Cassio when in reality, it is all part of the scheme of a bitter Ensign named Iago.

Name: The Browning Version
One-line: Andrew Crocker-Harris (Michael Redgrave), a classics teacher at an English school, is afflicted with a heart ailment and an unfaithful wife (Jean Kent). His interest in his pupils wanes as he looks towards his final days in employment.

Name: Memories of Underdevelopment
One-line: A Cuban man cycles through his opinions and memories as the threat of foreign invasion intensifies and the rest of his family moves to Miami.

Name: The Great Silence
One-line: A mute gunfighter defends a young widow and a group of outlaws against a gang of bounty killers in the winter of 1898, and a grim, tense struggle unfolds.

Name: Summer of Soul (...Or, When the Revolution Could Not Be Televised)
One-line: Documentary about the legendary 1969 Harlem Cultural Festival which celebrated African-American music and culture and promoted Black pride and unity.

Name: In a Year with 13 Moons
One-line: A transgender woman tries to salvage something from the wreckage love has made of her life by confronting her anguished past, hoping to find ultimate acceptance among former acquaintances and herself.

Name: Being John Malkovich
One-line: A puppeteer discovers a portal that leads literally into the head of movie star John Malkovich.

Name: All That Heaven Allows
One-line: An upper-class widow falls in love with a much younger, down-to-earth nurseryman, much to the disapproval of her children and criticism of her country club peers.

Name: The Bad and the Beautiful
One-line: An unscrupulous movie producer uses an actress, a director and a writer to achieve success.

Name: The American Friend
One-line: Tom Ripley, who deals in forged art, suggests a picture framer he knows would make a good hit man.

Name: Mamma Roma
One-line: An ex-prostitute reunites with her son, but an extortion scheme threatens her aspirations for a decent life.

Name: Pretty Village, Pretty Flame
One-line: During the war in Bosnia, two childhood friends eventually become enemies, as the tragic and devastating circumstances of the war put them on the opposite sides and expose the most gruesome and cruel aspects of the human nature.

Name: Tabu: A Story of the South Seas
One-line: On the South Pacific island of Bora Bora, a young couple's love is threatened when the tribal chief declares the girl a sacred virgin.

Name: The Insider
One-line: A research chemist comes under personal and professional attack when he decides to appear in a 60 Minutes exposé on Big Tobacco.

Name: Cape Fear
One-line: A lawyer's family is stalked by a man he once helped put in jail.

Name: Kings of the Road
One-line: A traveling projection-equipment mechanic works in Western Germany along the East-German border, visiting worn-out theatres. He meets with a depressed young man whose marriage has just broken up, and the two decide to travel together.

Name: Century of Cinema
Actors: ['Michael Henry Wilson', 'Martin Scorsese', 'Allison Anders', 'Kathryn Bigelow', 'Francis Ford Coppola']
One-line: Martin Scorsese describes his initial and growing obsession with films from the 1940s and 50s as the art form developed and grew with clips from classics and cult classics.

Name: Enter the Dragon
One-line: A Shaolin martial artist travels to an island fortress to spy on an opium lord - who is also a former monk from his temple - under the guise of attending a fighting tournament.

Name: Memento
One-line: A man with short-term memory loss attempts to track down his wife's murderer.

Name: Withnail & I
One-line: In 1969, two substance-abusing, unemployed actors retreat to the countryside for a holiday that proves disastrous.

Name: Placido
One-line: In a small Spanish town, a group of old ladies decides to celebrate Christmas Eve with a "seat a poor man at your table" dinner: each wealthy household of the town will have a homeless ... See full summary »

Name: Second Wind
One-line: A gangster escapes jail and quickly makes plans to continue his criminal ways elsewhere, but a determined inspector is closing in.

Name: Seven Beauties
One-line: The defense of honor, a strong value in Neapolitan society, and its effects on the life of everyman Pasquale Frafuso.

Name: The Navigator
One-line: Two spoiled rich people find themselves trapped on an empty passenger ship.

Name: The Killers
One-line: Hit men kill an unresisting victim, and investigator Reardon uncovers his past involvement with beautiful, deadly Kitty Collins.

Name: Titanic
One-line: A seventeen-year-old aristocrat falls in love with a kind but poor artist aboard the luxurious, ill-fated R.M.S. Titanic.

Name: Hud
One-line: Honest and hard-working Texas rancher Homer Bannon has a conflict with his unscrupulous, selfish, arrogant and egotistical son Hud, who sank into alcoholism after accidentally killing his brother in a car crash.

Name: Hail the Conquering Hero
One-line: Woodrow is discharged from the military for hay fever, but fabricates receiving a heroic honorable discharge before returning home.

Name: The Player
One-line: A Hollywood studio executive is being sent death threats by a writer whose script he rejected, but which one?

Name: The Set-Up
One-line: Expecting the usual loss, a boxing manager takes bribes from a betting gangster without telling his fighter.

Name: Jurassic Park
One-line: A pragmatic paleontologist touring an almost complete theme park on an island in Central America is tasked with protecting a couple of kids after a power failure causes the park's cloned dinosaurs to run loose.

Name: Here Comes Mr. Jordan
One-line: Boxer Joe Pendleton dies 50 years too soon due to a heavenly mistake, and is given a new life as a millionaire playboy.

Name: The Thief of Bagdad
Actors: ['Michael Powell', 'Tim Whelan', 'Alexander Korda', 'Zoltan Korda', 'William Cameron Menzies', 'Conrad Veidt', 'Sabu', 'June Duprez', 'John Justin']
One-line: After being tricked and cast out of Bagdad by the evil Jaffar, King Ahmad joins forces with a thief named Abu to reclaim his throne, the city, and the Princess he loves.

Name: Dawn of the Dead
One-line: During an escalating zombie epidemic, two Philadelphia SWAT team members, a traffic reporter and his TV executive girlfriend seek refuge in a secluded shopping mall.

Name: Sabrina
One-line: A playboy becomes interested in the daughter of his family's chauffeur, but it's his more serious brother who would be the better man for her.

Name: Europe '51
One-line: A wealthy woman becomes obsessed with humanitarianism when her young son dies after committing suicide.

Name: The Iron Giant
One-line: A young boy befriends a giant robot from outer space that a paranoid government agent wants to destroy.

Name: Memories of Murder
One-line: In a small Korean province in 1986, two detectives struggle with the case of multiple young women being found raped and murdered by an unknown culprit.

Name: The Nun's Story
One-line: After leaving a wealthy Belgian family to become a nun, Sister Luke struggles with her devotion to her vows during crisis, disappointment, and World War II.

Name: The Green Ray
One-line: It's July, and Delphine has nowhere to go for the summer. She feels very bored and "empty", but this won't last; one day she accidently meets someone who seems to be totally made for her...

Name: The Gleaners & I
One-line: Varda films and interviews gleaners in France in all forms, from those picking fields after the harvest to those scouring the dumpsters of Paris.

Name: A Patch of Blue
One-line: A blind, uneducated white girl is befriended by a black man who becomes determined to help her escape her impoverished and abusive home life by introducing her to the outside world.

Name: Le Jour Se Leve
One-line: After committing a murder, a man locks himself in his apartment and recollects the events that led him to the killing.

Name: Who's Singin' Over There?
One-line: It's April 5, 1941, somewhere in Serbia. A group of people go on a bus to Belgrade, on a journey that will change their lives forever.

Name: Crossfire
One-line: A man is murdered, apparently by one of a group of demobilized soldiers he met in a bar. But which one? And why?

Name: Chronicle of a Summer
One-line: A documentary about the everyday lives of ordinary Parisians, done in the style of cinéma vérité.

Name: The Crying Game
One-line: A British soldier kidnapped by the IRA soon befriends one of his captors, who then becomes drawn into the soldier's world.

Name: Marius
One-line: Marius is faced with a choice whether to fulfill his passion by sailing the seas or stay and marry the woman he loves.

Name: Nayakan
One-line: A common man's struggles against a corrupt police force put him on the wrong side of the law. He becomes a don, who is loved and respected by many, but his growing power and influence exact a heavy toll.

Name: The Blood of a Poet
One-line: Told in four episodes - an unnamed artist is transported through a mirror into another dimension, where he travels through various bizarre scenarios.

Name: And Your Mother Too
Actors: ['Maribel Verdú', 'Gael García Bernal', 'Daniel Giménez Cacho', 'Ana López Mercado']
One-line: In Mexico, two teenage boys and an older woman embark on a road trip and learn a thing or two about life and each other.

Name: The Verdict
One-line: An outcast, alcoholic Boston lawyer sees the chance to salvage his career and self-respect by taking a medical malpractice case to trial rather than settling.

Name: The Round-Up
One-line: In Hungary, the national movement led by Kossuth has been crushed and the Austrian hegemony re-established, but partisans carry on with violent actions. In order to root out the guerilla, ... See full summary »

Name: The Act of Killing
One-line: A documentary which challenges former Indonesian death-squad leaders to reenact their mass-killings in whichever cinematic genres they wish, including classic Hollywood crime scenarios and lavish musical numbers.

Name: The Matrix
One-line: When a beautiful stranger leads computer hacker Neo to a forbidding underworld, he discovers the shocking truth--the life he knows is the elaborate deception of an evil cyber-intelligence.

Name: The Endless Summer
One-line: The crown jewel to ten years of Bruce Brown surfing documentaries. Brown follows two young surfers around the world in search of the perfect wave, and ends up finding quite a few in addition to some colorful local characters.

Name: East of Eden
One-line: Two brothers in 1910s California struggle to maintain their strict, Bible-toting father's favor as an old secret about their long-absent mother comes to light.

Name: Auntie Mame
One-line: An orphan goes to live with his free-spirited aunt. Conflict ensues when the executor of his father's estate objects to the aunt's lifestyle.

Name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
Actors: ['Daniel Scheinert', 'Michelle Yeoh', 'Stephanie Hsu', 'Jamie Lee Curtis', 'Ke Huy Quan']
One-line: A middle-aged Chinese immigrant is swept up into an insane adventure in which she alone can save existence by exploring other universes and connecting with the lives she could have led.

Name: The Friends of Eddie Coyle
One-line: After his last crime has him looking at a long prison sentence for repeat offenses, a low level Boston gangster decides to snitch on his friends to avoid jail time.

Name: 21 Up
One-line: Director Michael Apted interviews the same group of British-born adults after a seven-year wait as to the changes that have occurred in their lives during the last seven years.

Name: The Guns of Navarone
One-line: A team of Allied saboteurs is assigned an impossible mission: infiltrate an impregnable Nazi-held Greek island and destroy the two enormous long-range field guns that prevent the rescue of 2,000 trapped British soldiers.

Name: The Saragossa Manuscript
One-line: Upon finding a book that relates his grandfather's story, an officer ventures through Spain meeting a wide array of characters, most of whom have a story of their own to tell.

Name: The Golden Age
One-line: A surrealist tale of a man and a woman who are passionately in love with each other, but their attempts to consummate that passion are constantly thwarted by their families, the Church, and bourgeois society.

Name: The Life of Emile Zola
One-line: The biopic of the famous French muckraking writer and his involvement in fighting the injustice of the Dreyfus Affair.

Name: Flee
One-line: FLEE tells the extraordinary true story of a man, Amin, on the verge of marriage which compels him to reveal his hidden past for the first time.

Name: Rain Man
One-line: After a selfish L.A. yuppie learns his estranged father left a fortune to an autistic-savant brother in Ohio that he didn't know existed, he absconds with his brother and sets out across the country, hoping to gain a larger inheritance.

Name: Alexander Nevsky
One-line: The story of how a great Russian prince led a ragtag army to battle an invading force of Teutonic Knights.

Name: The King's Speech
One-line: The story of King George VI, his unexpected ascension to the throne of the British Empire in 1936, and the speech therapist who helped the unsure monarch overcome his stammer.

Name: A Time to Live and a Time to Die
One-line: The semi-autobiographical film on director Hou Hsiao-Hsien's childhood and adolescence, when he was growing up in Taiwan, living through the deaths of his father, mother and grandmother.

Name: A Room with a View
One-line: Lucy Honeychurch (Helena Bonham Carter) shares a brief romance with George Emerson in Florence. Yet as she tries to move on with her life and look for marriage elsewhere, can she truly forget the events of that summer?

Name: Short Cuts
One-line: The day-to-day lives of several suburban Los Angeles residents.

Name: The Letter
One-line: The wife of a rubber plantation administrator shoots a man to death and claims it was self-defense, but a letter in her own hand may prove her undoing.

Name: Battleground
One-line: True tale about a squad of the 101st Airborne Division coping with being trapped by the Germans in the besieged city of Bastogne, Belgium during the Battle of the Bulge in December of 1944.

Name: Pelle the Conqueror
One-line: When his wife dies, Lasse takes his 12-year-old son, Pelle, from their home in Sweden to Denmark in search of a better life.

Name: Monterey Pop
One-line: A film about the greatest pre-Woodstock rock music festival.

Name: The Phantom of the Opera
Actors: ['Lon Chaney', 'Ernst Laemmle', 'Edward Sedgwick', 'Lon Chaney', 'Mary Philbin', 'Norman Kerry', 'Arthur Edmund Carewe']
One-line: A mad, disfigured composer seeks love with a lovely young opera singer.

Name: Heaven Can Wait
One-line: An old roué arrives in Hades to review his life with Satan, who will rule on his eligibility to enter the Underworld.

Name: Shame
One-line: In the midst of a civil war, former violinists Jan and Eva Rosenberg, who have a tempestuous marriage, run a farm on a rural island. In spite of their best efforts to escape their homeland, the war impinges on every aspect of their lives.

Name: The Music Man
One-line: Traveling con artist Harold Hill targets the naïve residents of a small town in 1910s Iowa by posing as a boys' band leader to raise money before he can skip town.

Name: The Working Class Goes to Heaven
One-line: A conscientious factory worker becomes embroiled in political activism after accidentally cutting off his finger while working a machine.

Name: Days of Wine and Roses
One-line: An alcoholic marries a young woman and systematically addicts her to booze so that they can share his "passion" together.

Name: Love Me Tonight
One-line: A Parisian tailor finds himself posing as a baron in order to collect a sizeable bill from an aristocrat, only to fall in love with an aloof young princess.

Name: Häxan
One-line: Fictionalized documentary showing the evolution of witchcraft, from its pagan roots to its confusion with hysteria in Eastern Europe.

Name: Gate of Hell
One-line: A samurai pursues a married lady-in-waiting.

Name: Lost in Translation
One-line: A faded movie star and a neglected young woman form an unlikely bond after crossing paths in Tokyo.

Name: Simon of the Desert
One-line: Simon, a deeply religious man living in the 4th century, wants to be nearer to God so he climbs a column. The Devil wants him to come down to Earth and is trying to seduce him.

Name: Destiny
One-line: When a woman's fiancé disappears, Death gives her three chances to save him from his fate.

Name: The Big House
One-line: A convict falls in love with his new cellmate's sister, only to become embroiled in a planned break-out which is certain to have lethal consequences.

Name: The Mortal Storm
One-line: The Roth family leads a quiet life in a small village in the German Alps during the early 1930s. When the Nazis come to power, the family is divided and Martin Breitner, a family friend, is caught up in the turmoil.

Name: The Sea Wolf
One-line: After being fished out of the sea by a sailer, three fugitives find themselves prisoners of the ship's brutal skipper who refuses to put them ashore and they hatch an escape plan during a crew mutiny.

Name: And Life Goes On
One-line: A director and his son return to a region damaged by the Guilan earthquake, hoping to find the children who appeared in his film a few years earlier.

Name: Nobody Knows
One-line: In a small Tokyo apartment, twelve-year-old Akira must care for his younger siblings after their mother leaves them and shows no sign of returning.

Name: Spring, Summer, Fall, Winter... and Spring
One-line: A boy is raised by a Buddhist monk in an isolated floating temple where the years pass like the seasons.

Name: The Last Detail
One-line: Two Navy men are ordered to bring a young offender to prison, but decide to show him one last good time along the way.

Name: Days of Being Wild
One-line: A man tries to find out who his real mother is after the woman who raised him tells him the truth.

Name: It's Such a Beautiful Day
One-line: Bill struggles to put together his shattered psyche, in this new feature film version of Don Hertzfeldt's animated short film trilogy.

Name: Letter Never Sent
One-line: Four geologists search for diamonds in the wilderness of Siberia.

Name: Nazarin
One-line: A priest in a poor community lives a charitable life in accordance with his religious principles, but many others do not return the favor.

Name: Becket
One-line: King Henry II of England comes to terms with his affection for his close friend and confidant Thomas Becket, who finds his true honor by observing God's divine will rather than the King's.

Name: Nanook of the North
One-line: In this silent predecessor to the modern documentary, film-maker Robert J. Flaherty spends one year following the lives of Nanook and his family, Inuits living in the Arctic Circle.

Name: I Vitelloni
One-line: A character study of five young men at crucial turning points in their lives in a small town in Italy.

Name: The Father
One-line: A man refuses all assistance from his daughter as he ages. As he tries to make sense of his changing circumstances, he begins to doubt his loved ones, his own mind and even the fabric of his reality.

Name: Classe Tous Risques
One-line: A ruthless criminal flees from the pursuit, involving more and more casualties.

Name: My Voyage to Italy
One-line: World-renowned director Martin Scorsese narrates this journey through his favorites in Italian cinema.

Name: From Russia with Love
One-line: James Bond willingly falls into an assassination plot involving a naive Russian beauty in order to retrieve a Soviet encryption device that was stolen by S.P.E.C.T.R.E.

Name: Smiles of a Summer Night
One-line: In Sweden at the turn of the century, members of the upper class and their servants find themselves in a romantic tangle that they try to work out amidst jealousy and heartbreak.

Name: Libeled Lady
One-line: When a socialite sues a big paper for libel, the editor responsible calls in the help of his ignored fiancée and a former employee to frame her and make the false story seem true.

Name: Only Yesterday
One-line: A twenty-seven-year-old office worker travels to the countryside while reminiscing about her childhood in Tokyo.

Name: Angels with Dirty Faces
One-line: A priest tries to stop a gangster from corrupting a group of street kids.

Name: Sense and Sensibility
One-line: Rich Mr. Dashwood dies, leaving his second wife and her three daughters poor by the rules of inheritance. The two eldest daughters are the title opposites.

Name: Taipei Story
One-line: Lung is a former member of the national Little League team who lives with his old childhood sweetheart Ah-chin, a traditional family woman. Although they live together, Ah-chin is weary of Lung's past liaison with another girl.

Name: Sleuth
One-line: A man who loves games and theater invites his wife's lover to meet him, setting up a battle of wits with potentially deadly results.

Name: The Usual Suspects
One-line: The sole survivor of a pier shoot-out tells the story of how a notorious criminal influenced the events that began with five criminals meeting in a seemingly random police lineup.

Name: Star Wars: Episode VI - Return of the Jedi
One-line: After rescuing Han Solo from Jabba the Hutt, the Rebels attempt to destroy the second Death Star, while Luke struggles to help Darth Vader back from the dark side.

Name: Brother's Keeper
One-line: This compelling documentary details the strange-but-true murder trial of Delbert Ward, accused of the mercy killing of his brother in rural upstate NY. This real-life murder mystery won the Audience Award at Sundance.

Name: A Touch of Zen
One-line: A lady fugitive on the run from corrupt government officials is joined in her endeavors by an unambitious painter and skilled Buddhist monks.

Name: Forbidden Games
One-line: A young French girl orphaned in a German air attack is befriended by the son of a poor farmer, and together they try to come to terms with the realities of death.

Name: The Incredible Shrinking Man
One-line: After Scott Carey begins to shrink because of exposure to a combination of radiation and insecticide, medical science is powerless to help him.

Name: Die Hard
One-line: A New York City police officer tries to save his estranged wife and several others taken hostage by terrorists during a Christmas party at the Nakatomi Plaza in Los Angeles.

Name: A Fistful of Dollars
One-line: A wandering gunfighter plays two rival families against each other in a town torn apart by greed, pride, and revenge.

Name: Fox and His Friends
One-line: A suggestible working-class innocent wins the lottery but lets himself be taken advantage of by his bourgeois new boyfriend and his circle of materialistic friends.

Name: Sounder
One-line: The oldest son of a loving and strong family of black sharecroppers comes of age in the Depression-era South after his father is imprisoned for stealing food.

Name: Moscow Does Not Believe in Tears
One-line: Three young provincial women come to Moscow in search of what people in all the capitals of the world are looking for - love, happiness and prosperity. Their destinies develop exactly as the character of each of the girls suggests.

Name: Bigger Than Life
One-line: A seriously-ill schoolteacher becomes dependent on a "miracle" drug that begins to affect his sanity.

Name: Broadcast News
One-line: Take two rival television reporters: one handsome, one talented, both male. Add one producer, female. Mix well, and watch the sparks fly.

Name: Forbidden Planet
One-line: A starship crew in the 23rd century goes to investigate the silence of a distant planet's colony, only to find just two survivors, a powerful robot, and the deadly secret of a lost civilization.

Name: Mimino
One-line: Local Georgian pilot Mimino dreams of flying airplanes for major international airlines. To realize his aspirations, he goes to Moscow where he encounters a fellow comrade from the Caucasus, the Armenian Rubik. Many misadventures ensue.

Name: Lonesome
One-line: Two lonely people in the big city meet and enjoy the thrills of an amusement park, only to lose each other in the crowd after spending a great day together. Will they ever see each other again?

Name: The Stranger
One-line: An investigator from the War Crimes Commission travels to Connecticut to find an infamous Nazi.

Name: The Fall of the House of Usher
One-line: Allan visits the sinister Usher family mansion, where his friend Roderick is painting a portrait of his sickly wife Madeline. The portrait seems to be draining the life out of Madeline, slowly leading to her death.

Name: Angel
One-line: A woman and her husband take separate vacations, and she falls in love with another man.

Name: Darling
Actors: ['Julie Christie', 'Dirk Bogarde', 'Laurence Harvey', 'José Luis de Vilallonga']
One-line: Beautiful but amoral model Diana Scott sleeps her way to the top of the London fashion scene at the height of the Swinging Sixties.

Name: The Artist
One-line: When George, a silent movie superstar, meets Peppy Miller, a dancer, sparks fly between the two. However, after the introduction of talking pictures, their fortunes change, affecting their dynamic.

Name: The Westerner
One-line: Judge Roy Bean, a self-appointed hanging judge in Vinegarroon, Texas, befriends saddle tramp Cole Harden, who opposes Bean's policy against homesteaders.

Name: Jean de Florette
One-line: A greedy landowner and his backward nephew conspire to block the only water source for an adjoining property in order to bankrupt the owner and force him to sell.

Name: Guess Who's Coming to Dinner
One-line: A couple's attitudes are challenged when their daughter introduces them to her African-American fiancé.

Name: The Terrorizers
One-line: A metaphysical mystery about the lives of three couples in Taipei that continually intersect over a span of several weeks.

Name: The Thief of Bagdad
One-line: A recalcitrant thief vies with a duplicitous Mongol ruler for the hand of a beautiful princess.

Name: Slumdog Millionaire
One-line: A teenager from the slums of Mumbai becomes a contestant on the show 'Kaun Banega Crorepati?' When interrogated under suspicion of cheating, he revisits his past, revealing how he had all the answers.

Name: The Red and the White
One-line: During the Russian Civil War, the Red Army - aided by Hungarian Communists - and the White Army fight for control of the area surrounding the Volga.

Name: The Front Page
One-line: A crusading newspaper editor tricks his retiring star reporter into covering one last case.

Name: Johnny Belinda
One-line: A kind doctor volunteers to tutor a deaf-mute woman, but scandal starts to swirl when his pupil is raped and falls pregnant.

Name: Paper Flowers
One-line: Suresh Sinha, a famous director, discovers star potential in Shanti, a woman he stumbled into one rainy evening, and casts her as the lead in a film. In a twist of fate, Shanti becomes a superstar and Suresh faces a decline in his career.

Name: The Big Lebowski
One-line: Jeff "The Dude" Lebowski, mistaken for a millionaire of the same name, seeks restitution for his ruined rug and enlists his bowling buddies to help get it.

Name: Le Plaisir
One-line: Three separate stories about the same thing: le plaisir (pleasure).

Name: True Grit
One-line: A drunken, hard-nosed U.S. Marshal and a Texas Ranger help a stubborn teenager track down her father's murderer in Indian Territory.

Name: Breaking the Waves
One-line: Oilman Jan is paralyzed in an accident. His wife, who prayed for his return, feels guilty; even more, when Jan urges her to have sex with another.

Name: Testament of Orpheus
One-line: The Poet looks back over his life and work, recalling his inspirations and obsessions.

Name: Thief
One-line: An ace safe cracker wants to do one last big heist for the mob before going straight.

Name: The Phantom of Liberty
One-line: A series of surreal sequences that critique morality and society in a stream of consciousness style.

Name: The Ballad of Narayama
One-line: In a poor 19th century rural Japanese village, everyone who reaches the age of 70 has to climb a nearby mountain to die. An elderly woman is reaching close to her cut-off age during her last days with her family.

Name: Nomadland
One-line: A woman in her sixties, after losing everything in the Great Recession, embarks on a journey through the American West, living as a van-dwelling modern-day nomad.

Name: Hearts and Minds
Actors: ['Tin Chan', 'Chau Diem', 'Ngo Dinh Diem', 'John Foster Dulles']
One-line: A startling and courageous landmark documentary that unflinchingly confronted the United States' involvement in Vietnam at the height of the controversy that surrounded it.

Name: Roma
Actors: ['Yalitza Aparicio', 'Marina de Tavira', 'Diego Cortina Autrey', 'Carlos Peralta']
One-line: A year in the life of a middle-class family's maid in Mexico City in the early 1970s.

Name: Life Is Sweet
One-line: A shop assistant, her cook husband, and their twin daughters go about their lives in a working-class London suburb.

Name: The War Game
One-line: A docudrama depicting a hypothetical nuclear attack on Britain.

Name: All the Beauty and the Bloodshed
One-line: Follows the life of artist Nan Goldin and the downfall of the Sackler family, the pharmaceutical dynasty who was greatly responsible for the opioid epidemic's unfathomable death toll.

Name: WALL·E
One-line: In the distant future, a small waste-collecting robot inadvertently embarks on a space journey that will ultimately decide the fate of mankind.

Name: Comrades: Almost a Love Story
One-line: Two Chinese-mainlanders living in Hong Kong form a close friendship. Over the years this grows into love, but there are obstacles.

Name: Castle in the Sky
One-line: A young boy and a girl with a magic crystal must race against pirates and foreign agents in a search for a legendary floating castle.

Name: Still Walking
One-line: A family gathers together for a commemorative ritual whose nature only gradually becomes clear.

Name: French Cancan
One-line: This comedy drama from Jean Renoir chronicles the revival of Paris' most notorious dance as it tells the story of a theater producer who turns a humble washerwoman into a star at the Moulin Rouge.

Name: The Miracle of Morgan's Creek
One-line: After an all-night send-off party for the troops, a small-town girl with an awkward boyfriend wakes up to find herself married and pregnant, but with no memory of her husband's identity.

Name: The Pinchcliffe Grand Prix
Actors: ['Wenche Foss', 'Per Theodor Haugen', 'Harald Heide-Steen Jr.', 'Leif Juster']
One-line: Reodor Felgen decides that he will enter a car race to defeat his former friend who has stolen his plans for a car.

Name: Time of the Gypsies
One-line: In this luminous tale set in the area around Sarajevo and in Italy, Perhan, an engaging young Romany (gypsy) with telekinetic powers, is seduced by the quick-cash world of petty crime, which threatens to destroy him and those he loves.

Name: Moonlight
One-line: A young African-American man grapples with his identity and sexuality while experiencing the everyday struggles of childhood, adolescence, and burgeoning adulthood.

Name: A Night to Remember
One-line: On her maiden voyage in April 1912, the supposedly unsinkable RMS Titanic strikes an iceberg in the Atlantic Ocean.

Name: Kiki's Delivery Service
One-line: A young witch, on her mandatory year of independent life, finds fitting into a new community difficult while she supports herself by running an air courier service.

Name: Sergeant York
One-line: A Tennessee farmer and marksman is drafted in World War I, and struggles with his pacifist inclinations before becoming one of the most celebrated war heroes.

Name: The Soft Skin
One-line: Pierre Lachenay is a well-known publisher and lecturer, married with Franca and father of Sabine, around 10. He meets an air hostess, Nicole. They start a love affair, which Pierre is hiding, but he cannot stand staying away from her.

Name: El Sur
One-line: A woman reflects on her childhood relationship with her father, attempting to understand the depths of his despair and the truth of his myths.

Name: Spotlight
One-line: The true story of how the Boston Globe uncovered the massive scandal of child molestation and cover-up within the local Catholic Archdiocese, shaking the entire Catholic Church to its core.

Name: Obsession
One-line: Gino, a drifter, begins an affair with inn-owner Giovanna, and they plan to get rid of her older husband.

Name: Seven Days in May
One-line: United States military leaders plot to overthrow the President because he supports a nuclear disarmament treaty and they fear a Soviet sneak attack.

Name: Barton Fink
One-line: A renowned New York playwright is enticed to California to write for the movies and discovers the hellish truth of Hollywood.

Name: Lola Montès
One-line: When she is reduced to appearing in a circus, a notorious beauty thinks back on her past loves.

Name: Dishonored
One-line: The Austrian Secret Service sends its most seductive agent to spy on the Russians.

Name: Purple Noon
One-line: Tom Ripley is a talented mimic, moocher, forger and all-around criminal improviser; but there's more to Tom Ripley than even he can guess.

Name: Operation 'Y' & Other Shurik's Adventures
One-line: Three stories about Shurik - a young student. He fights against criminals, falls in love, confuses apartments, passes exams - he lives after all.

Name: The Killer
One-line: A disillusioned assassin accepts one last hit in hopes of using his earnings to restore vision to a singer he accidentally blinded.

Name: California Split
One-line: When a casual gambler (George Segal as Bill) befriends a professional one (Elliott Gould as Charlie), he begins to mirror his life, sending both deeper into the sleazy gambling world where the stakes keep getting bigger.

Name: Duel
One-line: A business commuter is pursued and terrorized by the malevolent driver of a massive tractor-trailer.

Name: Wagon Master
One-line: Two young drifters guide a Mormon wagon train to the San Juan Valley and encounter cutthroats, Indians, geography, and moral challenges on the journey.

Name: Sleeping Beauty
Actors: ['Clyde Geronimi', 'Eric Larson', 'Wolfgang Reitherman', 'Hamilton Luske', 'Mary Costa', 'Bill Shirley', 'Eleanor Audley', 'Verna Felton']
One-line: After being snubbed by the royal family, a malevolent fairy places a curse on a princess which only a prince can break, along with the help of three good fairies.

Name: Amici miei
One-line: Four inseparable friends try to face their midlife crisis with daytrips and pranks at the expense of their families and the people around them.

Name: Office Romance
One-line: The life of entire statistical bureau becomes crazy when an ordinary worker, a shy man, falls in love with a boss, a strict woman.

Name: Veronika Voss
One-line: Partially based on the life of Sybille Schmitz, who found fame under the Nazi regime, but whose career was destroyed afterward. Veronika Voss is a once prominent UFA actress, kept by her doctor, who raises suspicion in a sports journalist.

Name: Seconds
One-line: An unhappy middle-aged banker agrees to a procedure that will fake his death and give him a completely new look and identity - one that comes with its own price.

Name: What's Up, Doc?
One-line: The accidental mix-up of four identical plaid overnight bags leads to a series of increasingly wild and wacky situations.

Name: Maborosi
One-line: A young woman's husband apparently commits suicide without warning or reason, leaving behind his wife and infant.

Name: Bombshell
One-line: A glamorous film star rebels against the studio, her pushy press agent and a family of hangers-on.

Name: Through the Olive Trees
One-line: A depiction of the off-screen relationship between the actors who play the newlyweds in the film And Life Goes On (1992).

Name: Entranced Earth
One-line: In the fictional Latin American country Eldorado, a poet tries to effect political change by influencing powerful men.

Name: The Bishop's Wife
One-line: A debonair angel comes to Earth to help an Episcopalian bishop and his wife in their quest to raise money for the new church.

Name: Breaker Morant
One-line: Three Australian lieutenants are court martialed for executing prisoners as a way of deflecting attention from war crimes committed by their superior officers.

Name: Death by Hanging
One-line: A Korean man is sentenced to death by hanging, but he survives the execution. For the following two hours, his executioners try to work out how to handle the situation in this black farce.

Name: Come from Away
One-line: 7,000 passengers are stranded after the 9/11 terrorist attacks in a small town in Newfoundland, where they were housed and welcomed. Filmed live on stage at the Gerald Schoenfeld Theater in New York City.

Name: The White Ribbon
One-line: Strange events happen in a small village in the north of Germany during the years before World War I, which seem to be ritual punishment. Who is responsible?

Name: Burden of Dreams
One-line: A documentary following German auteur Werner Herzog as he deals with difficult actors, bad weather and getting a boat over a mountain, all in an effort to make his film Fitzcarraldo (1982).

Name: Born Yesterday
One-line: A tycoon hires a tutor to teach his lover proper etiquette, with unexpected results.

Name: Superman
One-line: An alien orphan is sent from his dying planet to Earth, where he grows up to become his adoptive home's first and greatest superhero.

Name: 20,000 Leagues Under the Sea
One-line: A ship sent to investigate a wave of mysterious sinkings encounters the advanced submarine, the Nautilus, commanded by Captain Nemo.

Name: Punishment Park
One-line: "Punishment Park" is a pseudo-documentary purporting to be a film crews's news coverage of the team of soldiers escorting a group of hippies, draft dodgers, and anti-establishment types ... See full summary »

Name: Akira
One-line: A secret military project endangers Neo-Tokyo when it turns a biker gang member into a rampaging psychic psychopath who can only be stopped by a teenager, his gang of biker friends and a group of psychics.

Name: Gentlemen of Fortune
One-line: It so happens that peaceful kindergarten teacher is incredibly similar to the terrible villain who stole the helmet of Alexander the Great. And villain's accomplices are unexpectedly similar to children - they also need love and care.

Name: Alice Doesn't Live Here Anymore
One-line: A recently widowed woman is on the road with her precocious young son, determined to make a new life for herself as a singer.

Name: La Chienne
One-line: Maurice Legrand, a meek cashier married to a nagging wife, has a secret passion: he's a Sunday painter. He falls in love with Lulu, a young woman dominated by Dédé, the pimp who she works for. Dédé pushes Lulu into a relationship with him.

Name: Incendies
One-line: Twins journey to the Middle East to discover their family history and fulfill their mother's last wishes.

Name: Titicut Follies
One-line: Documentary filmmaker Frederick Wiseman takes us inside the Massachusetts Correctional Institution Bridgewater where people stay trapped in their madness.

Name: Talk to Her
One-line: Two men share an odd friendship while they care for two women who are both in deep comas.

Name: A Summer's Tale
One-line: A shy maths graduate takes a holiday in Dinard before starting his first job. He hopes his sort-of girlfriend will join him, but soon strikes up a friendship with another girl working in ... See full summary »

Name: Aranyer Din Ratri
One-line: A group of Calcutta city slickers, including the well-off Asim (Soumitra Chatterjee), the meek Sanjoy (Subhendu Chatterjee) and the brutish Hari (Samit Bhanja), head out for a weekend in the wilderness.

Name: Tender Mercies
One-line: A broken-down, middle-aged country singer gets a new wife, reaches out to his long-lost daughter, and tries to put his troubled life back together.

Name: Lost Horizon
One-line: When a revered diplomat's plane is diverted and crashes in the peaks of Tibet, he and the other survivors are guided to an isolated monastery at Shangri-La, where they wrestle with the invitation to stay.

Name: All Quiet on the Western Front
One-line: A young German soldier's terrifying experiences and distress on the western front during World War I.

Name: Aftersun
One-line: Sophie reflects on the shared joy and private melancholy of a holiday she took with her father twenty years earlier. Memories real and imagined fill the gaps between as she tries to reconcile the father she knew with the man she didn't...

Name: Stray Dog
One-line: During a sweltering summer, a rookie homicide detective tries to track down his stolen Colt pistol.

Name: Boyz n the Hood
Actors: ['Cuba Gooding Jr.', 'Laurence Fishburne', 'Hudhail Al-Amir', 'Lloyd Avery II']
One-line: Follows the lives of three young males living in the Crenshaw ghetto of Los Angeles, dissecting questions of race, relationships, violence, and future prospects.

Name: Kit Kat
One-line: Sheikh Hosny is a blind man who lives with his old mother and his frustrated son in the Kit Kat neighborhood. His son Youssef dreams of going to Europe to find work, and has a relationship ... See full summary »

Name: The 36th Chamber of Shaolin
One-line: A man studies kung fu at the Shaolin Temple to fight back against the oppressive Manchu government.

Name: Romeo and Juliet
One-line: When two young members of feuding families meet, forbidden love ensues.

Name: A Beautiful Mind
One-line: A mathematical genius, John Nash made an astonishing discovery early in his career and stood on the brink of international acclaim. But the handsome and arrogant Nash soon found himself on a harrowing journey of self-discovery.

Name: The Major and the Minor
One-line: A frustrated city girl disguises herself as a youngster in order to get a cheaper train ticket home. But little "Sue Sue" finds herself in a whole heap of grown-up trouble when she hides out in a compartment with a handsome Major.

Name: The Cow
One-line: An old villager deeply in love with his cow goes to the capital for a while. While he's there, the cow dies and now the villagers are afraid of his possible reaction to it when he returns.

Name: Quiz Show
One-line: A young lawyer, Richard Goodwin, investigates a potentially fixed game show. Charles Van Doren, a big time show winner, is under Goodwin's investigation.

Name: The Long Day Closes
One-line: A lyrical reverie about a young Liverpool boy coming of age in the 1950s among his loving family and the austere Catholic Church as he enters the rigors of school, nurtures a bedazzled love of the movies and longs for companionship.

Name: Ya shagayu po Moskve
One-line: Young Siberian writer Volodya meets Kolya in the Moscow metro in his visit to a famous author. Volodya and Kolya's friend Sasha adventure their love interests in their own way, while Kolya sets out to help them.

Name: A Christmas Carol

One-line: Biographical epic of the controversial and influential Black Nationalist leader, from his early life and career as a small-time gangster, to his ministry as a member of the Nation of Islam and his eventual assassination.

Name: The Age of Innocence
One-line: A tale of nineteenth-century New York high society in which a young lawyer falls in love with a woman separated from her husband, while he is engaged to the woman's cousin.

Name: The Beaches of Agnès
One-line: Agnès Varda explores her memories, mostly chronologically, with photographs, film clips, interviews, reenactments, and droll, playful contemporary scenes of her narrating her story.

Name: Perfect Blue
One-line: A pop singer gives up her career to become an actress, but she slowly goes insane when she starts being stalked by an obsessed fan and what seems to be a ghost of her past.

Name: Death in Venice
One-line: While recovering in Venice, sickly composer Gustav von Aschenbach becomes dangerously fixated with teenager Tadzio.

Name: Manon of the Spring
One-line: A beautiful but shy shepherdess plots vengeance on the men whose greedy conspiracy to acquire her father's land caused his death years earlier.

Name: Woman of the Year
One-line: Rival reporters Sam and Tess fall in love and get married, only to find their relationship strained when Sam comes to resent Tess' hectic lifestyle.

Name: Anbe Sivam
One-line: Two men, one young and arrogant, the other damaged - physically but not spiritually - by life, are thrown together by circumstances, and find that they are in some ways bound together by fate.

Name: Some Came Running
One-line: A veteran returns home to deal with family secrets and small-town scandals.

Name: Out of the Blue
One-line: A young girl whose father is an ex-convict and whose mother is a junkie finds it difficult to conform and tries to find comfort in a quirky combination of Elvis and the punk scene.

Name: Mister Roberts
Actors: ['Mervyn LeRoy', 'Joshua Logan', 'Henry Fonda', 'James Cagney', 'William Powell', 'Jack Lemmon']
One-line: In the waning days of World War II, the cargo officer of a Navy supply ship chafes at its role far from the action in the Pacific's backwater areas, his frustration rising when its captain denies the crew liberty over petty irritations.

Name: A Short Film About Love
One-line: A naive inexperienced young man spies on a woman who lives across the courtyard, and falls in love with her. He starts using tricks which he hopes will lead to them meeting.

Name: Police Story
One-line: A virtuous Hong Kong Police Officer must clear his good name when the drug lord he is after frames him for the murder of a dirty cop.

Name: The Wind Will Carry Us
One-line: Irreverent city engineer Behzad comes to a rural village in Iran to keep vigil for a dying relative. In the meanwhile the film follows his efforts to fit in with the local community and how he changes his own attitudes as a result.

Name: When We Were Kings
One-line: Boxing documentary on the 1974 world heavyweight championship bout between defending champion, George Foreman, and the underdog challenger, Muhammad Ali.

Name: Time to Love
One-line: A poor painter falls in love with a photograph of a woman while at work in one of the massive villas on Istanbul's Princes' Islands.

Name: Shine
One-line: Pianist David Helfgott, driven by his father and teachers, has a breakdown. Years later he returns to the piano, to popular if not critical acclaim.

Name: Traffic
One-line: A conservative judge is appointed by the President to spearhead America's escalating war against drugs, only to discover that his teenage daughter is a crack addict. Two DEA agents protect an informant. A jailed drug baron's wife attempts to carry on the family business.

Name: For Sama
One-line: FOR SAMA is both an intimate and epic journey into the female experience of war.

Name: Prince of the City
One-line: A New York City narcotics detective reluctantly agrees to cooperate with a special commission investigating police corruption, and soon realises he's in over his head, and nobody can be trusted.

Name: À Nous la Liberté
One-line: Seeking better life, two convicts escape from prison.

Name: Husbands and Wives
One-line: When their best friends announce that they're separating, a professor and his wife discover the faults in their own marriage.

Name: Girl Shy
One-line: A shy young man who can't talk to women ventures out to publish a book full of fictional conquests, but finds true love along the way.

Name: On the Town
One-line: Three sailors wreak havoc as they search for love during a whirlwind 24-hour leave in New York City.

Name: The Bad News Bears
One-line: An aging, down-on-his-luck ex-minor leaguer coaches a team of misfits in an ultra-competitive California little league.

Name: For All Mankind
One-line: An in-depth look at various NASA moon landing missions, starting with Apollo 8.

Name: The Hunchback of Notre Dame
One-line: In 15th-century France, a gypsy girl is framed for murder by the infatuated Chief Justice, and only the deformed bellringer of Notre Dame Cathedral can save her.

Name: The Long Voyage Home
One-line: A merchant ship's crew tries to survive the loneliness of the sea and the coming of war.

Name: This Sporting Life
One-line: Despite success on the field, a rising rugby star senses the emerging emptiness of his life as his inner angst begins to materialize through aggression and brutality, so he attempts to woo his landlady in hopes of finding reason to live.

Name: A New Leaf
One-line: Henry Graham lives the life of a playboy. When his lawyer tells him one day that his lifestyle has consumed all his funds, he needs an idea to avoid climbing down the social ladder. So he intends to marry a rich woman and - murder her.

Name: Sarpatta Parambarai
One-line: When Sarpatta Parambarai is challenged to a do-or-die match, will Kabilan, a young labourer, put on the gloves himself and lead his clan to victory, or be dissuaded by his disapproving mother and dangerous politics?

Name: The Heartbreak Kid
One-line: A newlywed man on his honeymoon has second thoughts about his marriage and falls for a different woman.

Name: La Grande Vadrouille
One-line: Several ordinary Frenchmen go on an epic voyage through the occupied country to the free zone as they help British pilots avoid German captivity.

Name: The Herd
One-line: Because of a local blood feud, a peasant family in eastern Turkey decides to sell its sheep in far away Ankara.

Name: Pigs and Battleships
One-line: A young hoodlum decides to work for a criminal organization that is tearing itself apart.

Name: The Rocky Horror Picture Show
One-line: A newly-engaged couple have a breakdown in an isolated area and must seek shelter at the bizarre residence of Dr. Frank-n-Furter.

Name: Style Wars
One-line: A documentary that exposes the rich growing subculture of hip-hop that was developing in New York City in the late '70s and early '80s, specifically focusing on graffiti art and breakdancing.

Name: The Man Who Knew Too Much
One-line: An ordinary British couple vacationing in Switzerland suddenly find themselves embroiled in a case of international intrigue when their daughter is kidnapped by spies plotting a political assassination.

Name: The Man Who Came to Dinner
One-line: An acerbic critic wreaks havoc when a hip injury forces him to move in with a Midwestern family.

Name: A Christmas Carol
One-line: An elderly miser learns the error of his ways on Christmas Eve.

Name: The Tin Drum
One-line: In 1924, Oskar Matzerath is born in the Free City of Danzig. At age three, he falls down a flight of stairs and stops growing. In 1939, World War II breaks out.

Name: The Incredibles
Actors: ['Craig T. Nelson', 'Samuel L. Jackson', 'Holly Hunter', 'Jason Lee']
One-line: While trying to lead a quiet suburban life, a family of undercover superheroes are forced into action to save the world.

Name: Bad Day at Black Rock
One-line: A one-armed stranger comes to a tiny town possessing a terrible past they want to keep secret, by violent means if necessary.

Name: Christ Stopped at Eboli
One-line: A doctor in Fascist Italy is exiled to a remote village for his political views.

Name: Hombre
One-line: John Russell, disdained by his "respectable" fellow stagecoach passengers because he was raised by Native Americans, becomes their only hope for survival when they are set upon by outlaws.

Name: The Kid Brother
Actors: ['Harold Lloyd', 'Lewis Milestone', 'J.A. Howe', 'Harold Lloyd', 'Jobyna Ralston', 'Walter James', 'Leo Willis']
One-line: A sheriff's milquetoast son has a chance to prove himself when a medicine show run by con artists comes into town.

Name: State of Siege
One-line: Using the interrogation of a US counterinsurgency agent as a backdrop, the film explores the consequences of the struggle between Uruguay's government and the leftist Tupamaro guerrillas.

Name: Queen Christina
One-line: Queen Christina of Sweden is a popular monarch who is loyal to her country. However, when she falls in love with a Spanish envoy, she must choose between the throne and the man she loves.

Name: Girlfriends
One-line: A photographer and her girlfriend are roommates. She is stuck with small-change shooting jobs and dreams of success. When her roommate decides to get married and leave, she feels hurt and has to learn how to deal with living alone.

Name: Portrait of Jennie
One-line: In Depression-era New York, an impoverished painter has a chance encounter with an enigmatic, old-fashioned little girl in Central Park who inspires him and changes his destiny.

Name: The Smiling Lieutenant
One-line: An amorous lieutenant is forced to marry a socially awkward princess, though he tries to keep his violin-playing girlfriend on the side.

Name: Night and the City
One-line: A small-time grifter and nightclub tout takes advantage of some fortuitous circumstances and tries to become a big-time player as a wrestling promoter.

Name: The King and the Mockingbird
One-line: A chimney sweep and a shepherdess seek to escape from the clutches of a tyrannical king.

Name: I Knew Her Well
One-line: Adriana, a naive Italian country girl, moves to Rome to become a movie star and experiences the dark side of the business.

Name: Rosetta
One-line: Young and impulsive Rosetta lives with her alcoholic mother and, moved by despair, she will do anything to maintain a job.

Name: The Message
One-line: This epic historical drama chronicles the life and times of Prophet Muhammad and serves as an introduction to early Islamic history.

Name: Body Heat
One-line: During an extreme heatwave, a beautiful Florida woman and a seedy lawyer engage in an affair while plotting the murder of her rich husband.

Name: The Joy Luck Club
One-line: The life histories of four East Asian women and their daughters reflect and guide each other.

Name: Tár
One-line: Set in the international world of Western classical music, the film centers on Lydia Tár, widely considered one of the greatest living composer-conductors and the very first female director of a major German orchestra.

Name: The Official Story
One-line: During the final months of Argentinian Military Dictatorship in 1983, a high school teacher sets out to find out who the mother of her adopted daughter is.

Name: Birdman or (The Unexpected Virtue of Ignorance)
One-line: A washed-up superhero actor attempts to revive his fading career by writing, directing, and starring in a Broadway production.

Name: The Children Are Watching Us
One-line: Four-year-old Pricò becomes the subject of emotional folly by his capricious parents and negligent relatives.

Name: To Live
One-line: After Fugui and Jiazhen lose their personal fortunes, they raise a family and survive difficult cultural changes during 1940s to 1970s China.

Name: Toy Story 3
One-line: The toys are mistakenly delivered to a day-care center instead of the attic right before Andy leaves for college, and it's up to Woody to convince the other toys that they weren't abandoned and to return home.

Name: Scarecrow
One-line: An ex-con drifter with a penchant for brawling is amused by a homeless ex-sailor, so they partner up as they head east together.

Name: The Haunting
One-line: Hill House has stood for about 90 years and appears haunted: its inhabitants have always met strange, tragic ends. Now Dr. John Markway has assembled a team of people who he thinks will prove whether or not the house is haunted.

Name: Chicago
One-line: Two death-row murderesses develop a fierce rivalry while competing for publicity, celebrity, and a sleazy lawyer's attention.

Name: The Sixth Sense
One-line: Malcolm Crowe, a child psychologist, starts treating a young boy, Cole, who encounters dead people and convinces him to help them. In turn, Cole helps Malcolm reconcile with his estranged wife.

Name: Camera Buff
One-line: An ordinary factory worker buys a camera on the occasion of the birth of his child. The authorities order him to make documentaries about the factory's success. But his endeavor to be truthful leads him to opposition against censorship.

Name: No Man's Land
One-line: Bosnia and Herzegovina during 1993 at the time of the heaviest fighting between the two warring sides. Two soldiers from opposing sides in the conflict, Nino and Ciki, become trapped in no man's land, whilst a third soldier becomes a living booby trap.

Name: Il Grido
One-line: A man wanders aimlessly away from his town, away from the woman he loves, emotionally and socially inactive.

Name: General Della Rovere
One-line: Bardone, a petty con man, is arrested by the Gestapo and coerced into impersonating a partisan leader in order to expose another resistance organizer.

Name: Two Women
One-line: In the Italy of WWII, a widow and her lonely daughter seek for distance between them and the horrors of war.

Name: The Caine Mutiny
One-line: When a U.S. Naval captain shows signs of mental instability that jeopardises the ship, the first officer is urged to consider relieving him of command.

Name: The Butcher
One-line: An unlikely friendship between a dour, working class butcher and a repressed schoolteacher coincides with a grisly series of Ripper-type murders in a provincial French town.

Name: Mona Lisa
One-line: A man recently released from prison manages to get a job driving a call girl from customer to customer.

Name: Double Suicide
One-line: A doomed love between a paper merchant and a courtesan.

Name: Night Train
One-line: Jerzy enters a train set for the Baltic coast. He seems to be on the run from something - as does the strange woman with whom he must share a sleeping compartment.

Name: The Muppet Movie
One-line: Kermit and his newfound friends trek across America to find success in Hollywood, but a frog legs merchant is after Kermit.

Name: Kibar Feyzo
One-line: A poor peasant, Feyzo returns from military service dreaming about getting married to Gülo, the love of his life. However, he has to face many obstacles. According to tradition, a man has ... See full summary »

Name: Selvi Boylum Al Yazmalim
One-line: Story of a dilemma between a woman's love and her logic. Asya, a young girl with a strict mother, meets Ilyas, who is a womanizer city man, and they quickly fall in love. They get over the ... See full summary »

Name: Easy Rider
One-line: Two bikers head from L.A. to New Orleans through the open country and desert lands, and along the way they meet a man who bridges a counter-culture gap of which they had been unaware.

Name: Human
One-line: A collection of stories about and images of our world, offering an immersion to the core of what it means to be human.

Name: Awakenings
One-line: The victims of an encephalitis epidemic many years ago have been catatonic ever since, but now a new drug offers the prospect of reviving them.

Name: Black Sabbath
One-line: Boris Karloff hosts a trio of horror stories concerning a stalked call girl, a vampire-like monster who preys on his family, and a nurse who is haunted by her ring's rightful owner.

Name: Scarlet Street
One-line: A man in mid-life crisis befriends a young woman, though her fiancé persuades her to con him out of the fortune they mistakenly assume he possesses.

Name: The Kids Are Alright
One-line: Interviews, TV clips and concert footage make up this comprehensive profile of The Who, Britain's premiere rock band.

Name: Seven Brides for Seven Brothers
One-line: In 1850 Oregon, when a backwoodsman brings a wife home to his farm, his six brothers decide that they want to get married too.

Name: The Chase
One-line: The citizens of a Texan town become concerned and panicked when a local bad boy escapes prison and heads for his hometown.

Name: The Tenant
One-line: A bureaucrat rents a Paris apartment where he finds himself drawn into a rabbit hole of dangerous paranoia.

Name: Watch Out for the Automobile
One-line: A very good cop tries to catch a very insidious and extremely clever serial car thief. The bitter irony is that the thief is not very clever, absolutely not insidious, and a virtuous person and his friend.

Name: The Times of Harvey Milk
One-line: A documentary of the successful career and assassination of San Francisco's first elected gay city supervisor.

Name: Gates of Heaven
One-line: A documentary about a pet cemetery in California, and the people who have pets buried there.

Name: Treasure Island
One-line: The treasure seeking adventures of young Jim Hawkins and pirate captain Long John Silver.

Name: Pillow Talk
One-line: An interior decorator and a playboy songwriter share a telephone party line and size each other up.

Name: Eat Drink Man Woman
One-line: A senior chef lives with his three grown daughters; the middle one finds her future plans affected by unexpected events and the life changes of the other household members.

Name: Man of Iron
One-line: A few years after the events of Man of Marble (1977), a journalist investigates Mateusz Birkut's son Maciek Tomczyk, now an activist leading a shipyard strike.

Name: Peter Pan
Actors: ['Wilfred Jackson', 'Hamilton Luske', 'Jack Kinney', 'Bobby Driscoll', 'Kathryn Beaumont', 'Hans Conried', 'Bill Thompson']
One-line: Wendy and her brothers are whisked away to the magical world of Neverland with the hero of their stories, Peter Pan.

Name: Whiplash
One-line: A promising young drummer enrolls at a cut-throat music conservatory where his dreams of greatness are mentored by an instructor who will stop at nothing to realize a student's potential.

Name: Johnny Got His Gun
One-line: During World War I, a patriotic young American is rendered blind, deaf, limbless, and mute by a horrific artillery shell attack. Trapped in what's left of his body, he desperately looks for a way to end his life.

Name: Fireworks
One-line: Nishi leaves the police in the face of harrowing personal and professional difficulties. Spiraling into depression, he makes questionable decisions.

Name: Samurai I: Musashi Miyamoto
One-line: Depicts the early life of the legendary warrior Musashi Miyamoto; his years as an aspiring warrior, an outlaw and finally a true samurai.

Name: Waltz with Bashir
One-line: An Israeli film director interviews fellow veterans of the 1982 invasion of Lebanon to reconstruct his own memories of his term of service in that conflict.

Name: Land of Silence and Darkness
One-line: Through examining Fini Straubinger, an old woman who has been deaf and blind since adolescence, and her work on behalf of other deaf and blind people, this film shows how the deaf and blind... See full summary »

Name: 7 Plus Seven
One-line: Director Michael Apted revisits the same group of British-born children after a seven-year wait. The subjects are interviewed as to the changes that have occurred in their lives during the last seven years.

Name: Teorema
One-line: A mysterious young man seduces each member of a bourgeois family. When he suddenly leaves, how will their lives change?

Name: Dark Victory
One-line: A young socialite is diagnosed with an inoperable brain tumor, and must decide whether or not she'll meet her final days with dignity.

Name: My Dear Brother
One-line: Two poor men try to find a television as a last wish for the terminally ill brother of one of them.

Name: Dry Summer
One-line: A farmer has a violent dispute with his fellow villagers by claiming ownership of the water that comes out of his land. He is as sexually frustrated as greedy.

Name: Inglourious Basterds
One-line: In Nazi-occupied France during World War II, a plan to assassinate Nazi leaders by a group of Jewish U.S. soldiers coincides with a theatre owner's vengeful plans for the same.

Name: 4 Little Girls
One-line: A documentary of the notorious racial terrorist bombing of an African American church during the Civil Rights Movement.

Name: Underworld
One-line: Boisterous gangster kingpin Bull Weed rehabilitates his former lawyer from his alcoholic haze, but complications arise when he falls for Weed's girlfriend.

Name: Monsters, Inc.
Actors: ['David Silverman', 'Lee Unkrich', 'Billy Crystal', 'John Goodman', 'Mary Gibbs', 'Steve Buscemi']
One-line: In order to power the city, monsters have to scare children so that they scream. However, the children are toxic to the monsters, and after a child gets through, two monsters realize things may not be what they think.

Name: Way Out West
One-line: Stanley and Ollie are enlisted to deliver the deed to a goldmine in a small village, only for it to be stolen.

Name: The Blue Kite
One-line: The lives of a Beijing family throughout the 1950s and 1960s, as they experience the impact of the Hundred Flowers Campaign, the Great Leap Forward, and the Cultural Revolution.

Name: A Bronx Tale
One-line: Robert De Niro and Chazz Palminteri give captivating performances in this intense drama about a boy torn between his tough, hard-working father and a violent yet charismatic crime boss.

Name: Cosy Dens
One-line: Two families, Sebkovi and Krausovi, are celebrating Christmas, but not everyone is in a good mood. Teenage kids think their fathers are totally stupid; fathers are sure their children are nothing more than rebels, hating anything they say.

Name: The Garden of the Finzi-Continis
One-line: The story of the Finzi-Continis, a noble family of Ferrara, during the Jewish persecution in Italy's 1930s.

Name: Kiss of the Spider Woman
One-line: A gay man and a political prisoner are together in a prison. The gay man narrates the stories of two fake movies and his own life.

Name: The Testament of Dr. Mabuse
One-line: A criminal mastermind uses hypnosis to rule the rackets after death.

Name: The Thin Blue Line
One-line: A film that successfully argued that a man was wrongly convicted for murder by a corrupt justice system in Dallas County, Texas.

Name: Little Miss Sunshine
One-line: A family determined to get their young daughter into the finals of a beauty pageant take a cross-country trip in their VW bus.

Name: The Taking of Pelham One Two Three
One-line: Four armed men hijack a New York City subway car and demand a ransom for the passengers. The city's police are faced with a conundrum: Even if it's paid, how could they get away?

Name: Olympia Part Two: Festival of Beauty
One-line: The document of the 1936 Olympics at Berlin, orchestrated as Nazi propaganda.

Name: The Return
One-line: In the Russian wilderness, two brothers face a range of new, conflicting emotions when their father - a man they know only through a single photograph - resurfaces.

Name: This Man Must Die
One-line: A man asserts himself within the life of an actress he believes is somehow responsible for his son's death.

Name: The Steel Edge of Revenge
One-line: A guilt-haunted samurai warrior attempts to stop a massacre taking place.

Name: Moolaadé
One-line: When a woman shelters a group of girls from suffering female genital mutilation, she starts a conflict that tears her village apart.

Name: Lady for a Day
One-line: A gangster tries to make Apple Annie, the Times Square apple seller, a lady for a day.

Name: Sholay
One-line: After his family is murdered by a notorious and ruthless bandit, a former police officer enlists the services of two outlaws to capture the bandit.

Name: Salt of the Earth
One-line: Mexican workers at a zinc mine call a general strike. It is only through the solidarity of the workers, and importantly the indomitable resolve of their wives, mothers, and daughters, that they eventually triumph.

Name: The Marquise of O
One-line: A German Marquise has to deal with a pregnancy she cannot explain and an infatuated Russian Count.

Name: The Good Earth
Actors: ['Victor Fleming', 'Gustav Machatý', 'Sam Wood', 'Paul Muni', 'Luise Rainer', 'Walter Connolly', 'Tilly Losch']
One-line: Although married Chinese farmers Wang and O-Lan initially experience success, their lives are complicated by declining fortunes and lean times, as well as the arrival of the beautiful young Lotus.

Name: The Quiet Girl
One-line: In rural Ireland, a quiet, neglected girl is sent away from her dysfunctional family to live with relatives for the summer where she blossoms and learns what it is to be loved.

Name: Bound for Glory
One-line: The early life of Woody Guthrie as a vagabond folk singer.

Name: Henry V
One-line: In the midst of the Hundred Years' War, the young King Henry V of England embarks on the conquest of France in 1415.

Name: The Chaos Class Is Waking Up
One-line: A kind and hardworking student joins to Hababam Sinifi (The Chaos Class) but they don't accept him as one of them and he becomes the target of all class' pranks.

Name: The Death of Mr. Lazarescu
One-line: Mr. Lãzãrescu, a dying old man, is shuttled from hospital to hospital by a loyal paramedic as doctors refuse to operate and no one can agree on a diagnosis.

Name: Providence
One-line: A dying writer bases his last book on his own perception of his family.

Name: A Short Film About Killing
One-line: A soon-to-be lawyer crosses his path with a taxi driver and a young sinister man.

Name: The Truman Show
One-line: An insurance salesman discovers his whole life is actually a reality TV show.

Name: Shrek
One-line: A mean lord exiles fairytale creatures to the swamp of a grumpy ogre, who must go on a quest and rescue a princess for the lord in order to get his land back.

Name: Mughal-E-Azam
One-line: A 16th century prince falls in love with a court dancer and battles with his emperor father.

Name: The Destiny of a Man
One-line: A Soviet soldier, Andrei Sokolov, has been separated from his family by World War II. Suffering in German captivity, he dreams of meeting his darlings after the victory. But cruel fate turned out otherwise.

Name: Flesh and the Devil
One-line: Childhood friends are torn apart when one of them marries the woman the other fiercely loves.

Name: The Banshees of Inisherin
One-line: Two lifelong friends find themselves at an impasse when one abruptly ends their relationship, with alarming consequences for both of them.

Name: Gosford Park
One-line: Set in the 1930s, a group of pretentious rich and famous get together for a weekend of relaxation at a hunting resort. But when a murder occurs, each one of these interesting characters becomes a suspect.

Name: Letters from Iwo Jima
One-line: The story of the battle of Iwo Jima between the United States and Imperial Japan during World War II, as told from the perspective of the Japanese who fought it.

Name: Winter Sleep
One-line: A hotel owner and landlord in a remote Turkish village deals with conflicts within his family and a tenant behind on his rent.

Name: In Which We Serve
One-line: This "story of a ship", the British destroyer H.M.S. Torrin, is told in flashbacks by survivors as they cling to a life raft.

Name: Dust in the Wind
One-line: A young couple leave their mining town home for Taipei where they struggle to eke out a living in an industrial wasteland.

Name: Muriel
One-line: In the seaside town of Boulogne, no one seems to be able to cope with their past, least of all Hélène, an antique furniture saleswoman, her stepson Bernard, and her former lover Alphonse.
