Name: Edward Scissorhands
One-line: The solitary life of an artificial man - who was incompletely constructed and has scissors for hands - is upended when he is taken in by a suburban family.

Name: Witness
One-line: While protecting an Amish boy - who is the sole witness to a brutal murder - and his mother, a detective is forced to seek refuge within their community when his own life is threatened.

Name: Blue
One-line: In his final - and most daring - cinematic statement, Jarman the romantic meets Jarman the iconoclast in a lush soundscape pulsing against a purely blue screen, laying bare his physical and spiritual state.

Name: Before the Rain
One-line: Three interconnected stories of love under the threat of civil war in Macedonia and London.

Name: The Professionals
One-line: An arrogant Texas millionaire hires four adventurers to rescue his kidnapped wife from a notorious Mexican bandit.

Name: Coming Home
One-line: In 1968 California, a woman whose husband is a Marine officer fighting in Vietnam falls in love with a former high school classmate who suffered a paralyzing combat injury in the war.

Name: Around the World in 80 Days
One-line: A Victorian Englishman bets that with the new steamships and railways he can circumnavigate the globe in eighty days.

Name: Pickup on South Street
One-line: A pickpocket unwittingly lifts a message destined for enemy agents and becomes a target for a Communist spy ring.

Name: When Harry Met Sally...
One-line: Harry and Sally have known each other for years, and are very good friends, but they fear sex would ruin the friendship.

Name: The Secret in Their Eyes
One-line: A retired legal counselor writes a novel hoping to find closure for one of his past unresolved homicide cases and for his unreciprocated love with his superior - both of which still haunt him decades later.

Name: CODA
One-line: As a CODA (Child of Deaf Adults) Ruby is the only hearing person in her deaf family. When the family's fishing business is threatened, Ruby finds herself torn between pursuing her passion at Berklee College of Music and her fear of abandoning her parents.

Name: Phantom of the Paradise
One-line: A disfigured composer sells his soul for the woman he loves so that she will perform his music. However, an evil record tycoon betrays him and steals his music to open his rock palace, The Paradise.

Name: Autumn Sonata
One-line: A devoted wife is visited by her mother, a successful concert pianist who had little time for her when she was young.

Name: Diamonds of the Night
One-line: Two Jewish boys escape from a train transporting them from one concentration camp to another. The film goes beyond the themes of war and anti-Nazism and concerns itself with man's struggle to preserve human dignity.

Name: Love Meetings
One-line: Director Pasolini traverses Italy in 1963 with camera and microphone interviewing people in public places about sex, marriage and gender roles.

Name: Son of the White Mare
One-line: In this dreamlike Hungarian folk myth, a horse goddess gives birth to three powerful brothers who set out into the Underworld to save three princesses from three evil dragons and reclaim their ancestors' lost kingdom.

Name: People on Sunday
Actors: ['Edgar G. Ulmer', 'Rochus Gliese', 'Curt Siodmak', 'Fred Zinnemann', 'Erwin Splettstößer', 'Brigitte Borchert', 'Wolfgang von Waltershausen', 'Christl Ehlers']
One-line: Two men and two women enjoy a pleasant Sunday at the beach amid the unending toil of the working week.

Name: A Prophet
One-line: A young Algerian man is sent to a French prison.

Name: White Nights
One-line: A humble clerk courts a woman who awaits her lover's return night after night.

Name: Elvis: That's the Way It Is
One-line: After years of making movies, the King made a triumphant return to the stage in 1970. Now, see the backstage footage from rehearsals to relaxing at the hotel and the performances in one of the most intimate looks at Elvis captured on film.

Name: Dr. No
One-line: A resourceful British government agent seeks answers in a case involving the disappearance of a colleague and the disruption of the American space program.

Name: Reversal of Fortune
One-line: Wealthy Sunny von Bülow lies brain-dead, husband Claus guilty of attempted murder; but he says he's innocent and hires Alan Dershowitz for his appeal.

Name: The Collector
One-line: A womanizing art dealer and a painter find the serenity of their Riviera vacation disturbed by a third guest, a vivacious bohemian woman known for her long list of male conquests.

Name: Dead Man's Letters
One-line: In the aftermath of nuclear holocaust, a group of intellectuals crave to find hope in the pale and colorless new world. Among them, a history teacher tries to contact via letters his missing son.

Name: 28 Up
One-line: This eye-opening episode uncovers human nature and the desire to survive and succeed in all its heart-breaking glory.

Name: Face to Face
One-line: Two psychiatrists have their marriage tested when one suffers a mental breakdown.

Name: Marat/Sade
One-line: In an insane asylum, Marquis de Sade directs Jean Paul Marat's last days through a theater play. The actors are the patients.

Name: The Twilight Samurai
One-line: As the feudal Japan era draws to a close, a widower samurai experiences difficulty balancing clan loyalties, 2 young daughters, an aged mother, and the sudden reappearance of his childhood sweetheart.

Name: Wild River
One-line: A TVA bureaucrat comes to the river to do what none of his predecessors have been able to do - evict a stubborn octogenarian from her island before the rising waters engulf her.

Name: Manchester by the Sea
One-line: A depressed uncle is asked to take care of his teenage nephew after the boy's father dies.

Name: Drunken Angel
One-line: A drunken doctor with a hot temper and a violence-prone gangster with tuberculosis form a quicksilver bond.

Name: The Prisoner of Zenda
Actors: ['W.S. Van Dyke', 'Ronald Colman', 'Madeleine Carroll', 'C. Aubrey Smith', 'Raymond Massey']
One-line: An Englishman on a Ruritarian holiday must impersonate the king when the rightful monarch, a distant cousin, is drugged and kidnapped.

Name: The Great Beauty
One-line: Jep Gambardella has seduced his way through the lavish nightlife of Rome for decades, but after his 65th birthday and a shock from the past, Jep looks past the nightclubs and parties to find a timeless landscape of absurd, exquisite beauty.

Name: Fists in the Pocket
One-line: A young man takes drastic measures to rid his dysfunctional family of its various afflictions.

Name: Wolfwalkers
One-line: A young apprentice hunter and her father journey to Ireland to help wipe out the last wolf pack. But everything changes when she befriends a free-spirited girl from a mysterious tribe rumored to transform into wolves by night.

Name: Small Axe
One-line: Mangrove tells this true story of The Mangrove Nine, who clashed with London police in 1970. The trial that followed was the first judicial acknowledgment of behavior motivated by racial hatred within the Metropolitan Police.

Name: Django
One-line: A coffin-dragging gunslinger and a prostitute become embroiled in a bitter feud between a Klan of Southern racists and a band of Mexican Revolutionaries.

Name: Boyhood
One-line: The life of Mason, from early childhood to his arrival at college.

Name: Heart of a Dog
One-line: In the wake of the Russian revolution, Professor Preobrazhensky rescues a starving dog from the gutter, and attempts to transform him into a man. Based on Mikhail Bulgakov's novel of the same name.

Name: Lassie Come Home
One-line: After her destitute family is forced to sell her, a collie named Lassie escapes from her new owner and begins the long trek from Scotland to her Yorkshire home.

Name: To Each His Own
One-line: An unwed mother, forced to give up her child to avoid scandal, follows her son's life from afar even as she prospers in business.

Name: Brighton Rock
One-line: In Brighton in 1935, small-time gang leader Pinkie Brown murders a journalist and later desperately tries to cover his tracks but runs into trouble with the police, a few witnesses, and a rival gang.

Name: Yesterday, Today and Tomorrow
One-line: Stories about three very different women and the men they attract.

Name: Small Axe
One-line: A single evening at a house party in 1980s West London sets the scene, developing intertwined relationships against a background of violence, romance and music.

Name: Weekend
One-line: A surreal tale of a married couple going on a road trip to visit the wife's parents with the intention of killing them for the inheritance.

Name: Çöpçüler Krali
One-line: Going through his daily routine in a stereotypical neighborhood, a street cleaner falls in love with a charwoman. Unfortunately for him, so does his boss.

Name: Casque d'Or
One-line: Three gangsters and an ex-con carpenter all fall for the same beautiful golden-haired woman in Belle Époque France.

Name: Kidnapping, Caucasian Style
One-line: A young student Shurik comes to a remote mountainous region in search of ancient legends and traditions. Fooled by the corrupt local governor, he helps him to kidnap a beautiful young girl, but soon realizes what he's done.

Name: The Black Stallion
One-line: After being shipwrecked with a magnificent horse off the coast of Africa in the 1940s, a boy bonds with the stallion, and trains him to race after their rescue.

Name: The Nun
One-line: Suzanne is forced against her will to take vows as a nun and three mothers superior treat her in radically different ways. Suzanne's virtue brings disaster to everyone in this faithful adaptation of a bitter attack on religious abuses.

Name: Design for Living
One-line: A woman cannot decide between two men who love her, and the trio agree to try living together in a platonic friendly relationship.

Name: Tea and Sympathy
One-line: A new senior at a boy's prep school, finds himself harassed by the machismo culture of his classmates and the unfeelingly behavior by his father, only being treated with decency by his roommate and with affection by the coach's wife.

Name: The Wedding Banquet
One-line: To satisfy his nagging parents, a gay landlord and a female tenant agree to a marriage of convenience, but his parents arrive to visit and things get out of hand.

Name: Ice Cold in Alex
One-line: During World War II in North Africa, a medical field unit must cross the desert in their ambulance in order to reach the British lines in Alexandria.

Name: Lupin III: The Castle of Cagliostro
One-line: A dashing thief, his gang of desperadoes and an intrepid cop struggle to free a princess from an evil count, and learn the secret of a treasure that she holds part of the key to.

Name: To Live and Die in L.A.
One-line: A fearless Secret Service agent will stop at nothing to bring down the counterfeiter who killed his partner.

Name: Stella Dallas
One-line: A working-class woman is willing to do whatever it takes to give her daughter a socially promising future.

Name: The Holy Innocents
One-line: Spain, 1960s. The family of poor farmers work hard in the countryside for the rich landowners who exploit them.

Name: Marnie
One-line: Mark marries Marnie although she is a habitual thief and has serious psychological problems, and tries to help her confront and resolve them.

Name: Le Million
One-line: An impoverished painter and his rival engage in a race across Paris to recover a jacket concealing a winning lottery ticket.

Name: Beau Geste
One-line: Three adopted English brothers join the French Foreign Legion in North Africa after one of them steals their adoptive family's famous heirloom sapphire.

Name: Ludwig
One-line: The reign of the tormented Ludwig, king of Bavaria, from 1864 to 1886.

Name: Patlabor 2: The Movie
Actors: ['Mizuho Nishikubo', 'Mîna Tominaga', 'Briony Glassco', 'Julie Ann Taylor', 'Toshio Furukawa']
One-line: When a terrorist attack is blamed on the Air Force, Special Vehicle Unit 2 gets caught in the middle of a growing political conflict.

Name: It Happened in Broad Daylight
One-line: Having doubts about the guilt of the obvious suspect in the murder of an eight year old girl, a police detective decides to investigate the case on his own.

Name: Variety Lights
Actors: ['Alberto Lattuada', 'Peppino De Filippo', 'Carla Del Poggio', 'Giulietta Masina', 'John Kitzmiller']
One-line: A beautiful, ambitious young woman joins a traveling troupe of third-rate vaudevillians and inadvertently causes jealousy and emotional crises.

Name: Judas and the Black Messiah
One-line: Offered a plea deal by the FBI, William O'Neal infiltrates the Illinois chapter of the Black Panther Party to gather intelligence on Chairman Fred Hampton.

Name: The Narrow Margin
Actors: ['William Cameron Menzies', 'Charles McGraw', 'Marie Windsor', 'Jacqueline White', 'Gordon Gebert']
One-line: A woman planning to testify against the mob must be protected against potential assassins on the train trip from Chicago to Los Angeles.

Name: The Diary of Anne Frank
One-line: During World War II, a teenage Jewish girl named Anne Frank and her family are forced into hiding in the Nazi-occupied Netherlands.

Name: All That Money Can Buy
One-line: A nineteenth-century New Hampshire farmer makes a pact with Satan for economic success, then enlists famed orator Daniel Webster to extract him from his contract.

Name: Los Angeles Plays Itself
One-line: A documentary on how Los Angeles has been used and depicted in the movies.

Name: Wings
Actors: ["Harry d'Abbadie d'Arrast", 'Clara Bow', "Charles 'Buddy' Rogers", 'Richard Arlen', 'Jobyna Ralston']
One-line: Two young men, one rich, one middle class, who are in love with the same woman, become fighter pilots in World War I.

Name: Grizzly Man
One-line: A devastating and heart-rending take on grizzly bear activists Timothy Treadwell and Amie Huguenard, who were killed in October of 2003 while living among grizzly bears in Alaska.

Name: A Foreign Affair
One-line: In occupied Berlin, an army captain is torn between an ex-Nazi café singer and the U.S. congresswoman investigating her.

Name: The Social Network
One-line: As Harvard student Mark Zuckerberg creates the social networking site that would become known as Facebook, he is sued by the twins who claimed he stole their idea and by the co-founder who was later squeezed out of the business.

Name: Santa Sangre
One-line: A former circus artist escapes from a mental hospital to rejoin his armless mother - the leader of a strange religious cult - and is forced to enact brutal murders in her name as he becomes "her arms".

Name: Happy Together
One-line: A couple take a trip to Argentina but both men find their lives drifting apart in opposite directions.

Name: Dancer in the Dark
One-line: An Eastern European US immigrant with a love for musicals has to cope with the gradual loss of her vision.

Name: Léon: The Professional
One-line: 12-year-old Mathilda is reluctantly taken in by Léon, a professional assassin, after her family is murdered. An unusual relationship forms as she becomes his protégée and learns the assassin's trade.

Name: You Only Live Once
One-line: The public defender's secretary and an ex-convict get married and try to make a life together, but a series of disasters sends their lives spiraling out of control.

Name: Key Largo
One-line: A man visits his war buddy's family hotel and finds a gangster running things. As a hurricane approaches, the two end up confronting each other.

Name: Smile
One-line: A social comedy about a beauty pageant for young Californian women, held annually in Santa Rosa, and how it affects the locals and participants.

Name: Hope and Glory
One-line: Bill, a young boy living on the outskirts of London experiences the exhilaration of World War II. During this period, Bill learns about sex, death, love, hypocrisy, and the faults of adults as he prowls the ruins of bombed houses.

Name: The Devils
One-line: In 17th-century France, Father Urbain Grandier's protection of the city of Loudun from the corrupt Cardinal Richelieu is undermined by a sexually repressed nun's accusation of witchcraft.

Name: Misery
One-line: After a famous author is rescued from a car crash by a fan of his novels, he comes to realize that the care he is receiving is only the beginning of a nightmare of captivity and abuse.

Name: Eureka
One-line: The traumatized survivors of a murderous bus hijacking come together and take a road trip to attempt to overcome their damaged selves. Meanwhile a serial killer is on the loose.

Name: Murmur of the Heart
One-line: As France is nearing the end of the first Indochina War, an open-minded teenage boy finds himself torn between a rebellious urge to discover love, and the ever-present, almost dominating affection of his beloved mother.

Name: The Freshman
Actors: ['Sam Taylor', 'Harold Lloyd', 'Jobyna Ralston', 'Brooks Benedict', 'James H. Anderson']
One-line: A nerdy college student will do anything to become popular on campus.

Name: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World
One-line: During the Napoleonic Wars, a brash British captain pushes his ship and crew to their limits in pursuit of a formidable French war vessel around South America.

Name: Minari
One-line: A Korean American family moves to an Arkansas farm in search of its own American dream. Amidst the challenges of new life in the strange and rugged Ozarks, they discover the undeniable resilience of family and what really makes a home.

Name: Lenny
One-line: The story of acerbic 1960s comic Lenny Bruce, whose groundbreaking, no-holds-barred style and social commentary was often deemed by the Establishment as too obscene for the public.

Name: Sling Blade
One-line: Karl Childers, a simple man hospitalized since his childhood murder of his mother and her lover, is released to start a new life in a small town.

Name: 49th Parallel
One-line: A World War II U-boat crew are stranded in northern Canada. To avoid internment, they must make their way to the border and get into the still-neutral U.S.

Name: Gol Maal
One-line: A man's simple lie to secure his job escalates into more complex lies when his orthodox boss gets suspicious.

Name: The Aviator's Wife
One-line: A young student is devastated when he finds that his girlfriend is cheating on him. In order to find out why she did it, he decides to spy on her and her lover.

Name: The Sweet Hereafter
One-line: A bus crash in a small town brings a lawyer to defend the families, but he discovers everything isn't what it seems.

Name: Iruvar
One-line: A struggling actor and a writer-politician become friends as young men and rise to great heights in cinema and politics respectively. But when both become contenders for the top political post in the state, a rift develops between them.

Name: When Father Was Away on Business
One-line: A family is deeply affected by the father's extramarital affairs and the turbulent consequences of the Tito-Stalin split.

Name: Ida
One-line: A novice nun about to take her vows uncovers a family secret dating back to the German occupation.

Name: Dead of Night
Actors: ['Charles Crichton', 'Basil Dearden', 'Robert Hamer', 'Mervyn Johns', 'Michael Redgrave', 'Roland Culver', 'Mary Merrall']
One-line: Guests invited to a weekend in the country share their supernatural stories, beginning with Walter Craig, who senses impending doom as his half-remembered recurring dream turns into reality.

Name: The Spy Who Came in from the Cold
One-line: Instead of coming in from the Cold War, British agent Alec Leamas chooses to face another mission.

Name: Sawdust and Tinsel
One-line: The complicated relationships between a circus ringmaster, his estranged wife and his lover.

Name: The Court Jester
One-line: A hapless carnival performer masquerades as the court jester as part of a plot against an evil ruler who has overthrown the rightful King.

Name: The Great Indian Kitchen
One-line: After marriage, a woman struggles to be the submissive wife that her husband and his family expect her to be. The story follows her journey, as she changes herself and, even more so, changes the household.

Name: One Hour with You
One-line: An unhappily married couple try to come between a happy one.

Name: Nostalgia for the Light
One-line: A documentary about two different searches conducted in the Chilean Atacama Desert: one by astronomers looking for answers about the history of the cosmos, and one by women looking for the remains of loved ones killed by Pinochet's regime.

Name: Mystery Train
One-line: Three stories are connected by a Memphis hotel and the spirit of Elvis Presley.

Name: The 47 Ronin
One-line: The legendary Forty-seven ronin plot to avenge the death of their lord, Asano Naganori, by killing Kira Yoshinaka, a shogunate official responsible for Asano being forced to commit seppuku.

Name: Death of a Cyclist
One-line: A couple having an affair strike a bicyclist with their car and do not offer aid out of fear of their relationship being exposed.

Name: Mary and Max
One-line: In 1976 Melbourne, a lonely 8-year-old girl strikes up a correspondence with an unlikely pen pal: a severely obese 44-year-old New Yorker with Asperger's syndrome.

Name: Waking Life
One-line: A man shuffles through a dream meeting various people and discussing the meanings and purposes of the universe.

Name: The Outlaw Josey Wales
One-line: Missouri farmer Josey Wales joins a Confederate guerrilla unit and winds up on the run from the Union soldiers who murdered his family.

Name: Small Change
One-line: The lives of a motherless boy, who is just starting to get interested in women, and his physically abused friend, who lives in poverty, are mixed with more or less innocent childhood experiences and challenges of a number of children.

Name: Love Exposure
One-line: A bizarre love triangle forms between a young Catholic upskirt photographer, a misandric girl and a manipulative cultist.

Name: Dazed and Confused
One-line: The adventures of high school and junior high students on the last day of school in May 1976.

Name: In the Bedroom
One-line: A New England couple's college-aged son dates an older woman who has two small children and an unwelcome ex-husband.

Name: Senna
One-line: A documentary on Brazilian Formula One racing driver Ayrton Senna, who won the F1 world championship three times before his death at age 34.

Name: Inception
One-line: A thief who steals corporate secrets through the use of dream-sharing technology is given the inverse task of planting an idea into the mind of a C.E.O., but his tragic past may doom the project and his team to disaster.

Name: Hero
One-line: A defense officer, Nameless, was summoned by the King of Qin regarding his success of terminating three warriors.

Name: Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory
One-line: A poor but hopeful boy seeks one of the five coveted golden tickets that will send him on a tour of Willy Wonka's mysterious chocolate factory.

Name: On Golden Pond
One-line: Norman is a curmudgeon with an estranged relationship with his daughter Chelsea. At Golden Pond, he and his wife nevertheless agree to care for Billy, the son of Chelsea's new boyfriend, and a most unexpected relationship blooms.

Name: Dark Passage
One-line: A man convicted of murdering his wife escapes from prison and works with a woman to try to prove his innocence.

Name: Force of Evil
One-line: An unethical lawyer who wants to help his older brother becomes a partner with a client in the numbers racket.

Name: The Fabelmans
One-line: Growing up in post-World War II era Arizona, young Sammy Fabelman aspires to become a filmmaker as he reaches adolescence, but soon discovers a shattering family secret and explores how the power of films can help him see the truth.

Name: The Big Red One
One-line: A hardened sergeant and the four core members of his infantry unit try to survive World War II as they move from battle to battle throughout Europe.

Name: Claire's Knee
One-line: On lakeside summer holiday, a conflicted older man is dared to have a flirt with two beautiful teenage half-sisters despite his betrothal to a diplomat's daughter and the fact that the girls have boyfriends.

Name: The Fog of War
One-line: The story of America as seen through the eyes of the former Secretary of Defense under President John F. Kennedy and President Lyndon B. Johnson, Robert McNamara.

Name: The Plague Dogs
One-line: Two dogs escape from a laboratory and are hunted as possible carriers of the bubonic plague.

Name: Interrogation
One-line: Tonia goes out drinking. She wakes up in prison, not having a clue why she's there. She is tortured to encourage her to confess to a crime she is not aware of.

Name: The Two of Us
One-line: In German-occupied France, a Jewish child is sent away from his family and conceals his religious affiliation from the anti-Semitic elderly man that takes care of him.

Name: One More Time with Feeling
One-line: Explores the creative process of Nick Cave and his band as the singer struggles with an unspoken personal tragedy.

Name: One Way Passage
One-line: A terminally ill woman and a debonair murderer facing execution meet and fall in love on a trans-Pacific crossing, each without knowing the other's secret.

Name: Saban, Son of Saban
One-line: Husamettin the commander in the army is constantly bothered by the stupidity of one of his soldiers Saban. After discharge from the army, Saban and his friend Ramazan work in a night club ... See full summary »

Name: Jeremiah Johnson
One-line: A mountain man who wishes to live the life of a hermit becomes the unwilling object of a long vendetta by the Crow tribe and proves to be a match for their warriors in single combat on the early frontier.

Name: Morocco
One-line: A cabaret singer and a Legionnaire fall in love, but their relationship is complicated by the results of his womanizing and the appearance of a rich man who wants her for himself.

Name: Sacco & Vanzetti
One-line: In 1920s Boston, Italian immigrants Nicola Sacco and Bartolomeo Vanzetti are scrutinized for their anarchist beliefs while on trial for robbery and murder.

Name: Dead Ringers
One-line: Twin gynecologists take full advantage of the fact that nobody can tell them apart, until their relationship begins to deteriorate over a woman.

Name: The Picture of Dorian Gray
One-line: A corrupt young man somehow keeps his youthful beauty, but a special painting gradually reveals his inner ugliness to all.

Name: Three Outlaw Samurai
One-line: When poor peasants kidnap a magistrate's daughter to coerce him into reducing their unfair taxes, a wandering ronin decides to give them some help.

Name: Easy Living
One-line: When a wealthy banker throws his wife's expensive fur coat off a roof and it lands on the head of a stenographer, everyone assumes she is his mistress and has access to his millions.

Name: Lady and the Tramp
Actors: ['Wilfred Jackson', 'Hamilton Luske', 'Jack Cutting', 'Barbara Luddy', 'Larry Roberts', 'Peggy Lee', 'Bill Thompson']
One-line: The romantic tale of a sheltered uptown Cocker Spaniel dog and a streetwise downtown Mutt.

Name: L'armata Brancaleone
One-line: A group of misfits, headed by an incompetent knight named Brancaleone, set out to reach the small town of Aurocastro so that their leader can take possession of the fief.

Name: Went the Day Well?
One-line: An English village is occupied by disguised German paratroopers as an advance post for a planned invasion.

Name: The Love Parade
One-line: The queen of mythical Sylvania marries a courtier, who finds his new life unsatisfying.

Name: Rope
One-line: Two men attempt to prove they committed the perfect crime by hosting a dinner party after strangling their former classmate to death.

Name: Before Midnight
One-line: We meet Jesse and Celine nine years on in Greece. Almost two decades have passed since their first meeting on that train bound for Vienna.

Name: The Postman
Actors: ['Massimo Troisi', 'Massimo Troisi', 'Philippe Noiret', 'Maria Grazia Cucinotta', 'Renato Scarpa']
One-line: A simple Italian postman learns to love poetry while delivering mail to a famous poet, and then uses this to woo local beauty Beatrice.

Name: The Piano Teacher
One-line: A young man romantically pursues his masochistic piano teacher.

Name: Seance on a Wet Afternoon
One-line: A medium and her husband stage a kidnapping in order for her to pretend to solve the crime and achieve fame.

Name: Escape from Alcatraz
One-line: Alcatraz is the most secure prison of its time. It is believed that no one can ever escape from it, until three daring men make a possibly successful attempt at escaping from one of the most infamous prisons in the world.

Name: RRR
Actors: ['N.T. Rama Rao Jr.', 'Ram Charan', 'Ajay Devgn', 'Alia Bhatt']
One-line: A fearless warrior on a perilous mission comes face to face with a steely cop serving British forces in this epic saga set in pre-independent India.

Name: Touki Bouki
One-line: Mory, a cowherd, and Anta, a university student, try to make money in order to go to Paris and leave their boring past behind.

Name: Martha
One-line: After the death of her abusive father, the lonely librarian Martha marries an equally vile businessman - Helmut. The cruel and torturous nature of their relationship leads Martha to believe Helmut might be trying to kill her.

Name: The Eight Diagram Pole Fighter
One-line: Mongols with the help of an insider, ambush the influential Yang Family, defenders of the dynasty. The Mongols must hunt down all Yang survivors so their insidious plot to overthrow the dynasty will not be uncovered.

Name: Hedwig and the Angry Inch
One-line: A gender-queer punk-rock singer from East Berlin tours the U.S. with her band as she tells her life story and follows the former lover/band-mate who stole her songs.

Name: I Remember Mama
One-line: A young writer recalls her ups and downs of growing up as one of four children to Norwegian immigrant parents in 1910s San Francisco.

Name: I Am Not Your Negro
Actors: ['Samuel L. Jackson', 'James Baldwin', 'Martin Luther King', 'Malcolm X']
One-line: Writer James Baldwin tells the story of race in modern America with his unfinished novel, Remember This House.

Name: Italianamerican
One-line: Martin Scorsese interviews his mother and father about their life in New York City and the family history back in Sicily. These are two people who have lived together for a long time and know each other very well.

Name: After Hours
One-line: An ordinary word processor has the worst night of his life after he agrees to visit a girl in Soho he met that evening at a coffee shop.

Name: Lonely Are the Brave
One-line: A fiercely independent cowboy gets himself locked up in prison to escape with an old friend.

Name: The Sandglass
One-line: Józef visits his dying father at a remote mental institution, where time itself doesn't seem to exist, and the line between dreams and memories becomes indistinguishable.

Name: Since You Went Away
Actors: ['Edward F. Cline', 'Tay Garnett', 'David O. Selznick', 'Claudette Colbert', 'Jennifer Jones', 'Joseph Cotten', 'Shirley Temple']
One-line: With her husband away to fight in World War II, a housewife must care for their two daughters alone.

Name: The Breaking Point
One-line: An otherwise moral captain of a charter boat becomes financially strapped and is drawn into illegal activities in order to keep up payments on his boat.

Name: Village of the Damned
One-line: In the English village of Midwich, the blonde-haired, glowing-eyed children of uncertain paternity prove to have frightening powers.

Name: Unfaithfully Yours
One-line: A man dreams of revenge when he suspects his wife is unfaithful.

Name: Atonement
One-line: Thirteen-year-old fledgling writer Briony Tallis irrevocably changes the course of several lives when she accuses her older sister's lover of a crime he did not commit.

Name: The Hunt
One-line: A teacher lives a lonely life, all the while struggling over his son's custody. His life slowly gets better as he finds love and receives good news from his son, but his new luck is about to be brutally shattered by an innocent little lie.

Name: The Unfaithful Wife
One-line: A man begins to believe his wife is cheating on him.

Name: The Broken Landlord
One-line: The landlord of a village in eastern Turkey decides to sell his land after a severe drought and migrates to Istanbul with his family. However the struggle for survival in the 'big city' will not be easier for them.

Name: Barefoot Gen
One-line: A powerful statement against war, Barefoot Gen is a disturbing story about the effect of the atomic bomb on a boy's life and the lives of the Japanese people.

Name: The Wolf Man
One-line: Larry Talbot returns to his father's castle in Wales and meets a beautiful woman. One fateful night, Talbot escorts her to a local carnival where they meet a mysterious gypsy fortune teller.

Name: Poetry
One-line: A sixty-something woman, faced with the discovery of a heinous family crime and in the early stages of Alzheimer's disease, finds strength and purpose when she enrolls in a poetry class.

Name: Ugly, Dirty and Bad
One-line: Four generations of a family live in a shantytown in the outskirts of Rome. The household engages in various forms of sexual idiosyncrasies, land swindles, incest, drugs and adultery.

Name: Play It Again, Sam
One-line: A neurotic film critic obsessed with the movie Casablanca (1942) attempts to get over his wife leaving him by dating again with the help of a married couple and his illusory idol, Humphrey Bogart.

Name: Devils on the Doorstep
One-line: Villagers in World War II China are unsure what to do with the two enemy prisoners who have been left in their care.

Name: Lagaan: Once Upon a Time in India
One-line: The people of a small village in Victorian India stake their future on a game of cricket against their ruthless British rulers.

Name: Voyage to Cythera
One-line: An old communist returns to Greece after 32 years in the Soviet Union. However, things aren't the way he had hoped for.

Name: Up
One-line: 78-year-old Carl Fredricksen travels to Paradise Falls in his house equipped with balloons, inadvertently taking a young stowaway.

Name: Performance
One-line: A violent East London gangster undergoes a transformation of identity while hiding from his former colleagues in the home of a jaded Bohemian rock star and his two girlfriends.

Name: Padre Padrone
One-line: The son of a shepherd embarks in the quest of emancipating himself from a tough lifestyle that his condition and his father force on him.

Name: Salaam Bombay!
One-line: Young Krishna struggles to survive among the drug dealers, pimps, and prostitutes in the back alleys and gutters of India.

Name: Kings Row
One-line: The dark side and hypocrisy of provincial American life is seen through the eyes of five children as they grow to adulthood at the turn of the century.

Name: Ritual
One-line: A disillusioned filmmaker has an encounter with a young girl who has a ritual of repeating "Tomorrow is my birthday" everyday. He tries to communicate with her through his video camera.

Name: The Goddess
One-line: A young woman is deemed a goddess when her father-in-law, a rich feudal land-lord, has a dream envisioning her as an avatar of Kali.

Name: Cyrano de Bergerac
One-line: Famed swordsman and poet Cyrano de Bergerac is in love with his cousin Roxane. He has never expressed his love for her as he his large nose undermines his self-confidence. Then he finds a way to express his love to her, indirectly.

Name: American History X
One-line: Living a life marked by violence, neo-Nazi Derek finally goes to prison after killing two black youths. Upon his release, Derek vows to change; he hopes to prevent his brother, Danny, who idolizes Derek, from following in his footsteps.

Name: Jai Bhim
One-line: When a tribal man is arrested for a case of alleged theft, his wife turns to a human-rights lawyer to help bring justice.

Name: Requiem for a Dream
One-line: The drug-induced utopias of four Coney Island people are shattered when their addictions run deep..

Name: 49 Up
One-line: Director Michael Apted revisits the same group of British-born adults after a seven-year wait. The subjects are interviewed as to the changes that have occurred in their lives during the last seven years.

Name: Invention for Destruction
One-line: An evil millionaire named Artigas plans to use a super-explosive device to conquer the world from his headquarters inside an enormous volcano.

Name: Old Yeller
One-line: A teenage boy grows to love a stray yellow dog while helping his mother and younger brother run their Texas homestead while their father is away on a cattle drive. First thought to be good-for-nothing mutt, Old Yeller is soon beloved by all.

Name: They Were Expendable
One-line: A Navy commander fights to prove the battle-worthiness of the PT boat at the start of World War II.

Name: Love Story
One-line: A boy and a girl from different backgrounds fall in love regardless of their upbringing - and then tragedy strikes.

Name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
One-line: A cash-strapped documentary maker decides to make his newest documentary about a mollusk shell he finds living in his Airbnb with his friends.

Name: A Passage to India
One-line: Cultural mistrust and false accusations doom a friendship in British colonial India between an Indian doctor, an Englishwoman engaged to marry a city magistrate, and an English educator.

Name: Rye Lane
One-line: Two youngsters reeling from bad breakups connect over an eventful day in South London.

Name: 7th Heaven
One-line: A street cleaner saves a young woman's life, and the pair slowly fall in love until war intervenes.

Name: Mystic River
One-line: The tragic murder of a 19-year-old girl reunites three childhood friends still living in Boston--the victim's gangster father, a detective, and the disturbed man they both suspect of killing her.

Name: The Desert of the Tartars
One-line: Lieutenant Giovanni Drogo is assigned to the old Bastiani border fortress where he expects an imminent attack by nomadic fearsome Tartars.

Name: The Blues Brothers
One-line: Jake Blues rejoins with his brother Elwood after being released from prison, but the duo has just days to reunite their old R&B band and save the Catholic home where the two were raised, outrunning the police as they tear through Chicago.

Name: Seduced and Abandoned
One-line: A desperate Sicilian man, whose 15-year-old daughter was seduced and impregnated by his older daughter's fiancé, tries to find a way to save the family's honor.

Name: Pitfall
One-line: A man wanders into a seemingly deserted town with his young son in search of work. But after a bit of bad luck, he joins the town's population of lost souls.

Name: Center Stage
Actors: ['Maggie Cheung', 'Han Chin', 'Tony Ka Fai Leung', 'Carina Lau']
One-line: Biopic of 1930s Chinese actress Lingyu Ruan.

Name: Hope
One-line: Story of an 8-year-old girl who faces a horrible rape that damages her internally and affects her emotionally, trying to overcome all the obstacles following the incident with the good support of those around her.

Name: The Cameraman
One-line: Hopelessly in love with a woman working at MGM Studios, a clumsy man attempts to become a motion-picture cameraman to be close to the object of his desire.

Name: Bitter Rice
One-line: Two criminals on the run end up working in a rice field and decide to recruit other workers for their next robbery.

Name: Are You There God? It's Me, Margaret.
One-line: When her family moves from the city to the suburbs, 11-year-old Margaret navigates new friends, feelings, and the beginning of adolescence.

Name: El Norte
Actors: ['Zaide Silvia Gutiérrez', 'David Villalpando', 'Ernesto Gómez Cruz', 'Alicia del Lago']
One-line: After their family is killed in a government massacre, siblings Enrique and Rosa flee Guatemala and embark on a perilous journey to "El Norte": the United States.

Name: The Ear
One-line: After coming home from a Party gathering one night, a Czech official becomes convinced that he is about to be the subject of a political purge and tries to do damage control, while also dealing with his turbulent marriage.

Name: The Tree of Life
One-line: The story of a family in Waco, Texas in 1956. The eldest son witnesses the loss of innocence and struggles with his parents' conflicting teachings.

Name: Hope
One-line: When one of his horses is killed by an automobile, and when it is clear that neither justice nor charity will prevail, the man begins a slow slide into despair. On the advice of a local ... See full summary »

Name: The Great Ziegfeld
One-line: The ups and downs of Florenz Ziegfeld Jr., famed producer of extravagant stage revues, are portrayed.

Name: Curse of the Demon
One-line: American professor John Holden arrives in London for a parapsychology conference, only to find himself investigating the mysterious actions of Devil-worshipper Julian Karswell.

Name: Barren Lives
One-line: A poor family in the Northeast of Brazil (Fabiano, the father; Sinhá Vitória, the mother; their 2 children and a dog called Baleia) wander about the barren land searching for a better place... See full summary »

Name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
One-line: A father's wish magically brings a wooden boy to life in Italy, giving him a chance to care for the child.

Name: One False Move
One-line: A small town police chief awaits the arrival of a gang of killers.

Name: Platform
One-line: A theatre troupe from rural Fenyang struggles under the decline of communism and rise of popular culture in China in the 1980s.

Name: Bloody Sunday
One-line: A dramatization of the Irish civil rights protest march and subsequent massacre by British troops on January 30, 1972.

Name: The Child
One-line: Bruno and Sonia, a young couple living off her benefit and the thefts committed by his gang, have a new source of money: their newborn son.

Name: Caged
One-line: A gentle, naive, pregnant 19-year-old widow is slowly, inexorably ground down by the hardened criminals, sadistic guards, and matron at a woman's prison. Will she be the same person when her sentence is up?

Name: High Sierra
One-line: After being released from prison, notorious thief Roy Earle is hired by his old boss to help a group of inexperienced criminals plan and carry out the robbery of a California resort.

Name: To Be and to Have
One-line: A documentary portrait of a one-room school in rural France, where the students (ranging in age from 4 to 11) are educated by a single dedicated teacher.

Name: Whisper of the Heart
One-line: A love story between a girl who loves reading books, and a boy who has previously checked out all of the library books she chooses.

Name: High Hopes
One-line: The life of a working class couple living in London and their complicated relationships with other members of the family.

Name: The Stranger
One-line: A well-off family is paid an unexpected, and rather unwanted, visit by a man claiming to be the woman's long-lost uncle. The initial suspicion with which they greet the man slowly dissolves as he regales them with stories of his travels.

Name: The Untouchables
Actors: ['Kevin Costner', 'Sean Connery', 'Robert De Niro', 'Charles Martin Smith']
One-line: During Prohibition, Treasury agent Eliot Ness sets out to stop ruthless Chicago gangster Al Capone, and assembles a small, incorruptible team to help him.

Name: Damnation
One-line: A lonely barfly falls in love with a married bar singer.

Name: Show People
One-line: A young lady from Georgia goes to Hollywood in the hopes of becoming an actress.

Name: The Last Temptation of Christ
One-line: The life of Jesus Christ, his journey through life as he faces the struggles all humans do, and his final temptation on the cross.

Name: Close
One-line: The intense friendship between two thirteen-year old boys Leo and Remi suddenly gets disrupted. Struggling to understand what has happened, Léo approaches Sophie, Rémi's mother. "Close" is a film about friendship and responsibility.

Name: Long Day's Journey Into Night
One-line: At the end of a long and hot summer day, members of one family gather in a large house. Everyone has something painful and offensive to say, and their silence is even worse.

Name: The Hurt Locker
One-line: During the Iraq War, a Sergeant recently assigned to an army bomb squad is put at odds with his squad mates due to his maverick way of handling his work.

Name: The Tale of Zatoichi
One-line: The adventures of a blind, gambling masseur who also happens to be a master swordsman.

Name: Filantropica
One-line: Ovidiu, a high-school teacher looking for an extra buck, finds an unexpected way to earn easy money.

Name: The Innocent
One-line: Tullio Hermil is a chauvinist aristocrat who flaunts his mistress to his wife, but when he believes she has been unfaithful, he becomes enamored of her again.

Name: Sunday Bloody Sunday
One-line: The emotional intricacies of a polyamorous relationship between young artist Bob and his two lovers: a lonely male doctor and a frustrated female office worker.

Name: The Sand Pebbles
One-line: In 1926, a U.S. Naval engineer gets assigned to a gunboat on a rescue mission in war-torn China.

Name: The Secret of NIMH
One-line: To save her ill son, a field mouse must seek the aid of a colony of rats, with whom she has a deeper link than she suspected.

Name: The Chaos Class Is on Vacation
One-line: Hababam Sinifi (The Chaos Class) continue to their adventures. Now first female students of the school history joins to the class and all Hababam Sinifi fight each other for them at first ... See full summary »

Name: Carlito's Way
One-line: A Puerto Rican former convict, just released from prison, pledges to stay away from drugs and violence despite the pressure around him and lead on to a better life outside of N.Y.C.

Name: The Class
One-line: Teacher and novelist François Bégaudeau plays a version of himself as he negotiates a year with his racially mixed students from a tough Parisian neighborhood.

Name: The Wheel
One-line: A railway engineer adopts a young girl orphaned by a train crash. Years later when she starts getting suitors, he grapples with whether or not to tell her the truth about her parentage.

Name: Who Killed Captain Alex?
One-line: Uganda's president gives Captain Alex an assignment to defeat the Tiger Mafia, but he gets killed in the process. Upon hearing the tragic news, his brother investigates to avenge Alex's death.

Name: Star Trek II: The Wrath of Khan
One-line: With the assistance of the Enterprise crew, Admiral Kirk must stop an old nemesis, Khan Noonien Singh, from using the life-generating Genesis Device as the ultimate weapon.

Name: Ghost in the Shell
One-line: A cyborg policewoman and her partner hunt a mysterious and powerful hacker called the Puppet Master.

Name: Michael Madana Kama Rajan
One-line: A comedy of errors with identical quadruplets, separated at birth, coming together as adults.

Name: Our Family
One-line: A love story between a poor man and a rich girl. The rich girl's father tries to prevent their marriage and he declares a war against the poor boy's family.

Name: Winchester '73
One-line: A cowboy's obsession with a stolen rifle leads to a bullet-ridden odyssey through the American West.

Name: Son of Saul
One-line: A Jewish-Hungarian concentration camp prisoner sets out to give a child he mistook for his son a proper burial.

Name: The Swimming Pool
One-line: Lovers Marianne and Jean-Paul spend their vacation in a villa on the French Riviera near St-Tropez. Marianne invites her former lover, Harry, and his teenage daughter, Penelope, to stay. Tension rises between them, especially when Jean-Paul seduces Penelope.

Name: Sonatine
One-line: Several yakuza from Tokyo are sent to Okinawa to help end a gang war. The war then escalates and the Tokyo drifters decide to lay low at the beach.

Name: Awaara
One-line: A poor young man named Raj joins a criminal gang to feed his mother. But when he falls in love with Rita, he decides to reform himself for her.

Name: Leaving Las Vegas
One-line: Ben Sanderson, a Hollywood screenwriter who lost everything because of his alcoholism, arrives in Las Vegas to drink himself to death. There, he meets and forms an uneasy friendship and non-interference pact with prostitute Sera.

Name: Kumbalangi Nights
One-line: The film revolves around four brothers who share a love-hate relationship with each other. Their relationship progresses to another level when Saji, Boney, and Franky decide to help Bobby stand by his love.

Name: The Pit and the Pendulum
One-line: In the sixteenth century, Francis Barnard travels to Spain to clarify the strange circumstances of his sister's death after she had married the son of a cruel Spanish Inquisitor.

Name: Ulysses' Gaze
One-line: An exiled filmmaker finally returns to his home country where former mysteries and afflictions of his early life come back to haunt him once more.

Name: The Twelve Tasks of Asterix
Actors: ['Henri Gruel', 'Albert Uderzo', 'Pierre Watrin', 'Matt McCarthy', 'Roger Carel', 'Jacques Morel', 'Pierre Tornade', 'Henri Labussière']
One-line: Asterix and Obelix are tasked by Julius Caesar with accomplishing twelve impossible labors to determine the fate of their indomitable Gaulish village.

Name: Lilya 4-Ever
One-line: Sixteen-year-old Lilja and her only friend, the young boy Volodja, live in Russia, fantasizing about a better life. One day, Lilja falls in love with Andrej, who is going to Sweden, and invites Lilja to come along and start a new life.

Name: After the Thin Man
One-line: Private detective Nick Charles and his wealthy wife Nora are back home at last and hoping for a quiet New Year when there is a murder. The obvious suspect is his wife, Nora's cousin, Selma.

Name: A Better Tomorrow
One-line: A reforming ex-gangster tries to reconcile with his estranged policeman brother, but the ties to his former gang are difficult to break.

Name: Mysteries of Lisbon
One-line: Follows a jealous countess, a wealthy businessman, and a young orphaned boy across Portugal, France, Italy and Brazil where they connect with a variety of mysterious individuals.

Name: Kannathil Muthamittal
One-line: A little girl is told by her parents that she is adopted. Determined to find her real mother, she begs to be taken to Sri Lanka, where her mother works with a militant group of activists.

Name: I Want to Live!
One-line: A prostitute, sentenced to death for murder, pleads her innocence.

Name: Murder, My Sweet
One-line: After being hired to find an ex-con's former girlfriend, Philip Marlowe is drawn into a deeply complex web of mystery and deceit.

Name: Meet John Doe
One-line: A penniless drifter is recruited by an ambitious columnist to impersonate a non-existent person who said he'd be committing suicide as a protest, and a social movement begins.

Name: Tenebrae
One-line: An American novelist visiting Rome to promote his latest book is stalked and harassed by an obsessed fan who is committing a string of murders that appear to be tributes to his work.

Name: An Actor's Revenge
One-line: Yukinojo, a Kabuki actor, seeks revenge by destroying the three men who caused the deaths of his parents. Also involved are the daughter of one of Yukinojo's targets, two master thieves, and a swordsman who himself is out to kill Yukinojo.

Name: Somebody Up There Likes Me
One-line: Boxer Rocky Graziano's biopic, based on his autobiography, from childhood to his World Middleweight Championship title win at age 28 in 1947.

Name: You Can Count on Me
One-line: A single mother's life is thrown into turmoil after her struggling, rarely seen younger brother returns to town.

Name: The Handmaiden
One-line: A woman is hired as a handmaiden to a Japanese heiress, but secretly she is involved in a plot to defraud her.

Name: Kill Bill: Vol. 2
One-line: The Bride continues her quest of vengeance against her former boss and lover Bill, the reclusive bouncer Budd, and the treacherous, one-eyed Elle.

Name: Advise & Consent
One-line: The polarizing search for a new Secretary of State has far-reaching consequences.

Name: Evil Dead II
One-line: Ash Williams, the lone survivor of an earlier onslaught of flesh-possessing spirits, holes up in a cabin with a group of strangers while the demons continue their attack.

Name: The Royal Tenenbaums
One-line: The eccentric members of a dysfunctional family reluctantly gather under the same roof for various reasons.

Name: Matewan
One-line: A labor union organizer comes to an embattled mining community brutally and violently dominated and harassed by the mining company.

Name: Witchhammer
One-line: In the 1600s, an overzealous clergy hauls innocent women in front of tribunals, forces them to confess to imaginary witchery, and engages in brutal torture and persecution of their subjects.

Name: A Christmas Story
One-line: In the 1940s, a young boy named Ralphie Parker attempts to convince his parents, teacher, and Santa Claus that a Red Ryder Range 200 Shot BB gun really is the perfect Christmas gift.

Name: Ghostbusters
One-line: Three parapsychologists forced out of their university funding set up shop as a unique ghost removal service in New York City, attracting frightened yet skeptical customers.

Name: She Wore a Yellow Ribbon
One-line: Captain Nathan Brittles, on the eve of retirement, takes out a last patrol to stop an impending massive Indian attack. Encumbered by women who must be evacuated, Brittles finds his mission imperiled.

Name: Anand
One-line: The story of a terminally ill man who wishes to live life to the fullest before the inevitable occurs, as told by his best friend.

Name: The Big Gundown
One-line: An unofficial lawman and would-be senator is tasked by a railroad baron with hunting down a knife-wielding Mexican peasant accused of raping and killing a young girl.

Name: Cure
One-line: A frustrated detective deals with the case of several gruesome murders committed by people who have no recollection of what they've done.

Name: Out of Africa
One-line: In 20th-century colonial Kenya, a Danish baroness/plantation owner has a passionate love affair with a free-spirited big-game hunter.

Name: The Silent Partner
One-line: A timid bank teller anticipates a bank robbery and steals the money himself before the crook arrives. When the sadistic crook realizes he's been fooled, he tracks down the teller and engages him in a cat-and-mouse chase for the cash.

Name: Little Shop of Horrors
One-line: A nerdy florist finds his chance for success and romance with the help of a giant man-eating plant who demands to be fed.

Name: The Honeymoon Killers
Actors: ['Donald Volkman', 'Shirley Stoler', 'Tony Lo Bianco', 'Mary Jane Higby', 'Doris Roberts']
One-line: An obese, embittered nurse doesn't mind if her toupee-wearing boyfriend romances and fleeces other women, as long as he takes her along on his con jobs.

Name: The Jungle Book
One-line: Bagheera the Panther and Baloo the Bear have a difficult time trying to convince a boy to leave the jungle for human civilization.

Name: Fantozzi
One-line: A good-natured but unlucky Italian is constantly getting into difficult situations, but never loses his positive mood.

Name: Mad Max: Fury Road
One-line: In a post-apocalyptic wasteland, a woman rebels against a tyrannical ruler in search for her homeland with the aid of a group of female prisoners, a psychotic worshiper and a drifter named Max.

Name: The Incident
One-line: Late one night, two young toughs hold hostage the passengers in one car of a New York subway train.

Name: Steamboat Bill, Jr.
One-line: The effete son of a cantankerous riverboat captain comes to join his father's crew.

Name: Targets
One-line: An aging horror star questions his place in modern Hollywood, while a disturbed young man goes on a killing spree.

Name: Love Letter
One-line: When exchanging letters two women discover new things about a man they knew.

Name: Henry V
One-line: In the midst of the Hundred Years War, the young King Henry V of England embarks on the conquest of France in 1415.

Name: The Long Gray Line
One-line: In 1898, Irish immigrant Martin Maher is hired as a civilian employee at West Point where, during a 50-year career, he rises to the rank of NCO and instructor.

Name: Charley Varrick
One-line: A man, his wife and their friend stage a bloody bank robbery without realizing they are stealing from the Mob.

Name: Born on the Fourth of July
One-line: The biography of Ron Kovic. Paralyzed in the Vietnam war, he becomes an anti-war and pro-human rights political activist after feeling betrayed by the country for which he fought.

Name: I Walked with a Zombie
One-line: A nurse is hired to care for the wife of a sugar plantation owner, who has been acting strangely, on a Caribbean island.

Name: The Greatest Show on Earth
One-line: The dramatic lives of trapeze artists, a clown, and an elephant trainer are told against a background of circus spectacle.

Name: The Promise
One-line: Roger uses his son Igor to ruthlessly traffic and exploit undocumented immigrants. When one of the immigrants is killed, Igor is guilt-ridden and wants to care for the dead man's family against his father's orders.

Name: Wheel of Fortune and Fantasy
One-line: An unexpected love triangle, a failed seduction trap and an encounter that results from a misunderstanding, told in three movements to depict three female characters and trace the trajectories between their choices and regrets.

Name: The Power of the Dog
One-line: Charismatic rancher Phil Burbank inspires fear and awe in those around him. When his brother brings home a new wife and her son, Phil torments them until he finds himself exposed to the possibility of love.

Name: Made in Hong Kong
One-line: Autumn Moon (Sam Lee), a low-rent triad living in Hong Kong, struggles to find meaning in his hopelessly violent existence.

Name: This Land Is Mine
One-line: A mild-mannered school teacher in a German-occupied town during World War II finds himself torn between collaboration and resistance.

Name: The Big Clock
One-line: A magazine tycoon commits a murder and pins it on an innocent man, who then tries to solve the murder himself.

Name: Sudden Fear
One-line: After an ambitious actor insinuates himself into the life of a wealthy middle-aged playwright and marries her, he plots with his mistress to murder her.

Name: Gintama the Movie: The Final Chapter - Be Forever Yorozuya
One-line: Gintoki travels into the future and discovers it to be a wasteland with his friends fallen apart. He reunites them to find out what went wrong and how to fix things.

Name: Lancelot of the Lake
One-line: King Arthur learns that his wife, Queen Guinevere, has been having an affair with Lancelot, who at the same time remains loyal to the king, particularly after Arthur's traitorous nephew Mordred commits an attempt on his life.

Name: Twelve Chairs
One-line: Two gentlemen of fortune from the times of Imperial Russia are looking for an uncountable treasure at the dawn of the Soviet Union age.

Name: The Dresser
One-line: Personal assistant Norman struggles to get deteriorating veteran actor Sir through a difficult performance of King Lear.

Name: Nine Queens
One-line: Two con artists try to swindle a stamp collector by selling him a sheet of counterfeit rare stamps (the "nine queens").

Name: Argo
One-line: Acting under the cover of a Hollywood producer scouting a location for a science fiction film, a CIA agent launches a dangerous operation to rescue six Americans in Tehran during the U.S. hostage crisis in Iran in 1979.

Name: Black Swan
One-line: Nina is a talented but unstable ballerina on the verge of stardom. Pushed to the breaking point by her artistic director and a seductive rival, Nina's grip on reality slips, plunging her into a waking nightmare.

Name: Body and Soul
One-line: A talented boxer's young career hits difficult terrain when an unethical promoter takes interest in him.

Name: A Nightmare on Elm Street
One-line: Teenager Nancy Thompson must uncover the dark truth concealed by her parents after she and her friends become targets of the spirit of a serial killer with a bladed glove in their dreams, in which if they die, it kills them in real life.

Name: Wise Blood
One-line: Fresh out of the army, Hazel Motes attempts to open the first Church Without Christ in the small town of Taulkinham.

Name: An Angel at My Table
One-line: Janet Frame was a brilliant child who, as a teen, was misdiagnosed with schizophrenia. Explore Janet's discovery of the world and her life in Europe as her books are published to acclaim.

Name: Courier
One-line: The story of a teenager boy in times of the comunism fall in the Soviet Union.

Name: Head-On
One-line: With the intention to break free from the strict familial restrictions, a suicidal young woman sets up a marriage of convenience with a forty-year-old addict, an act that will lead to an outburst of envious love.

Name: Songs from the Second Floor
One-line: Where are we humans going? A film poem inspired by the Peruvian poet César Vallejo. We meet people in the city. People trying to communicate, searching compassion and get the connection of small and large things.

Name: The Steel Helmet
One-line: A ragtag group of American stragglers battles against superior Communist troops in an abandoned Buddhist temple during the Korean War.

Name: Manufacturing Consent: Noam Chomsky and the Media
Actors: ['Peter Wintonick', 'Noam Chomsky', 'Mark Achbar', 'Karin Aguilar-San Juan', 'Paul Andrews']
One-line: A film about the noted American linguist/political dissident and his warning about corporate media's role in modern propaganda.

Name: Mississippi Burning
One-line: Two F.B.I. Agents with wildly different styles arrive in Mississippi to investigate the disappearance of some civil rights activists.

Name: Full Metal Jacket
One-line: A pragmatic U.S. Marine observes the dehumanizing effects the Vietnam War has on his fellow recruits from their brutal boot camp training to the bloody street fighting in Hue.

Name: Road to Morocco
One-line: Two carefree castaways on a desert shore find an Arabian Nights city, where they compete for the luscious Princess Shalmar.

Name: Her
One-line: In a near future, a lonely writer develops an unlikely relationship with an operating system designed to meet his every need.

Name: Innocence
One-line: Yusuf is released from prison after serving a ten-year sentence. He is scared of life outside as he goes to an address given to him by another prisoner.

Name: The Night of the Iguana
One-line: An ostracized Episcopal clergyman leads a busload of middle-aged Baptist women on a tour of the Mexican coast and comes to terms with the failure haunting his life.

Name: Satya
One-line: An innocent man is embroiled in underworld after being falsely charged and sets out to punish the perpetrators who subjected his life to misery.

Name: Vive L'Amour
One-line: Three lonely young denizens of Taipei unknowingly share an apartment used for sexual trysts.

Name: Unfinished Piece for the Player Piano
One-line: In Imperial Russia, the nobility has its own entertainments, disputes and worries.

Name: Marriage Italian Style
One-line: Wealthy businessman Domenico and penniless prostitute Filumena share a large part of their lives in post-WWII Italy.

Name: The Devil and Miss Jones
One-line: A tycoon goes undercover to ferret out agitators at a department store, but gets involved in their lives instead.

Name: The Son
One-line: A joinery instructor at a rehab center refuses to take a new teen as his apprentice, but then begins to follow the boy through the hallways and streets.

Name: Fight Club
One-line: An insomniac office worker and a devil-may-care soap maker form an underground fight club that evolves into much more.

Name: Interstella 5555: The 5tory of the 5ecret 5tar 5ystem
One-line: A continuation of the story told in the Daft Punk music videos "One More Time," "Aerodynamic," "Digital Love," and "Harder, Better, Faster, Stronger."

Name: Another Round
One-line: Four high-school teachers consume alcohol on a daily basis to see how it affects their social and professional lives.

Name: Last Tango in Paris
One-line: A young Parisian woman meets a middle-aged American businessman who demands their clandestine relationship be based only on sex.

Name: Nebraska
One-line: An aging, booze-addled father makes the trip from Montana to Nebraska with his estranged son in order to claim a million-dollar Mega Sweepstakes Marketing prize.

Name: Orlando
One-line: After Queen Elizabeth I commands him not to grow old, a young nobleman struggles with love and his place in the world.

Name: 5 Fingers
One-line: During WWII the valet to the British Ambassador to Ankara sells British secrets to the Germans while trying to romance a refugee Polish countess.

Name: 13th
One-line: An in-depth look at the prison system in the United States and how it reveals the nation's history of racial inequality.

Name: Sons of the Desert
One-line: When Stan and Ollie trick their wives into thinking that they are taking a medicinal cruise while they're actually going to a convention, the wives find out the truth the hard way.

Name: A Scene at the Sea
One-line: The lives of a young, hearing-impaired and gloomy couple are fulfilled after the boy holds interest in surfboarding.

Name: Mishima: A Life in Four Chapters
One-line: A fictionalized account in four chapters of the life of celebrated Japanese writer Yukio Mishima.

Name: The Grand Budapest Hotel
One-line: A writer encounters the owner of an aging high-class hotel, who tells him of his early years serving as a lobby boy in the hotel's glorious years under an exceptional concierge.

Name: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
One-line: Harry Potter, Ron and Hermione return to Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry for their third year of study, where they delve into the mystery surrounding an escaped prisoner who poses a dangerous threat to the young wizard.

Name: The Woman in the Window
One-line: When a conservative middle aged professor engages in a relationship with a femme fatale, he's plunged into a nightmarish world of blackmail and murder.

Name: Trial on the Road
One-line: A Soviet POW joins the partisan guerrillas and proves his loyalty fighting the Germans.

Name: The Duellists
One-line: France, 1801. Due to a minor perceived slight, mild-mannered Lieutenant d'Hubert is forced into a duel with hot-headed irrational Lieutenant Feraud. The disagreement ultimately results in scores of duels spanning several years.

Name: Home from the Hill
One-line: Dramatic story of the influential Hunnicutt family set in Texas during the late 1950s.

Name: Street Angel
One-line: A woman on the run from the law finds her past catching up to her just as she is on the verge of true happiness.

Name: Vera Drake
One-line: Abortionist Vera Drake finds her beliefs and practices clash with the mores of 1950s Britain--a conflict that leads to tragedy for her family.

Name: The Mystery of Picasso
One-line: A filmed record of Pablo Picasso painting numerous canvases for the camera, allowing us to see his creative process at work.

Name: The Breakfast Club
One-line: Five high school students meet in Saturday detention and discover how they have a great deal more in common than they thought.

Name: The Scent of Green Papaya
Actors: ['Nu Yên-Khê Tran', 'Man San Lu', 'Thi Loc Truong', 'Anh Hoa Nguyen']
One-line: A Vietnamese servant girl, Mui, observes lives within two different Saigon families: the first, a woman textile seller with three boys and a frequently absent husband; the second, a handsome young pianist with his fiancée.

Name: The Color of Paradise
One-line: The story of Mohammed, a blind Iranian boy and his father, Hashem, who is always oscillating between accepting his son as he is and abandoning him, as he represents a burden for him, after the loss of his wife.

Name: Uncle Boonmee Who Can Recall His Past Lives
One-line: Dying of kidney disease, a man spends his last, somber days with family, including the ghost of his wife and a forest spirit who used to be his son, on a rural northern Thailand farm.

Name: Goodbye, Dragon Inn
One-line: On a dark, wet night a historic and regal Chinese cinema sees its final film. Together with a small handful of souls they bid "Goodbye, Dragon Inn".

Name: Heroes of the East
One-line: A Chinese man (Liu) marries a Japanese woman through an arranged marriage and manages to insult all of her Japanese martial arts family by issuing a challenge to her that is misinterpreted ... See full summary »

Name: Lilies of the Field
One-line: A travelling handyman becomes the answer to the prayers of nuns who wish to build a chapel in the desert.

Name: Blast of Silence
One-line: A hired killer from Cleveland has a job to do on a second-string mob boss in New York, but a special girl from his past and a gun dealer with pet rats get in his way.

Name: Summer Interlude
One-line: A lonely woman recalls her first love thirteen years prior during a brief summer vacation.

Name: Once Upon a Time in Anatolia
One-line: A group of men set out in search of a dead body in the Anatolian steppes.

Name: Mandela
One-line: A local barber's fate turns overnight when he becomes the single deciding vote in the village elections.

Name: Separate Tables
One-line: The stories of several people are told as they stay at a seaside hotel in Bournemouth which features dining at "Separate Tables."

Name: Life Is Beautiful
One-line: When an open-minded Jewish waiter and his son become victims of the Holocaust, he uses a perfect mixture of will, humor and imagination to protect his son from the dangers around their camp.

Name: Kolya
One-line: A confirmed bachelor is in for the surprise of his life when a get-rich-quick scheme backfires and leaves him with a pint-sized new roommate.

Name: Deep End
One-line: 15-year-old dropout Mike takes a job at Newford Baths, where inappropriate sexual behaviour abounds, and becomes obsessed with his coworker Susan.

Name: The Mark of Zorro
One-line: A young Spanish aristocrat must masquerade as a fop in order to maintain his secret identity of Zorro as he restores justice to early California.

Name: Women in Love
One-line: Two best friends fall in love with a pair of women, but the relationships soon go in very different directions.

Name: John Wick: Chapter 4
One-line: John Wick uncovers a path to defeating The High Table. But before he can earn his freedom, Wick must face off against a new enemy with powerful alliances across the globe and forces that turn old friends into foes.

Name: Crooks in Clover
One-line: A dying mob boss hands over his business to an old friend, Fernand. The boss' assistants want to get rid of the latter. But are the Volfoni brothers and Théo real threats? Ensuing fights and shootouts are more comical than deadly.

Name: Collective
One-line: Director Alexander Nanau follows a crack team of investigators at the Romanian newspaper Gazeta Sporturilor as they try to uncover a vast health-care fraud that enriched moguls and politicians and led to the deaths of innocent citizens.

Name: Husbands
One-line: After the death of a common friend, three married men leave their lives together, seeking pleasure and freedom and ultimately leaving for London.

Name: La La Land
One-line: While navigating their careers in Los Angeles, a pianist and an actress fall in love while attempting to reconcile their aspirations for the future.

Name: The Killing of a Chinese Bookie
One-line: A proud strip club owner is forced to come to terms with himself as a man when his gambling addiction gets him in hot water with the mob, who offer him only one alternative.

Name: Great Freedom
One-line: In post-war Germany, liberation by the Allies does not mean freedom for everyone. Hans is repeatedly imprisoned under Paragraph 175, which criminalizes homosexuality. Over the decades, he develops an unlikely bond with his cellmate Viktor.

Name: Broadway Danny Rose
One-line: In his attempts to reconcile a lounge singer with his mistress, a hapless talent agent is mistaken as her lover by a jealous gangster.

Name: Paradise Lost: The Child Murders at Robin Hood Hills
One-line: A horrific triple child murder leads to an indictment and trial of three nonconformist boys based on questionable evidence.

Name: Gimme Shelter
Actors: ['David Maysles', 'Charlotte Zwerin', 'Mick Jagger', 'Keith Richards', 'Mick Taylor', 'Charlie Watts']
One-line: When three hundred thousand members of the Love Generation collided with a few dozen Hells Angels at San Francisco's Altamont Speedway, the bloody slash that transformed a decade's dreams into disillusionment was immortalized on this film.

Name: The Circle
One-line: Various women struggle to function in the oppressively sexist society of contemporary Iran.

Name: The Wrestler
One-line: A faded professional wrestler must retire, but finds his quest for a new life outside the ring a dispiriting struggle.

Name: About Elly
One-line: The mysterious disappearance of a kindergarten teacher during a picnic in the north of Iran is followed by a series of misadventures for her fellow travelers.

Name: King of the Doormen
One-line: A janitor/doorman and his family who came to "big city" Istanbul, with the hope to live a better life. With the different characters living in the building, the story evolves around the ... See full summary »

Name: Metropolitan
One-line: A group of young upper-class Manhattanites are blithely passing through the gala debutante season, when an unusual outsider joins them and stirs them up.

Name: HyperNormalisation
One-line: Adam Curtis explains how, at a time of confusing and inexplicable world events, politicians and the people they represent have retreated in to a damaging over-simplified version of what is happening.

Name: Alphaville
One-line: A U.S. secret agent is sent to the distant space city of Alphaville where he must find a missing person and free the city from its tyrannical ruler.

Name: Gangs of Wasseypur
One-line: A clash between Sultan and Shahid Khan leads to the expulsion of Khan from Wasseypur, and ignites a deadly blood feud spanning three generations.

Name: Mediterraneo
One-line: In WW2, an Italian Army unit of misfits occupies an isolated non-strategic Greek island for the duration of the war.

Name: Topsy-Turvy
One-line: Set in the 1880s, the story of how, during a creative dry spell, the partnership of the legendary musical/theatrical writers Gilbert and Sullivan almost dissolves, before they turn it all around and write the Mikado.

Name: Apollo 13
One-line: NASA must devise a strategy to return Apollo 13 to Earth safely after the spacecraft undergoes massive internal damage putting the lives of the three astronauts on board in jeopardy.

Name: Diner
One-line: A group of college-age buddies struggle with their imminent passage into adulthood in 1959 Baltimore.

Name: Howards End
One-line: Set in the early 20th century, class distinctions and troubled relations affect the relationship between two families and the ownership of a cherished British estate known as Howards End.

Name: Ed Wood
One-line: Ambitious but troubled movie director Edward D. Wood Jr. tries his best to fulfill his dreams despite his lack of talent.

Name: The Collector
One-line: A man kidnaps a woman and holds her hostage just for the pleasure of having her there.

Name: Happening
One-line: An adaptation of Annie Ernaux's novel of the same name, looking back on her experience with abortion when it was still illegal in France in the 1960s.

Name: The Vanishing
One-line: Rex and Saskia, a young couple in love, are on vacation. They stop at a busy service station and Saskia is abducted. After three years and no sign of Saskia, Rex begins receiving letters from the abductor.

Name: The Incredible Journey
One-line: Two dogs and a cat set off on a treacherous 200-mile journey towards home.

Name: Whistle Down the Wind
One-line: When an injured wife murderer takes refuge on a remote Lancashire farm, the owner's three children mistakenly believe him to be the Second Coming of Christ.

Name: Waiting for the Hearse
One-line: Each member of this family tries to endorse someone else to care for the old Mother.

Name: Fallen Angels
One-line: This Hong Kong-set crime drama follows the lives of a hitman, hoping to get out of the business, and his elusive female partner.

Name: Jaane Bhi Do Yaaro
One-line: Two photographers, who are employed by a magazine editor to expose the scandalous activities of the rich, come across corruption by a builder and accidentally photograph a murder.

Name: Julius Caesar
One-line: The growing ambition of Julius Caesar is a source of major concern to his close friend Brutus. Cassius persuades him to participate in his plot to assassinate Caesar but they have both sorely underestimated Mark Antony.

Name: El Cid
One-line: The fabled Spanish hero Rodrigo Diaz de Vivar (a.k.a. El Cid) overcomes a family vendetta and court intrigue to defend Christian Spain against the Moors.

Name: The Great McGinty
One-line: Dan McGinty has great success in his chosen field of crooked politics, but he endangers it all in one crazy moment of honesty.

Name: Fellini Satyricon
One-line: A series of disjointed mythical tales set in first-century Rome.

Name: Pariyerum Perumal
One-line: A law student from a lower caste begins a friendship with his classmate, a girl who belongs to a higher caste, and the men in her family start giving him trouble over this.

Name: Virunga
Actors: ['André Bauma', 'Emmanuel de Merode', 'Mélanie Gouby', 'Rodrigue Mugaruka Katembo']
One-line: A team of brave individuals risk their lives to protect the last mountain gorillas.

Name: Christiane F.
One-line: A teen girl in 1970s Berlin becomes addicted to heroin. Everything in her life slowly begins to distort and disappear as she befriends a small crew of junkies and falls in love with a drug-abusing male prostitute.

Name: The Girls
One-line: Several romance stories - part funny, part sadly - set in a remote logging camp.

Name: The Southerner
One-line: The life of the poor Tucker family who worked as cotton pluggers and decided to get their own ground, but nature was against them.

Name: The Story of Qiu Ju
One-line: A peasant woman seeks justice after the headman of her village has kicked her husband in the groin.

Name: Moonlighting
One-line: Nowak (Irons), a Polish contractor, leads a group of workmen to London so they can provide cheap labor for a government official based there. Nowak must manage the project and the men as ... See full summary »

Name: Alfie
One-line: An unrepentant ladies' man gradually begins to understand the consequences of his lifestyle.

Name: Samurai III: Duel at Ganryu Island
One-line: Musashi Miyamoto is challenged to a duel by a confident swordsman Sasaki Kojiro. He agrees to fight him in a year's time.

Name: Trilogia: To livadi pou dakryzei
One-line: The story starts in 1919 with some Greek refugees from Odessa arriving somewhere near Thessaloniki. Among these people are two small kids, Alexis and Eleni.

Name: The Oak
One-line: A description of Romania before Ceausescu's downfall, through the story of Nela. Daughter of a former colonel of the Securitate, the romanian political police. She refused to become as her ... See full summary »

Name: The Sea Hawk
One-line: Geoffrey Thorpe, a buccaneer, is hired by Queen Elizabeth I to nag the Spanish Armada. The Armada is waiting for the attack on England and Thorpe surprises them with attacks on their galleons where he shows his skills on the sword.

Name: WR: Mysteries of the Organism
