One-line: An homage to the work of psychologist Wilhelm Reich, matched with a story about a Yugoslavian girl's affair with a Russian skater. Sexual repression, social systems and the orgone theory are explored.

Name: Tropical Malady
One-line: A romance between a soldier and a country boy, wrapped around a Thai folk-tale involving a shaman with shape-shifting abilities.

Name: Sahara
One-line: After the fall of Tobruk in 1942, during the Allied retreat in the Libyan desert, an American tank picks-up a motley group of survivors but they face advancing Germans and a lack of water.

Name: Christmas in July
One-line: After the co-workers of an ambitious clerk trick him into thinking he has won $25,000 in a slogan contest, he begins to use the money to fulfill his dreams. What will happen when the ruse is discovered?

Name: A Fish Called Wanda
Actors: ['John Cleese', 'John Cleese', 'Jamie Lee Curtis', 'Kevin Kline', 'Michael Palin']
One-line: In London, four very different people team up on a jewel heist, then try to double-cross one another for the loot, complicated by their efforts to fool a very proper barrister.

Name: Millennium Actress
One-line: A TV interviewer and his cameraman meet a former actress and travel through her memories and career.

Name: A Shot in the Dark
One-line: Inspector Clouseau falls in love with a murder suspect and tries to clear her name.

Name: All This, and Heaven Too
One-line: A duchess' irrational behavior toward her children's governess triggers tragic events that will change her family's lives forever.

Name: The Hours
One-line: The story of how the novel "Mrs. Dalloway" affects three generations of women, all of whom, in one way or another, have had to deal with suicide in their lives.

Name: Fire of Love
One-line: Intrepid scientists and lovers Katia and Maurice Krafft died in a volcanic explosion doing the very thing that brought them together: unraveling the mysteries of volcanoes by capturing the most explosive imagery ever recorded.

Name: Ratcatcher
One-line: A naïve young lad navigates the dirty squalid streets of 1973 Glasgow and the poor youth around him.

Name: A Few Good Men
One-line: Military lawyer Lieutenant Daniel Kaffee defends Marines accused of murder. They contend they were acting under orders.

Name: Naked Childhood
One-line: An anguished foster child takes to mischief and lies as his foster parents do their best to love and care for him. But it might be too little, too late in this emotionally devastating portrayal of the orphaned child.

Name: Driving Miss Daisy
One-line: An old Jewish woman and her African-American chauffeur in the American South have a relationship that grows and improves over the years.

Name: Midnight Express
One-line: Billy Hayes, an American college student, is caught smuggling drugs out of Turkey and thrown into prison.

Name: The Prestige
One-line: After a tragic accident, two stage magicians in 1890s London engage in a battle to create the ultimate illusion while sacrificing everything they have to outwit each other.

Name: The Mission
One-line: Eighteenth-century Spanish Jesuits try to protect a remote South American tribe in danger of falling under the rule of pro-slavery Portugal.

Name: No End in Sight
One-line: A comprehensive look at the Bush Administration's conduct of the Iraq war and its occupation of the country.

Name: Broken Blossoms or the Yellow Man and the Girl
One-line: A frail waif, abused by her brutal boxer father in London's seedy Limehouse District, is befriended by a sensitive Chinese immigrant with tragic consequences.

Name: The Little Mermaid
Actors: ['John Musker', 'Jodi Benson', 'Samuel E. Wright', 'Rene Auberjonois', 'Christopher Daniel Barnes']
One-line: A mermaid princess makes a Faustian bargain in an attempt to become human and win a prince's love.

Name: Bullet in the Head
One-line: When three close friends escape from Hong Kong to war-time Saigon to start a criminal's life, they all go through a harrowing experience which totally shatters their lives and their friendship forever.

Name: 7 Women
One-line: In 1935 China, seven dedicated missionary women try to protect themselves from the advances of a barbaric Mongolian warlord and his cut-throat gang of warriors.

Name: Burnt by the Sun
One-line: In the USSR in 1936, shadows of Stalin's repressions fall on a famous, revolutionary hero. The accusations of him being a foreign spy are nonsense, and everyone knows that. However, a slow process of his downfall has already started.

Name: The Intruder
One-line: A charismatic "social reformer" rallies the white populace of a Southern town to oppose school integration, but he soon finds himself in a situation that he cannot control.

Name: Scream of Fear
One-line: A wheelchair-bound young woman returns to her father's estate after 10 years, and although she's told he's away, she keeps seeing his dead body on the estate.

Name: Argentina, 1985
One-line: A team of lawyers takes on the heads of Argentina's bloody military dictatorship during the 1980s in a battle against odds and a race against time.

Name: Thieves' Highway
One-line: A war veteran turned truck driver attempts to avenge the crippling and robbing of his father at the hands of an amoral produce scofflaw.

Name: Cleopatra
One-line: The man-hungry Queen of Egypt leads Julius Caesar and Marc Antony astray, amid scenes of DeMillean splendor.

Name: Chupke Chupke
One-line: A newly wedded husband plays a practical joke on his wife's family with full support from his wife and friends.

Name: Peking Opera Blues
One-line: The movie is set in chaotic 1920's China, when warlords fought each other for power while Sun Yat-Sen's underground movement tried to establish a democratic republic. The movie tells the ... See full summary »

Name: My Uncle Antoine
One-line: Set in cold rural Quebec at Christmas time, we follow the coming of age of a young boy and the life of his family which owns the town's general store and undertaking business.

Name: The Prime of Miss Jean Brodie
One-line: An eccentric Scottish schoolteacher's extravagantly romantic ideas about life--and love--overly impress her young pupils and bring her into conflict with her school's conservative headmistress.

Name: The Eel
One-line: A businessman kills his adulterous wife and is sent to prison. After the release, he opens a barbershop and meets new people, talking almost to no one except an eel he befriended while in prison.

Name: Departures
One-line: Soon after buying an expensive cello, Daigo learns that his orchestra is disbanding. He moves back to his hometown with his wife, where he answers an ad for what Daigo thinks is a travel agency but is, in actuality, a mortuary.

Name: The Salt of the Earth
Actors: ['Wim Wenders', 'Sebastião Salgado', 'Wim Wenders', 'Lélia Wanick Salgado', 'Juliano Ribeiro Salgado']
One-line: The life and work of photographer Sebastião Salgado, who has spent forty years documenting societies in hidden corners of the world.

Name: Cavalcade
One-line: A portrayal of the triumphs and tragedies of two English families, the upper-crust Marryots and the working-class Bridgeses, from 1899 to 1933.

Name: Billy Elliot
One-line: A talented young boy becomes torn between his unexpected love of dance and the disintegration of his family.

Name: Patterns
One-line: When Fred Staples is recruited onto the board of a high-powered New York corporation, he finds his ethics and ambition at odds.

Name: The Best Man
One-line: The two front runners for their party's presidential nomination, one principled and the other ruthless, vie for the former president's endorsement.

Name: Bachelor Mother
One-line: An unemployed woman discovers an abandoned baby on the steps of an orphanage, and accepts an offer to take responsibility for the child in return for a job.

Name: The Lower Depths
One-line: A charismatic thief makes friends with a bankrupt baron who comes to live in the thief's slum. Meanwhile the thief seeks the love of a young woman, who is held emotionally captive by her slumlord family.

Name: Mission: Impossible - Dead Reckoning Part One
One-line: Ethan Hunt and his IMF team must track down a dangerous weapon before it falls into the wrong hands.

Name: Visaaranai
One-line: Four labourers are tortured by the police to confess to a theft they have not committed.

Name: Boys Town
One-line: When a death row prisoner tells him he wouldn't have led a life of crime if only he had had one friend as a child, Father Edward Flanagan decides to start a home for young boys.

Name: The Children's Hour
One-line: A rebellious student at a girls' school accuses two teachers of lesbianism.

Name: Underworld U.S.A.
One-line: A teenager who witnesses the murder of his father vows to exact revenge on the four mobsters involved in the killing.

Name: Theater of Blood
One-line: A Shakespearean actor takes poetic revenge on the critics who denied him recognition.

Name: Anne of the Thousand Days
One-line: King Henry VIII of England discards one wife, Catharine of Aragon, who has failed to produce a male heir, in favor of the young and beautiful Anne Boleyn.

Name: The Count of Monte Cristo
One-line: After greedy men have Edmond Dantes unjustly imprisoned for 20 years for innocently delivering a letter entrusted to him, he escapes to get his revenge on them.

Name: The Harder They Fall
One-line: An ex-sportswriter is hired by a shady fight promoter to promote his latest find, an unknown but easily exploitable rising star from Argentina.

Name: Drunken Master
One-line: Wong Fei-Hung is a mischievous yet righteous young man, but after a series of incidents his frustrated father has him disciplined by a master of drunken martial arts.

Name: Act of Violence
One-line: An embittered, vengeful POW stalks his former commanding officer who betrayed his men's planned escape attempt from a Nazi prison camp.

Name: Island of Lost Souls
One-line: A mad doctor conducts ghastly genetic experiments on a remote island in the South Seas, much to the fear and disgust of the shipwrecked sailor who finds himself trapped there.

Name: Taking Off
One-line: While searching for their runaway teenage daughter, the parents rediscover the pleasures of life as they get acquainted with a self-help group for parents of vanished children.

Name: The Full Monty
One-line: Six unemployed steel workers form a male striptease act. The women cheer them on to go for "the full monty" - total nudity.

Name: C'mon C'mon
One-line: When his sister asks him to look after her son, a radio journalist embarks on a cross-country trip with his energetic nephew to show him life away from Los Angeles.

Name: The Last Wave
One-line: A Sydney lawyer defends five Aboriginal Persons in a ritualized taboo murder and in the process learns disturbing things about himself and premonitions.

Name: Bellissima
One-line: A woman from the lower class desperately tries to get her daughter into the movies.

Name: Pride & Prejudice
One-line: Sparks fly when spirited Elizabeth Bennet meets single, rich, and proud Mr. Darcy. But Mr. Darcy reluctantly finds himself falling in love with a woman beneath his class. Can each overcome their own pride and prejudice?

Name: Reds
One-line: A radical American journalist becomes involved with the Communist revolution in Russia, and hopes to bring its spirit and idealism to the United States.

Name: Tunes of Glory
One-line: After World War II, a Highland Regiment's acting Commanding Officer, who rose from the ranks, is replaced by a peace-time Oxford-educated Commanding Officer, leading to a dramatic conflict between the two.

Name: Swing Girls
One-line: A tale of delinquent and lazy school girls. In their efforts to cut remedial summer math class, they end up vitiating and replacing the schools brass band.

Name: The Masque of the Red Death
One-line: A European prince terrorizes the local peasantry while using his castle as a refuge against the "Red Death" plague that stalks the land.

Name: Lake of Fire
One-line: A graphic documentary on both sides of the abortion debate.

Name: RoboCop
One-line: In a dystopic and crime-ridden Detroit, a terminally wounded cop returns to the force as a powerful cyborg haunted by submerged memories.

Name: Lust for Life
One-line: The life of brilliant but tortured artist Vincent van Gogh.

Name: Minding the Gap
One-line: Filmmaker Bing Liu searches for correlations between his skateboarder friends' turbulent upbringings and the complexities of modern masculinity.

Name: The Commitments
One-line: Jimmy Rabbitte, an unemployed Dublin boy, decides to put together a soul band made up entirely of the Irish working class.

Name: Juliet of the Spirits
One-line: Visions, memories, and mysticism all help a 40-something woman to find the strength to leave her cheating husband.

Name: Baby Face
One-line: A young woman, sexually exploited all her life, decides to turn the tables and exploit the hapless men at a big city bank by gleefully seducing her way to the top.

Name: Glory
One-line: Robert Gould Shaw leads the U.S. Civil War's first all-black volunteer company, fighting prejudices from both his own Union Army, and the Confederates.

Name: Pink Floyd: The Wall
One-line: A confined but troubled rock star descends into madness in the midst of his physical and social isolation from everyone.

Name: Mass
One-line: The parents of both the shooter and one of the victims of a school shooting tragedy agree to meet and talk in an attempt to move forward.

Name: Twentieth Century
One-line: A flamboyant Broadway impresario who has fallen on hard times tries to get his former lover, now a Hollywood diva, to return and resurrect his failing career.

Name: Cash on Demand
One-line: A charming but ruthless criminal holds the family of a bank manager hostage as part of a cold-blooded plan to steal 97,000 pounds.

Name: Searching for Bobby Fischer
One-line: A prepubescent chess prodigy is encouraged to harden himself in order to become a champion like the famous but unlikable Bobby Fischer.

Name: A Moment of Innocence
One-line: A semi-autobiographical account of Makmahlbaf's experience as a teenager when, as a 17-year-old, he stabbed a policeman at a protest rally. Two decades later, he tracks down the policeman he injured in an attempt to make amends.

Name: No Way Out
One-line: Two hoodlum brothers are brought into a hospital for gunshot wounds, and when one of them dies the other accuses their black doctor of murder.

Name: Kin-dza-dza!
One-line: Two Russians push the wrong button on a strange device and end up on the telepathic planet Pluke with its strange societal norms.

Name: Harry and Tonto
One-line: When his apartment building is torn down, a retired lifelong New Yorker goes on a cross-country odyssey with his beloved cat Tonto.

Name: The Hole
One-line: While never-ending rain and a strange disease spread by cockroaches ravage Taiwan, a plumber makes a hole between two apartments and the inhabitants of each form a unique connection, enacted in musical numbers.

Name: Ship of Fools
One-line: A varied group of passengers boarding a ship bound for pre-WWII Germany represents a microcosm of early 1930s society.

Name: Detour
One-line: The life of Al Roberts, a pianist in a New York nightclub, turns into a nightmare when he decides to hitchhike to Los Angeles to visit his girlfriend.

Name: Knife in the Water
One-line: A couple pick up a hitchhiker on the way to their yacht. The husband invites the young man to come along for their day's sailing. As the voyage progresses, the antagonism between the two men grows. A violent confrontation is inevitable.

Name: Mother and Son
One-line: A man goes for a walk through the countryside with his dying mother.

Name: The Aviator
One-line: A biopic depicting the early years of legendary director and aviator Howard Hughes' career from the late 1920s to the mid 1940s.

Name: The Bohemian Life
One-line: Three struggling artists try to make passable livings in Paris despite setbacks and tragedies.

Name: Safe
One-line: An affluent and unexceptional homemaker in the suburbs develops multiple chemical sensitivity.

Name: Pudhu Pettai
One-line: After running away from his home, Kumar falls in with a gang and slowly rises through the ranks of the criminal underworld.

Name: A Sunday in the Country
One-line: An elderly painter whose son visits with his family on the weekends, is also surprised by a visit from his still-single daughter.

Name: Moonage Daydream
One-line: A cinematic odyssey exploring David Bowie's creative and musical journey. From visionary filmmaker Brett Morgen, and sanctioned by the Bowie estate.

Name: A Place in the World
One-line: Mario and Ana, in voluntary exile from Buenos Aires, live in a remote Argentine valley with their 12-year-old son Ernesto. Mario runs a school and a wool cooperative; Ana, a doctor, heads a... See full summary »

Name: The Razor's Edge
One-line: An adventuresome young man goes off to find himself and loses his socialite fiancée in the process. But when he returns 10 years later, she will stop at nothing to get him back, even though she is already married.

Name: Diva
One-line: Two tapes, two Parisian mob killers, one corrupt policeman, an opera fan, a teenage thief, and the coolest philosopher ever filmed all twist their way through an intricate and stylish French-language thriller.

Name: Little Dieter Needs to Fly
One-line: German-American Dieter Dengler discusses his service as a U.S. naval pilot in the Vietnam War. Dengler also revisits the sites of his capture and eventual escape from the hands of the Viet Cong, recreating many events for the camera.

Name: O Lucky Man!
One-line: An ambitious coffee salesman has a series of improbable and ironic adventures that seem designed to challenge his naive idealism.

Name: The Effect of Gamma Rays on Man-in-the-Moon Marigolds
One-line: A middle-aged misfit struggles to raise her daughters, one popular and the other a promising science student.

Name: The Bells of St. Mary's
One-line: At a big city Catholic school, Father O'Malley and Sister Benedict indulge in friendly rivalry, and succeed in extending the school through the gift of a building.

Name: Places in the Heart
One-line: In central Texas in the 1930s, a widow with two small children tries to save her small 40-acre farm with the help of a blind boarder and an itinerant black handyman.

Name: Kapo
One-line: A young Jewish girl leads an escape attempt from a concentration camp.

Name: Straw Dogs
One-line: A young American and his English wife come to rural England and face increasingly vicious local harassment.

Name: Where the Sidewalk Ends
One-line: Det. Sgt. Mark Dixon wants to be something his old man wasn't: a guy on the right side of the law. Will Dixon's vicious nature get the better of him?

Name: Heavenly Creatures
One-line: Two teenage girls share a unique bond; their parents, concerned that the friendship is too intense, separate them, and the girls take revenge.

Name: Oh, Beautiful Istanbul
One-line: Black comedy about a girl who runs away from her rural village to Istanbul to become and actress and an old drunkard street photographer.

Name: The Goodbye Girl
One-line: After being dumped by her live-in boyfriend, an unemployed dancer and her 10-year-old daughter are reluctantly forced to live with a struggling off-Broadway actor.

Name: Hatari!
One-line: A group of men trap wild animals in Africa and sell them to zoos before the arrival of a female wildlife photographer threatens to change their ways.

Name: King of the Hill
One-line: A young boy struggles on his own in a run-down hotel after his parents and younger brother are separated from him in 1930s Depression-era Midwest.

Name: The Cove

Name: The Bank Dick

Name: Peyton Place

Name: Alice

Name: Together

April 6th, 1917. As an infantry battalion assembles to wage war deep in enemy territory, two soldiers are assigned to race against time and deliver a message that will stop 1,600 men from walking straight into a deadly trap.

Name: Four Adventures of Reinette and Mirabelle
One-line: Two unlike girls are going to learn each other's world - lovely countryside and bustling Paris.

One-line: A manager of an orphanage in India is sent to Copenhagen, Denmark, where he discovers a life-altering family secret.

Name: Far from the Madding Crowd
One-line: Bathsheba Everdene, a willful, flirtatious young woman, unexpectedly inherits a large farm and is romantically pursued by three very different men.

Name: The 1,000 Eyes of Dr. Mabuse

Name: Magnificent Obsession
One-line: A rich playboy whose recklessness inadvertently causes the death of a prominent doctor tries to make amends to his widow, and falls for her in the process.

Name: Gueros
One-line: Tomas is too much for his lone mother so she sends him to live with his older brother Federico, aka Sombra, in Mexico City.

Name: The Masters of Time

Name: Fish Tank
One-line: Everything changes for 15-year-old Mia when her mum brings home a new boyfriend.

Name: Corpse Bride
Actors: ['Mike Johnson', 'Johnny Depp', 'Helena Bonham Carter', 'Emily Watson', 'Tracey Ullman']
One-line: When a shy groom practices his wedding vows in the inadvertent presence of a deceased young woman, she rises from the grave assuming he has married her.

Name: In Harm's Way
One-line: A Naval officer, reprimanded after Pearl Harbor, is later promoted to Rear Admiral and gets a second chance to prove himself against the Japanese.

Name: Salvador
One-line: A burnt-out photojournalist becomes involved in a Central American revolution.

Name: The Host
One-line: A monster emerges from Seoul's Han River and begins attacking people. One victim's loving family does what it can to rescue her from its clutches.

Name: White Christmas
One-line: A successful song-and-dance team become romantically involved with a sister act and team up to save the failing Vermont inn of their former commanding general.

Name: Midnight
One-line: A chorus girl stranded in Paris is set up by a millionaire to break up his wife's affair with another man, while being romantically pursued by a cab driver.

Name: Air Force
One-line: The crew of an Air Force bomber arrives in Pearl Harbor in the aftermath of the Japanese attack on December 7, 1941, and is sent on to Manila to help with the defense of the Philippines.

Name: Morvern Callar
One-line: After her beloved boyfriend's suicide, a mourning supermarket worker and her best friend hit the road in Scotland, but find that grief is something that you can't run away from forever.

Name: Machuca
One-line: Two 12-year-old Chilean children from different social classes become friends in 1973. They both discover each other's world as political tensions in their country increase.

Name: Kahaani
One-line: A pregnant woman's search for her missing husband takes her from London to Kolkata, but everyone she questions denies having ever met him.

Name: Gemide
One-line: Sailors want to remain in their small world, warm and cozy and full of lies, but they kidnap a prostitute from some pimps.

Name: Joint Security Area
One-line: After a shooting incident at the North-South Korean border DMZ leaves two North Korean soldiers dead, a neutral Swiss and Swedish team investigates what actually happened.

Name: The Boy and the World
One-line: A little boy goes on an adventurous quest in search of his father.

Name: Little Women
One-line: The four daughters of a New England family fight for happiness during and after the Civil War.

Name: Jane
Actors: ['Jane Goodall', 'Hugo Van Lawick', 'Hugo Eric Louis van Lawick']
One-line: The life and work of the renowned primatology scientist, Jane Goodall, especially on her research about chimpanzees.

Name: About Schmidt
One-line: A recently retired man embarks on a journey to his estranged daughter's wedding, only to discover more about himself and life than he ever expected.

Name: Sing Street
One-line: A young lad notices a beautiful girl who begins to occupy his thoughts. While struggling with poverty, personal relationships and life's woes, he starts a band, hoping to catch her attention.

Name: Born to Kill
One-line: A calculating divorcée risks her chances at wealth and security with a man she doesn't love by getting involved with the hotheaded murderer romancing her foster sister.

Name: Avalon
One-line: A Polish-Jewish family comes to the U.S. at the beginning of the twentieth century. There, the family and their children try to make themselves a better future in the so-called promised land.

Name: Secret Honor

Name: Lilo & Stitch
Actors: ['Chris Sanders', 'Daveigh Chase', 'Chris Sanders', 'Tia Carrere', 'David Ogden Stiers']
One-line: A young and parentless girl adopts a 'dog' from the local pound, completely unaware that it's supposedly a dangerous scientific experiment that's taken refuge on Earth and is now hiding from its creator and those who see it as a menace.

Name: Accattone
One-line: A pimp with no other means to provide for himself finds his life spiraling out of control when his prostitute is sent to prison.

Name: Sisters
One-line: A small-time reporter tries to convince the police she saw a murder in the apartment across from hers.

Name: The Crow
One-line: A man brutally murdered comes back to life as an undead avenger of his and his fiancée's murder.

Name: The Thin Man Goes Home
One-line: Nick and Nora head to Nick's hometown of Sycamore Springs to spend some time with his parents. His father, a prominent local physician, was always a bit disappointed with Nick's choice of ... See full summary »

Name: Boccaccio '70
Actors: ['Federico Fellini', 'Mario Monicelli', 'Luchino Visconti', 'Anita Ekberg', 'Sophia Loren', 'Romy Schneider', 'Marisa Solinas']
One-line: Inspired by Boccaccio's novellas, each episode focuses on sex, love and seduction in Italy in the 1960s, an era of economic growth and major cultural changes.

Name: Comanche Station
One-line: A man saves a woman who had been kidnapped by Comanches, then struggles to get both of them home alive.

Name: Happy as Lazzaro
One-line: An unceasingly kind Italian peasant and his family are blatantly exploited by a tobacco baroness.

Name: First Cow
One-line: A skilled cook has traveled west and joined a group of fur trappers in Oregon, though he only finds true connection with a Chinese immigrant also seeking his fortune. Soon the two collaborate on a successful business.

Name: The Glenn Miller Story
One-line: Biography of bandleader Glenn Miller from his beginnings to his death over the English Channel in December 1944.

Name: Night Nurse
One-line: A nurse enlists the help of a petty criminal to foil a sinister plot to murder two children.

Name: Blackmail
One-line: After killing a man in self-defense, a young woman is blackmailed by a witness to the killing.

Name: The Trap
One-line: A couple finds out their son urgently needs an expensive heart surgery. While struggling to find the money, the father is approached by a mysterious man proposing a sinister deal.

Name: A Generation
One-line: Story of youth during the German occupation of Poland in World War II who come to adulthood through love and adversity.

Name: The Band's Visit
One-line: A band comprised of members of the Egyptian police force head to Israel to play at the inaugural ceremony of an Arab arts center, only to find themselves lost in the wrong town.

Name: Wrinkles

Name: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade
One-line: In 1938, after his father goes missing while pursuing the Holy Grail, Indiana Jones finds himself up against the Nazis again to stop them from obtaining its powers.

Name: Local Hero
One-line: An American oil company has plans for a new refinery and sends someone to Scotland to buy up an entire village, but things don't go as expected.

Name: Roger & Me
One-line: After General Motors closes its factory in Flint, Michigan, eliminating 35,000 jobs, filmmaker Michael Moore undertakes a quixotic quest to interview General Motors' chairman, Roger B. Smith.

Name: And the Band Played On
One-line: The story of the discovery of the AIDS epidemic, and the political infighting of the scientific community hampering the early fight with it.

Name: Paterson
One-line: A quiet observation of the triumphs and defeats of daily life, along with the poetry evident in its smallest details.

Name: Rascal Does Not Dream of a Dreaming Girl
One-line: A high school student's blissful days with his girlfriend are interrupted when his first crush returns in two forms.

Name: Return to Seoul

Name: Land of Mine

Name: Full Contact
One-line: Two disreputable friends get tied in with a group of criminals who turn out to be excessively violent and deceptive.

Name: Man's Favorite Sport?
One-line: The author of a best-selling fishing guide is actually extremely inexperienced in the sport, which causes mayhem when he is entered into a competition.

Name: Green Book
One-line: A working-class Italian-American bouncer becomes the driver for an African-American classical pianist on a tour of venues through the 1960s American South.

Name: Red Rock West
One-line: Upon arriving to a small town, a drifter is mistaken for a hitman, but when the real hitman arrives, complications ensue.

Name: Mad Max
One-line: In a self-destructing world, a vengeful Australian policeman sets out to stop a violent motorcycle gang.

Name: Under the Sun of Satan
One-line: A priest stuck in a rural congregation and burdened with his overwrought spirituality, finds purpose in a troubled woman accused of murder.

Name: Beyond the Mat
One-line: A heartfelt documentary focusing on the day-to-day lives of professional wrestlers, some on the rise, some on the wane, and others fighting for their lives.

Name: Die Geschichte vom weinenden Kamel
One-line: When a Mongolian nomadic family's newest camel colt is rejected by its mother, a musician is needed for a ritual to change her mind.

Name: Destiny
One-line: Bekir loves Ugur, who loves Zagor, who is about to get out of jail. An already tense love triangle is thrown into turmoil on a hot summer night, when Zagor kills someone, and Ugur disappears.

Name: Pursued
One-line: A boy haunted by nightmares about the night his entire family was murdered is brought up by a neighboring family in the 1880s. He falls for his lovely adoptive sister but his nasty adoptive brother and mysterious uncle want him dead.

Name: Arabian Nights
One-line: In ancient Arabia, a beautiful slave girl chooses a youth to be her new master, then she is kidnapped and they must search for each other. Stories are told within stories: love, travel and the whims of destiny.

Name: The Toy
One-line: A poor journalist finds himself as a toy of a boss' son. Making friends with a naughty child, he tries to save him from the cruel power of his father.

Name: Up in the Air
One-line: Ryan Bingham enjoys living out of a suitcase for his job, travelling around the country firing people, but finds that lifestyle threatened by the presence of a potential love interest, and a new hire presenting a new business model.

Name: Beverly Hills Cop

Name: Rebels of the Neon God
One-line: Within the urban gloom of Taipei, four youths face alienation, loneliness, and moments of existential crisis amidst a series of minor crimes.

Name: The Gambler
One-line: Axel Freed is a literature professor. He has the gambling vice. When he has lost all of his money, he borrows from his girlfriend, then his mother, and finally some bad guys that chase him. Despite all of this, he cannot stop gambling.

Name: Warrior
One-line: The youngest son of an alcoholic former boxer returns home, where he's trained by his father for competition in a mixed martial arts tournament - a path that puts the fighter on a collision course with his estranged, older brother.

Name: Buffet Froid
One-line: Alphonse lives in an empty building. Empty but for one neighbour, the police captain Morvandieu. When the man who have killed Alphonse's wife appears, the three men will be thrown in a serie of event in a surrealist world.

Name: Hamlet
One-line: Hamlet, Prince of Denmark, returns home to find his father murdered and his mother remarrying the murderer, his uncle. Meanwhile, war is brewing.

Name: The Raid: Redemption
One-line: A S.W.A.T. team becomes trapped in a tenement run by a ruthless mobster and his army of killers and thugs.

Name: Vernon, Florida
One-line: A documentary on the eccentric residents of Vernon, Florida.

Name: Pollyanna
One-line: A young girl comes to an embittered town and confronts its attitude with her determination to see the best in life.

Name: The New York Ripper
One-line: A burned-out New York police detective teams up with a college psychoanalyst to track down a vicious serial killer randomly stalking and killing various young women around the city.

Name: Crash
One-line: Los Angeles citizens with vastly separate lives collide in interweaving stories of race, loss and redemption.

Name: Walk the Line
One-line: A chronicle of country music legend Johnny Cash's life, from his early days on an Arkansas cotton farm to his rise to fame with Sun Records in Memphis, where he recorded alongside Elvis Presley, Jerry Lee Lewis, and Carl Perkins.

Name: The Hitch-Hiker
One-line: Two fishermen pick up a psychopathic escaped convict who tells them that he intends to murder them when the ride is over.

Name: Law of Desire
One-line: A gay filmmaker becomes involved with an obsessive fan while still pining for his absent true love. Meanwhile, he shares a close but complex relationship with his trans sister, an actress.

Name: The Swindle
One-line: A trio of con-men led by a lonesome swindler must deal with their job and family pressures.

Name: The Central Park Five
Actors: ['Sarah Burns', 'David McMahon', 'Antron McCray', 'Kevin Richardson', 'Kharey Wise', 'Raymond Santana']
One-line: A documentary that examines the 1989 case of five black and Latino teenagers who were convicted of raping a white woman in Central Park. After having spent between 6 and 13 years each in prison, a serial rapist confessed to the crime.

Name: Lost Highway
One-line: Anonymous videotapes presage a musician's murder conviction, and a gangster's girlfriend leads a mechanic astray.

Name: Better Days
One-line: While she copes the the pressures of her final examinations, a bullied teenage girl forms an unlikely friendship with a mysterious young man who protects her from her assailants.

Name: The Consequences of Love
One-line: An introverted man's life changes completely when he finds himself attracted to a young barmaid.

Name: The Descendants
One-line: A land baron tries to reconnect with his two daughters after his wife is seriously injured in a boating accident.

Name: Back to the Future Part II
One-line: After visiting 2015, Marty McFly must repeat his visit to 1955 to prevent disastrous changes to 1985...without interfering with his first trip.

Name: Colorado Territory
One-line: In Colorado territory, outlaw Wes McQueen escapes jail to pull a railroad robbery but, upon meeting pretty settler Julie Ann, he wonders about going straight.

Name: Conspirators of Pleasure
One-line: Six people unknowingly form a cycle of masturbation as they each cause others to privately indulge in their fetishes.

Name: Aaranya Kaandam
One-line: A mob boss must deal with a disgruntled mistress and a vanishing bag of cocaine.

Name: Hardcore
One-line: A religious businessman from Michigan has to venture into the world of pornography in California, desperately searching for his runaway teenage daughter.

Name: The Cider House Rules
One-line: A compassionate young man, raised in an orphanage and trained to be a doctor there, decides to leave to see the world.

Name: Batman: The Dark Knight Returns, Part 1
One-line: Batman has not been seen for ten years. A new breed of criminal ravages Gotham City, forcing 55-year-old Bruce Wayne back into the cape and cowl. But, does he still have what it takes to fight crime in a new era?

Name: Rushmore
One-line: A teenager at Rushmore Academy falls for a much older teacher and befriends a middle-aged industrialist. Later, he finds out that his love interest and his friend are having an affair, which prompts him to begin a vendetta.

Name: Water
One-line: Set in colonial India against Gandhi's rise to power, it's the story of 8-year-old Chuyia, who is widowed and sent to a home to live in penitence; once there, Chuyia's feisty presence deeply affects the lives of the other residents.

Name: La fille sur le pont
One-line: One night, a fading entertainer intervenes when a woman contemplates suicide, beginning a strange, unpredictable relationship.

Name: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
One-line: The master sleuth hunts his archenemy, Professor Moriarty, who is planning the crime of the century.

Name: Little Forest: Winter/Spring
One-line: Ichiko lived in a big city, but goes back to her small hometown Komori, located on a mountain in the Tohoku region. She is self-sufficient. Ichiko gains energy living among nature and eating foods she makes from seasonal ingredients.

Name: The Crow's Egg
One-line: Two slum kids yearn to taste a pizza after being enticed by the pizza shop that has opened near their locality. What happens when they manage to find the money to buy one?

Name: Riki-Oh: The Story of Ricky
One-line: Riki-Oh, a young man who has superhuman strength, is incarcerated in a private prison, where inmates are treated like slaves. He is forced to use his unstoppable form of martial arts to destroy the corrupt officials and their lackeys.

Name: Sin City
Actors: ['Quentin Tarantino', 'Robert Rodriguez', 'Mickey Rourke', 'Clive Owen', 'Bruce Willis', 'Jessica Alba']
One-line: An exploration of the dark and miserable Basin City and three of its residents, all of whom are caught up in violent corruption.

Name: Hairspray
One-line: A 'pleasantly plump' teenager teaches 1962 Baltimore a thing or two about integration after landing a spot on a local TV dance show.

Name: The Bachelor and the Bobby-Soxer
One-line: A high school girl falls for a playboy artist, with screwball results.

Name: A Woman of Paris: A Drama of Fate
One-line: A kept woman runs into her former fiancé and finds herself torn between love and comfort.

Name: The Boy Friend
One-line: When the leading lady of a low-budget musical revue sprains her ankle, the assistant stage manager is forced to understudy and perform in her place, becoming a star and finding love in the process.

Name: Promising Young Woman
One-line: Nothing in Cassie's life is what it appears to be - she's wickedly smart, tantalizingly cunning, and she's living a secret double life. Now, an unexpected encounter is about to give Cassie a chance to right the wrongs from the past.

Name: Blade Runner 2049
One-line: Young Blade Runner K's discovery of a long-buried secret leads him to track down former Blade Runner Rick Deckard, who's been missing for thirty years.

Name: Love Crazy
One-line: A wife suspecting infidelity starts divorce proceedings, so the husband pretends to be insane in order to delay the divorce and clear up the misunderstanding.

Name: Ridicule
One-line: To get royal backing on a needed drainage project, a poor French lord must learn to play the delicate games of wit at court at Versailles.

Name: The Lunchbox
One-line: A mistaken delivery in Mumbai's famously efficient lunchbox delivery system connects a young housewife to an older man in the dusk of his life as they build a fantasy world together through notes in the lunchbox.

Name: Munna Bhai M.B.B.S.
One-line: A gangster sets out to fulfill his father's dream of becoming a doctor.

Name: Blancanieves
One-line: A twist on the Snow White fairy tale that is set in 1920s Seville and centered on a female bullfighter.

Name: I'm All Right Jack
One-line: A naive aristocrat in search of a career becomes caught up in the struggles between his profit-minded uncle and an aggressive labor union.

Name: The Big Short
One-line: In 2006-2007 a group of investors bet against the United States mortgage market. In their research, they discover how flawed and corrupt the market is.

Name: Suddenly, Last Summer
One-line: A surgeon is assigned the case of a young woman whose aunt wants her lobotomized to cover up a family secret.

Name: Holiday Affair
One-line: A young widow is torn between a boring attorney and a romantic ne'er-do-well.

Name: Get on the Bus
One-line: A disparate group of African-American men travel by bus to Washington, DC for the Million Man March.

Name: Ruby in Paradise
One-line: A young woman struggles for independence and identity in a small Florida tourist town.

Name: Call Northside 777
One-line: Chicago reporter P.J. McNeal re-opens a decade-old murder case.

Name: Kings & Queen
One-line: Parallel storylines tell the current state of affairs for two ex-lovers: Nora's a single mother who comes to care for her terminally ill father; holed in up in mental ward, Ismael, a brilliant musician, plots his escape.

Name: The New Centurions
One-line: An idealistic rookie cop joins the L.A.P.D. to make ends meet while finishing law school, and is indoctrinated by a seasoned veteran. As time goes on, he loses his ambitions and family as police work becomes his entire life.

Name: U2: Rattle and Hum
One-line: A documentary of the Irish rock group U2 on their Fall 1987 tour of North America.

Name: Chûgoku no chôjin
One-line: A salaryman and yakuza are each sent by their bosses to a remote Chinese village but discover more than they expected.

Name: Brat 2
One-line: Arriving in Moscow, Danila discovers Konstantin dead and he sets out to avenge his death; a journey that leads him to Chicago and a whole new experience.

Name: Conspiracy
One-line: At the Wannsee Conference on January 20, 1942, senior Nazi officials meet to determine the manner in which the so-called "Final Solution to the Jewish Question" can be best implemented.

Name: Master of the Flying Guillotine
Actors: ['Jimmy Wang Yu', 'Tien Wu Chu', 'Kang Chin', 'Chun-Erh Lung']
One-line: After his students are killed by the One Armed Boxer, a vengeful and blind Kung Fu expert travels to a village where a martial arts contest is being held and vows to behead every one armed man he comes across.

Name: Drishyam
One-line: Desperate measures are taken by a man who tries to save his family from the dark side of the law, after they commit an unexpected crime.

Name: The Squid and the Whale
One-line: Follows two young boys dealing with their parents' divorce in Brooklyn in the 1980s.

Name: Hacksaw Ridge
One-line: World War II American Army Medic Desmond T. Doss, serving during the Battle of Okinawa, refuses to kill people and becomes the first man in American history to receive the Medal of Honor without firing a shot.

Name: The White Sheik
One-line: During a day of their honeymoon, newlyweds are separated by the city's lust and the desires it produces.

Name: Murder She Said
One-line: When Miss Jane Marple reports witnessing a murder through the window of a passing train, the police dismiss her as a dotty spinster when no trace of the crime can be found.

Name: Thani Oruvan
One-line: Siddharth Abimanyu, an influential scientist, is involved in various illegal medical practices. Mithran, an efficient IPS officer, decides to expose him.

Name: Brand Upon the Brain!
One-line: Returned home to his long-estranged mother upon a request from her deathbed, a man raised by his parents in an orphanage has to confront the childhood memories that have long haunted him.

Name: May Fools
One-line: During the events of May 1968 in France, different worldviews of conflicting relatives collide in their family estate.

Name: The City of Lost Children
One-line: A scientist in a surrealist society kidnaps children to steal their dreams, hoping that they slow his aging process.

Name: Putney Swope
One-line: The board of directors at a Madison Avenue ad agency must elect a new chairman. In the maneuvering to make sure that enemies don't get votes, all the members accidentally cast their ballot for the board's token black man, Putney Swope.

Name: The Purple Rose of Cairo
One-line: In 1935 New Jersey, a movie character walks off the screen and into the real world.

Name: Gettysburg
One-line: In 1863, the Northern and Southern forces fight at Gettysburg in the decisive battle of the American Civil War.

Name: Warlock
One-line: A famous gunman becomes the marshal of Warlock to end a gang's rampages, but is met with some opposition by a former gang member turned deputy sheriff who wants to follow only legal methods.

Name: Cruel Story of Youth
One-line: A harsh young man seduces a freeloading young woman and eventually takes advantage of her knack for hitch-hiking to rob middle-class men.

Name: Parallel Mothers
One-line: The story of two mothers who bond in unexpected way after giving birth the same day.

Name: The Clockmaker
One-line: A Watchmaker finds out one day that his son has become a murderer. He tries to understand for whom and why.

Name: Raising Victor Vargas
One-line: A Lower East Side teen-ager struggles to find some sanity while surrounded by an eccentric grandmother, a crazy new girlfriend, and a longing younger brother.

Name: The First Day of the Rest of Your Life
One-line: Five key days in a family's life.

Name: Theodora Goes Wild
One-line: The author of a controversially racy best-selling book tries to hide her celebrity status from her provincial small-town neighbors, who would be scandalized if they knew.

Name: Rang De Basanti
One-line: The story of six young Indians who assist an English woman to film a documentary on the freedom fighters from their past, and the events that lead them to relive the long-forgotten saga of freedom.

Name: And Justice for All
One-line: A lawyer is forced to defend a judge, while defending other clients, and trying to find punishment for the guilty and provide justice for the innocent.

Name: Dodge City
One-line: A Texas cattle agent witnesses first hand, the brutal lawlessness of Dodge City and takes the job of sheriff to clean the town up.

Name: Dunkirk
One-line: Allied soldiers from Belgium, the British Commonwealth and Empire, and France are surrounded by the German Army and evacuated during a fierce battle in World War II.

Name: Anna Karenina
One-line: The married Anna Karenina falls in love with Count Vronsky despite her husband's refusal to grant a divorce, and both must contend with the social repercussions.

Name: Andhadhun
One-line: A series of mysterious events change the life of a blind pianist, who must now report a crime that he should technically know nothing of.

Name: Watch Out, We're Mad
One-line: After a tied first place in a local stunt race, two drivers start a contest to decide which of them will own the prize, a dune buggy. But when a mobster destroys the car, they are determined to get it back.

Name: Sicario
One-line: An idealistic FBI agent is enlisted by a government task force to aid in the escalating war against drugs at the border area between the U.S. and Mexico.

Name: The Bravados
One-line: A man is chasing four outlaws who killed his wife and finds them in a small town's jail, but they escape to Mexico.

Name: Robin Hood
One-line: The story of the legendary British outlaw portrayed with the characters as anthropomorphic animals.

Name: Bagdad Cafe
One-line: A lonely German woman ends up in the most desolate motel on Earth and decides to make it brighter.

Name: The Corporation
One-line: Documentary that looks at the concept of the corporation throughout recent history up to its present-day dominance.

Name: Beginners
One-line: A young man is rocked by two announcements from his elderly father: that he has terminal cancer and that he has a young male lover.

Name: Jab We Met
One-line: A depressed wealthy businessman finds his life changing after he meets a spunky and care-free young woman.

Name: State of the Union
One-line: An industrialist is urged to run for President, but this requires uncomfortable compromises on both political and marital levels.

Name: Last Life in the Universe
One-line: A suicidal, obsessively compulsive Japanese librarian is forced to lie low in Thailand with a pot-smoking woman coping with the recent loss of her sister.

Name: Cemetery of Splendor
One-line: A group of soldiers in a small town on the Mekong River in northern Thailand are struck with a bizarre sleeping illness.

Name: How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying
One-line: Armed with the titular manual, an ambitious window washer seeks to climb the corporate ladder.

Name: Mirage
One-line: An accountant suddenly suffers from amnesia. This appears related to the suicide of his boss. Now some violent thugs are out to get him. They work for a shadowy figure known simply as The Major.

Name: Hell Drivers
One-line: A rookie trucker tries to expose his boss' rackets.

Name: Tension
One-line: A meek pharmacist creates an alternate identity under which he plans to murder the bullying liquor salesman who has become his wife's lover.

Name: Jour de Fête
One-line: A village postman with no sense of humour delivers his mail via bicycle on the day the travelling fair comes to town. He is disrupted by a short film about US speed and efficiency and the playful teasing of the village folk.

Name: Grosse Pointe Blank
One-line: Martin Blank is a professional assassin. He is sent on a mission to a small Detroit suburb, Grosse Pointe, and, by coincidence, his ten-year high school reunion party is taking place there at the same time.

Name: The Girlfriends
One-line: A young woman returns to her hometown of Turin to set up a new fashion salon and gets involved with a troubled woman and her three wealthy friends.

Name: La Cage aux Folles
One-line: The manager of a Saint-Tropez nightclub featuring drag entertainment, and his star attraction, are a gay couple. Madness ensues when his straight son brings home a fiancée and her ultra-conservative parents to meet them.

Name: The Rescuers
Actors: ['Wolfgang Reitherman', 'Art Stevens', 'Bob Newhart', 'Eva Gabor', 'Geraldine Page', 'Joe Flynn']
One-line: Two mice of the Rescue Aid Society search for a little girl kidnapped by unscrupulous treasure hunters.

Name: Le Dîner de Cons
One-line: A few friends have a weekly fools' dinner, where each brings a fool along. Pierre finds a champion fool for next dinner. Surprise.

Name: Fellini's Casanova
One-line: Giacomo Casanova uses his sexuality to find his place in life amid eccentric and strange characters.

Name: Almost Human
One-line: A small-time homicidal maniac kidnaps a young heiress, prompting a cop to pursue him before he can kill the girl once the hefty ransom is paid.

Name: Kubo and the Two Strings
One-line: A young boy named Kubo must locate a magical suit of armour worn by his late father in order to defeat a vengeful spirit from the past.

Name: Rumble Fish

Name: Bill Cunningham New York
One-line: A profile of the noted and extraordinarily cheerful veteran New York City fashion photographer.

Name: Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl

Name: Queen

Name: Before the Revolution
One-line: Following the death of his friend, an Italian youth grows increasingly closer to his young aunt.

Name: Failan

Name: A Self-Made Hero
One-line: Set in France at the end of World War II Albert Dehousse finds out his father wasn't a war hero and his mother is a collaborator. He leaves his wife and goes to Paris. Gradually he ... See full summary »

Name: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
One-line: A journalist is aided by a young female hacker in his search for the killer of a woman who has been dead for forty years.

Name: The Emperor's New Groove

Name: Red Rocket

Name: Father
One-line: A Serbian man fights to regain custody of his children.

Name: Shall We Dance?
One-line: A successful but unhappy Japanese accountant finds the missing passion in his life when he begins to secretly take ballroom dance lessons.

Name: Truly Madly Deeply

Name: The Girl Can't Help It

Name: Bird

Name: Into the Wild

Along the way, Christopher encounters a series of characters that shape his life.

Name: Take Shelter
One-line: Plagued by a series of apocalyptic visions, a young husband and father questions whether to shelter his family from a coming storm, or from himself.

Name: Star Trek
One-line: The brash James T. Kirk tries to live up to his father's legacy with Mr. Spock keeping him in check as a vengeful Romulan from the future creates black holes to destroy the Federation one planet at a time.

Name: Animal Kingdom

Name: An Education

Name: Force Majeure
One-line: A family vacationing in the French Alps is confronted with a devastating avalanche.

Name: Bonjour Tristesse

Name: Superbad

Name: The Late Show
One-line: A grumpy semi-retired private investigator partners with a quirky female client to catch the people who murdered his partner.

Name: Ilo Ilo
Actors: ['Yann Yann Yeo', 'Tian Wen Chen', 'Angeli Bayani', 'Jia Ler Koh']
One-line: In 90s Singapore, the friendship between Filipino nursemaid Teresa and her young charge Jiale makes waves in a family, while the Asian recession hits the region.

Name: Andaz Apna Apna
One-line: Two slackers competing for the affections of an heiress inadvertently become her protectors from an evil criminal.

Name: Dark City
One-line: A man struggles with memories of his past, which include a wife he cannot remember and a nightmarish world no one else ever seems to wake up from.

Name: The Year of Living Dangerously

Name: The Damned Don't Cry

Name: Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom

Name: The Fly
One-line: A scientist has a horrific accident when he tries to use his newly invented teleportation device.

Name: Manhattan Murder Mystery
One-line: A middle-aged couple suspects foul play when their neighbor's wife suddenly drops dead.

One-line: A look at a few chapters in the life of Poppy, a cheery, colorful, North London schoolteacher whose optimism tends to exasperate those around her.

Name: Klute

Name: The Gods Must Be Crazy

Name: The Blue Bead

Name: Boomerang!

Name: The Hired Hand

Name: Footnote

Name: Southern Comfort

Name: Pom Poko
One-line: A community of magical shape-shifting raccoon dogs struggle to prevent their forest home from being destroyed by urban development.

Name: Tabutta Rövasata
One-line: Mahsun is homeless and unemployed. He lives in Rumelihisari (one of the most picturesque and oldest quarters of Istanbul), and tries to stay alive with the help of local fishermen. Mahsun ... See full summary »

Name: Hercules
One-line: The son of Zeus and Hera is stripped of his immortality as an infant and must become a true hero in order to reclaim it.

Name: Tarzan
One-line: A man raised by gorillas must decide where he really belongs when he discovers he is a human.

Name: Lady Bird
One-line: In 2002, an artistically inclined 17-year-old girl comes of age in Sacramento, California.

Name: Vera Cruz

One-line: At a Montréal public grade school, an Algerian immigrant is hired to replace a popular teacher who committed suicide in her classroom. While helping his students deal with their grief, his own recent loss is revealed.

Name: Il Mare

Name: Heart Attack
One-line: A hard-working freelancer falls in love with a doctor.

Name: Buffalo '66

Name: Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham...

Name: Loveless

Name: The Secret Garden

Name: The Trial
One-line: An unassuming office worker is arrested and stands trial, but he is never made aware of his charges.

Name: To Joy

Name: The Phenix City Story

Name: Show Me Love
One-line: Two teenage girls in small-town Sweden. Elin is beautiful, popular, and bored with life. Agnes is friendless, sad, and secretly in love with Elin.

Name: I Wake Up Screaming

Name: Fatal Attraction

Name: Sonbahar

Name: Batman

Name: The Spider's Stratagem
One-line: A man returns to the place where his father was murdered and tries to find closure. But he finds himself in a similar predicament as his late father instead.

Name: Drácula

Name: Talvar

Name: The Dark Mirror

Name: Coco
Actors: ['Adrian Molina', 'Anthony Gonzalez', 'Gael García Bernal', 'Benjamin Bratt', 'Alanna Ubach']
One-line: Aspiring musician Miguel, confronted with his family's ancestral ban on music, enters the Land of the Dead to find his great-great-grandfather, a legendary singer.

Name: Noviembre
One-line: Impelled by a spirit which still preserves a patina of idealism, Alfredo arrives in Madrid intent on creating "a performance which is freer.

Name: The Classic
One-line: A college student finds a diary detailing a long-ago love triangle involving her mother, her future father, and his best friend.

Name: The Big Feast

Name: Val

One-line: Suspecting that his childhood friend, a professional boxer, is having a love affair with his fiancée, a businessman starts training rigorously in order to take him down.

Name: Indochine

Name: Elena
One-line: When a sudden illness and an unexpected reunion threaten dutiful housewife Elena's potential inheritance, she must hatch a desperate plan ...

Name: The World

Name: Bianco, rosso e Verdone

Name: The Fox and the Hound

One-line: A fox named Tod and a hound named Copper vow to be best friends forever. But as Copper grows into a hunting dog, their unlikely friendship faces the ultimate test.

Name: Topkapi

Name: Blithe Spirit

Name: The Leopard Man
One-line: A seemingly-tame leopard used for a publicity stunt escapes and kills a young girl, spreading panic throughout a sleepy New Mexico town.

Name: I've Loved You So Long

Name: Kill Bill: Vol. 1

Name: We Are the Best!

Name: Top Secret!
Actors: ['David Zucker', 'Jerry Zucker', 'Val Kilmer', 'Omar Sharif', 'Jeremy Kemp', 'Warren Clarke']
One-line: An American rock and roll singer is invited to a cultural festival in East Germany in order to distract from a plot to destroy NATO submarines, but he accidentally becomes involved in a resistance plot to rescue an imprisoned scientist.

Name: The Cave of the Yellow Dog
One-line: The little Nansal finds a baby dog in the Mongolian veld, who becomes her best friend against all rejections of her parents.

Name: No

Name: My Name Is Julia Ross
One-line: Julia Ross secures employment through a rather nosy employment agency, with a wealthy widow, Mrs. Hughes, and goes to live at her house. 2 days later, she awakens - in a different house, in... See full summary »

Name: The Song of Sparrows
One-line: When an ostrich-rancher focuses on replacing his daughter's hearing aid, which breaks right before crucial exams, everything changes for a struggling rural family in Iran. Karim motorbikes ... See full summary »

Name: The Devil's Eye
One-line: Don Juan is sent from Hell to Earth with a mission - to seduce a virgin in order to spoil her pure wedding. The mission becomes crazy when Don Juan falls in love for the first time in centuries.

Name: All or Nothing

Name: Ronia: The Robber's Daughter

Name: Everlasting Moments

Name: The Black Power Mixtape 1967-1975

Name: The Sniper

Name: Mr. Vampire

Name: Deadline - U.S.A.

Name: American Gangster

Name: The Dark Crystal

Name: The Bitter Tea of General Yen

Name: 28 Days Later

Name: Story of a Love Affair

Name: The Man from Earth

Name: Bells Are Ringing

Name: The Boston Strangler

Name: The Decameron
One-line: An adaptation of nine stories from Boccaccio's "Decameron".

Name: Cabin in the Sky
One-line: A compulsive gambler dies during a shooting, but he'll receive a second chance to reform himself and to make up with his worried wife.

Name: God's Own Country

Name: Elite Squad 2: The Enemy Within

Name: Swing Kids

Name: Shenandoah

Name: The Professional

Name: Talk to Me

Name: The Lost World

Name: The House with Laughing Windows

Name: Fahrenheit 451

Name: Lion
One-line: A five-year-old Indian boy is adopted by an Australian couple after getting lost hundreds of kilometers from home. 25 years later, he sets out to find his lost family.

Name: Boy

Name: All That Breathes

Name: The Secret of Kells

Name: Laurence Anyways

Name: Sorry, Wrong Number

Name: Black Legion

One-line: After the murder of his fiancée, a Wyoming ranch hand sets out to find her killer.

Name: Mad God
One-line: The Assassin travels through a nightmare underworld of tortured souls, ruined cities and wretched monstrosities forged from the primordial horrors of the unconscious mind of Phil Tippett, the world's preeminent stop-motion animator.

Name: Boy Meets Girl
One-line: Paris by night. Alex, 22, wants to become a filmmaker. He is fascinated by first times and his girlfriend, Florence, has just left him for his best friend, Thomas. First break-up, first ... See full summary »

Name: Caesar Must Die
One-line: Inmates at a high-security prison in Rome prepare for a public performance of Shakespeare's "Julius Caesar."

Name: A Tale of Springtime
One-line: Simple conversations engender complicated human interactions. Jeanne is open and even-tempered, a philosophy teacher at a lycée. Her fiancé is away and she doesn't want to stay at his messy... See full summary »

Name: Slap Shot
One-line: A failing ice hockey team finds success with outrageously violent hockey goonery.

Name: Testament
One-line: The life of a suburban American family is scarred after a nuclear attack.

Name: Fearless
One-line: A man's personality is dramatically changed after surviving a major airline crash.

Name: Birds of Passage
One-line: During the marijuana bonanza, a violent decade that saw the origins of drug trafficking in Colombia, Rapayet and his indigenous family get involved in a war to control the business that ends up destroying their lives and their culture.

Name: Side by Side
One-line: The documentary investigates the history, process and workflow of both digital and photochemical film creation.

Name: Gattaca
One-line: A genetically inferior man assumes the identity of a superior one in order to pursue his lifelong dream of space travel.

Name: The Sure Thing
One-line: Walter Gibson is a university freshman going through a dry spell. His old buddy arranges a "sure thing" for him in California. Gibson and his classmate Allison then take a long road trip out to Cali, and both foil each other's plans.

Name: The Tale
One-line: A woman filming a documentary on childhood rape victims starts to question the nature of her childhood relationship with her riding instructor and running coach.

Name: 20,000 Days on Earth
One-line: Writer and musician Nick Cave marks his 20,000th day on the planet Earth.

Name: River's Edge
One-line: A high school slacker commits a shocking act and proceeds to let his friends in on the secret. However, the friends' reaction is almost as ambiguous and perplexing as the crime itself.

Name: In the Soup
One-line: New Yorker Adolpho Rollo is your classic head-movie auteur. In his mind, he's creating deathless classics of the screen. Back in the real world, he can't pay the rent on the downtown flophouse he calls home.

Name: The Crimson Pirate
One-line: During the 1700s, pirate Captain Vallo seizes a British warship and gets involved in various money-making schemes involving Caribbean rebels led by El Libre, British envoy Baron Jose Gruda, and a beautiful courtesan named Consuelo.

Name: Life Is a Miracle
One-line: What could be better for the village than a scenic railway to bring in the tourists? What could be worse for tourism than war? Luka builds the railway and shuts his eyes to war. Then Luka's wife runs off with a musician and his son is called up to the army. Luka's life is a war zone. Then he meets Sabaha..

Name: The Taste of Others
One-line: The lives of 6 people over 35 in Rouen, France, and their relationship to each other.

Name: Faraway, So Close!
One-line: A group of angels in the German capital look longingly upon the life of humans.

Name: Blood and Sand
One-line: Illiterate peasant Juan Gallardo rises meteorically to fame and fortune in the bullfight arena only to sow the seeds of his own fall.

Name: Parenthood
One-line: Four Buckman siblings attempt to raise their children - each in their own different style - and deal with the joys and sorrows that the process brings.

Name: The Five Heartbeats
One-line: The story of the rise and fall of an African American vocal group.

Name: In the City of Sylvia
Actors: ['Pilar López de Ayala', 'Xavier Lafitte', 'Laurence Cordier', 'Tanja Czichy']
One-line: A man returns to a city to try to track down a lovely woman he met six years earlier.

Name: The Winslow Boy
One-line: Following the theft of a postal order, a 14-year-old cadet is expelled from Naval College. To save the honour of the boy and his family, the pre-eminent barrister of the day is engaged to take on the might of the Admiralty.

Name: Starred Up
One-line: Eric Love, 19, is locked up in prison. On his first day, he assaults another inmate and several guards. He's offered group therapy and his dad, an inmate as well, tries to talk sense into him. Can he be rehabilitated?

Name: Quatermass and the Pit
One-line: A mysterious artifact is unearthed in London, and famous scientist Bernard Quatermass is called in to divine its origins and explain its strange effects on people.

Name: A Room for Romeo Brass
One-line: After stopping 12 y.o. Romeo and Gavin from being beaten up, Morell drives them home and meets Romeo's adult sister and falls in love. The boys "help" him in his pursuit.

Name: Cinderella Man
One-line: The true story of James J. Braddock, a supposedly washed-up boxer, who returned to the spotlight to win the heavyweight championship of the world.

Name: Diego Maradona
One-line: Constructed from over 500 hours of never-before-seen footage, this documentary centers on the career of celebrated football player Diego Maradona, who played for S.S.C. Napoli in the 1980s.

Name: Bridge of Spies
One-line: During the Cold War, an American lawyer is recruited to defend an arrested Soviet spy in court, and then help the CIA facilitate an exchange of the spy for the Soviet captured American U2 spy plane pilot, Francis Gary Powers.

Name: Kuch Kuch Hota Hai
One-line: During their college years, Anjali was in love with her best-friend Rahul, but he had eyes only for Tina. Years later, Rahul and the now-deceased Tina's eight-year-old daughter attempts to reunite her father and Anjali.

Name: Side Street
One-line: A struggling young father-to-be gives in to temptation and impulsively steals money from the office of a shady lawyer--with catastrophic consequences.

Name: Star Trek: First Contact
One-line: The Borg travel back in time intent on preventing Earth's first contact with an alien species. Captain Picard and his crew pursue them to ensure that Zefram Cochrane makes his maiden flight reaching warp speed.

Name: Nise: The Heart of Madness
One-line: Based on the true story of Dr. Nise da Silveira, a psychiatrist in Brazil who treated her patients with art instead of electroshock therapy.

Name: Paradise Now
One-line: Two childhood friends are recruited for a suicide bombing in Tel Aviv.

Name: Scrooge
One-line: A musical retelling of Charles Dickens' classic novel about an old bitter miser taken on a journey of self-redemption, courtesy of several mysterious Christmas apparitions.

Name: Rudy
One-line: Rudy has always been told that he was too small to play college football. But he is determined to overcome the odds and fulfill his dream of playing for Notre Dame.

Name: The Kirishima Thing
One-line: A story about the disappearance of Kirishima, a star athlete of the volleyball club, and how this affects every person in his school.

Name: Office Space
One-line: Three company workers who hate their jobs decide to rebel against their greedy boss.

Name: The Secret of Roan Inish
One-line: Young Fiona lives with her grandparents in a small fishing village where she takes an active role to unravel the mysterious secrets.

Name: Longtime Companion
One-line: The emergence and devastation of the AIDS epidemic is chronicled in the lives of several gay men living during the 1980s.

Name: The Dark Corner
One-line: A secretary tries to help her boss who's been framed for murder.

Name: The Lower Depths
One-line: In a Japanese slum, various residents play out their lives, dreaming of better things or settling for their lot. Among them is a man who pines for a young woman but is stymied by her deceptive family.

Name: PK
One-line: An alien on Earth loses the only device he can use to communicate with his spaceship. His innocent nature and child-like questions force the country to evaluate the impact of religious views on people.

Name: Five Deadly Venoms
One-line: The sixth and final pupil of a dying martial arts teacher is instructed to find the teacher's five former pupils and defeat any evil ones that are among them.

Name: The God of Cookery
One-line: The most renowned and feared chef in the world loses his title of God of Cookery because of his pompous attitude. Humbled, he sets out to reclaim his title.

Name: The Headless Woman
One-line: After hitting something with her car, a bourgeois Argentine woman's life slowly descends into paranoia and isolation, as she fears she may have killed someone.

Name: Intimate Stories
One-line: Three people and a baby set off on separate journeys, along the same road; their disparate dreams and stories intertwine amidst the breathtaking deserted Patagonic route.

Name: The Blade
One-line: A swordsmith trains his friend's orphaned son. The boy seeks revenge for his father's murder but loses an arm rescuing the swordsmith's daughter. A hermit girl nurses him, and he learns swordsmanship with his father's broken sword.

Name: Konosuba!: God's Blessing on This Wonderful World! - Legend of Crimson
One-line: Kazuma's party is suddenly alerted by an outrageous letter delivered by Yunyun. The letter requested that they come to the Crimson Demon Clan's village, that is facing a threat that could mean it's ending.

Name: The House of Fear
One-line: Sherlock Holmes investigates a series of deaths at a castle with each foretold by the delivery of orange pips to the victims.

Name: Iron Man
One-line: After being held captive in an Afghan cave, billionaire engineer Tony Stark creates a unique weaponized suit of armor to fight evil.

Name: The Tall Blond Man with One Black Shoe
One-line: A hapless orchestra player becomes an unwitting pawn of rival factions within the French secret service after he is chosen as a decoy by being identified as a super secret agent.

Name: The Lodger
One-line: A landlady suspects that her new lodger is Jack the Ripper.

Name: Miracle in Cell No. 7
Actors: ['Aras Bulut Iynemli', 'Nisa Sofiya Aksongur', 'Deniz Baysal', 'Celile Toyon Uysal']
One-line: A story of love between a mentally-ill father who was wrongly accused of murder and his lovely six year old daughter. Prison will be their home. Based on the 2013 Korean movie Miracle in Cell No. 7 (2013).

Name: Runaway Train
Actors: ['Jon Voight', 'Eric Roberts', 'Rebecca De Mornay', 'Kyle T. Heffner']
One-line: Two escaped convicts and a female railway worker find themselves trapped on a speeding train with no brakes and nobody driving.

Name: A Taxi Driver
One-line: A widowed father and taxi driver who drives a German reporter from Seoul to Gwangju to cover the 1980 uprising, soon finds himself regretting his decision after being caught in the violence around him.

Name: Gulaal
Actors: ['Kay Kay Menon', 'Raj Singh Chaudhary', 'Raja Chaudhary', 'Jesse Randhawa']
One-line: A law student witnesses deception, homicide, and crime after being elected as General Secretary of his college.

Name: The Hunchback of Notre Dame
One-line: In 15th-century Paris, the brother of the archdeacon plots with the gypsy king to foment a peasant revolt. Meanwhile, a freakish hunchback falls in love with a gypsy dancer.

Name: Dirty Rotten Scoundrels
One-line: Two con men try to settle their rivalry by betting on who can swindle a young American heiress out of fifty thousand dollars first.

Name: 127 Hours
One-line: A mountain climber becomes trapped under a boulder while canyoneering alone near Moab, Utah and resorts to desperate measures in order to survive.

Name: The Mob
One-line: Johnny Damico botches a murder case and is suspended from the force. In reality, he is put undercover to identify the mysterious boss of the NY waterfront who has murdered everyone in his way. Will Johnny be next in line?

Name: Klaus
Actors: ['Carlos Martínez López', 'Jason Schwartzman', 'J.K. Simmons', 'Rashida Jones', 'Will Sasso']
One-line: A simple act of kindness always sparks another, even in a frozen, faraway place. When Smeerensburg's new postman, Jesper, befriends toymaker Klaus, their gifts melt an age-old feud and deliver a sleigh full of holiday traditions.

Name: Charlotte's Web
One-line: Wilbur is a farm pig who's terrified that he'll end up on the dinner table. His friend Charlotte, a charming spider, comes to his rescue. She weaves words into her web, convincing the farmer that Wilbur is too special a pig to kill.

Name: Arthur
One-line: Alcoholic billionaire playboy Arthur Bach must marry a woman he does not love, or he will be cut off from his $750,000,000 fortune. But when Arthur falls in love with a poor waitress, he must decide if he wants to choose love or money.

Name: Jo
One-line: A writer of detective stories desperately trying to hide a corpse in his house - and at the same time to know exactly who he killed accidentally.

Name: Ziegfeld Follies
Actors: ['Roy Del Ruth', 'Robert Lewis', 'Vincente Minnelli', 'George Sidney', 'Merrill Pye', 'Charles Walters', 'William Powell', 'Judy Garland', 'Lucille Ball', 'Fred Astaire']
One-line: The late, great impresario Florenz Ziegfeld Jr. looks down from Heaven and ordains a new revue in his grand old style.

Name: Paan Singh Tomar
One-line: The story of Paan Singh Tomar, an Indian athlete and seven-time national steeplechase champion who becomes one of the most feared dacoits in Chambal Valley after his retirement.

Name: Shanghai Triad
One-line: A provincial boy related to a Shanghai crime family is recruited by his uncle into cosmopolitan Shanghai in the 1930s to be a servant to a ganglord's mistress.

Name: The Weather Underground
One-line: The remarkable story of The Weather Underground, radical activists of the 1970s, and of radical politics at its best and most disastrous.

Name: The Lighthouse
One-line: Two lighthouse keepers try to maintain their sanity while living on a remote and mysterious New England island in the 1890s.

Name: Shutter Island
One-line: Teddy Daniels and Chuck Aule, two US marshals, are sent to an asylum on a remote island in order to investigate the disappearance of a patient, where Teddy uncovers a shocking truth about the place.

Name: Dev.D
One-line: After breaking up with his childhood sweetheart, a young man finds solace in drugs. Meanwhile, a teenage girl is caught in the world of prostitution. Will they be destroyed, or will they find redemption?

Name: Kiss Me, Stupid
One-line: Jealous piano teacher Orville Spooner sends his beautiful wife, Zelda, away for the night while he tries to sell a song to famous nightclub singer Dino, who is stranded in town.

Name: La faute à Fidel!
One-line: A 9-year-old girl weathers big changes in her household as her parents become radical political activists in 1970-71 Paris.

Name: Carefree
One-line: A psychiatrist falls in love with the woman he's supposed to be nudging into marriage with someone else.

Name: King of New York
One-line: A drug kingpin is released from prison and seeks to take total control of the criminal underworld in order to give back to the community.

Name: 20th Century Women
One-line: The story of a teenage boy, his mother, and two other women who help raise him among the love and freedom of Southern California of 1979.

Name: The 7th Voyage of Sinbad
One-line: When a princess is shrunken by an evil wizard, Sinbad must undertake a quest to an island of monsters to cure her and prevent a war.

One-line: Two documentary filmmakers chronicle their time in Sonagchi, Calcutta and the relationships they developed with children of prostitutes who work the city's notorious red light district.

Name: The Help
