Name: Meek's Cutoff
One-line: Settlers traveling through the Oregon desert in 1845 find themselves stranded in harsh conditions.

Name: Project Nim
One-line: Tells the story of a chimpanzee taken from its mother at birth and raised like a human child by a family in a brownstone on the upper West Side in the 1970s.

Name: English Vinglish
One-line: A quiet, sweet tempered housewife endures small slights from her well-educated husband and daughter every day because of her inability to speak and understand English.

Name: What Price Hollywood?
One-line: The career of a waitress takes off when she meets an amiable drunken Hollywood director.

Name: Microhabitat
One-line: Whiskey and cigarettes, the only ways of keeping her dignity in this city.

Name: Little Forest
One-line: A young woman grows tired of life in the city and returns to her hometown in the countryside.

Name: Pusher
One-line: A drug pusher grows increasingly desperate after a botched deal leaves him with a large debt to a ruthless drug lord.

Name: Fantastic Mr. Fox
One-line: An urbane fox cannot resist returning to his farm raiding ways and then must help his community survive the farmers' retaliation.

Name: Brothers
Actors: ['Ulrich Thomsen', 'Nikolaj Lie Kaas', 'Connie Nielsen', 'Sarah Juel Werner']
One-line: Two brothers must negotiate changing roles and shifting family dynamics when one is sent to war in Afghanistan.

Name: Darr
One-line: Darr is a girl's (Kiran) story caught between one man's (Sunil) love and another man's (Rahul) obsession.

Name: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
One-line: Journalist Mikael Blomkvist is aided in his search for a woman who has been missing for 40 years by young computer hacker Lisbeth Salander.

Name: Floating Clouds
One-line: A tragic social drama set in post war Japan and concerns a lonely woman trying to find purpose and stability in a devastated Tokyo.

Name: Support Your Local Sheriff!
One-line: In the old west, a man becomes a Sheriff just for the pay, figuring he can decamp if things get tough. In the end, he uses ingenuity instead.

Name: Bab'Aziz: The Prince That Contemplated His Soul
One-line: The story of a blind dervish Bab'Aziz and his spirited granddaughter, Ishtar, together they wander the desert in search of a great reunion of dervishes that takes place just once every thirty years.

Name: Spider Baby or, the Maddest Story Ever Told
Actors: ['Lon Chaney Jr.', 'Carol Ohmart', 'Quinn K. Redeker', 'Beverly Washburn']
One-line: A caretaker devotes himself to three demented siblings after their father's death.

Name: Clean, Shaven
One-line: After a man suffering from schizophrenia is released from a mental institution, he attempts to get his daughter back from her adoptive family.

Name: Fahrenheit 9/11
One-line: Michael Moore's view on what happened to the United States after September 11 and how the Bush Administration allegedly used the tragic event to push forward its agenda for unjust wars in Afghanistan and Iraq.

Name: Nine to Five
One-line: Three female employees of a sexist, egotistical, lying, hypocritical bigot find a way to turn the tables on him.

Name: The Day Will Come
Actors: ['Lars Mikkelsen', 'Sofie Gråbøl', 'Harald Kaiser Hermann', 'Albert Rudbeck Lindhardt']
One-line: At the Orphanage Godhavn violence and humiliations plays a part of the everyday life. Based on real stories from Godhavn, where lots of boys were victims of violent and sexual abuse and medical neglect.

Name: Bajrangi Bhaijaan
One-line: An Indian man with a magnanimous heart takes a young mute Pakistani girl back to her homeland to reunite her with her family.

Name: Palm Springs
One-line: Stuck in a time loop, two wedding guests develop a budding romance while living the same day over and over again.

Name: I Wanna Hold Your Hand
Actors: ['Nancy Allen', 'Bobby Di Cicco', 'Marc McClure', 'Susan Kendall Newman']
One-line: In 1964, six teenagers from New Jersey run off to see The Beatles perform on The Ed Sullivan Show (1948) in the hope of meeting their idols. However, they don't have tickets. Along the way, they learn new things about friendship and growing up.

Name: In a Better World

Name: Gods and Monsters
One-line: The last days of Frankenstein (1931) director James Whale are explored.

Name: On the Count of Three
One-line: Jerrod Carmichael makes his directorial debut and stars in On the Count of Three, a darkly comic feature about two best friends, Val (Carmichael) and Kevin (Christopher Abbott), on the last day of their lives.

Name: The Martian
One-line: An astronaut becomes stranded on Mars after his team assume him dead, and must rely on his ingenuity to find a way to signal to Earth that he is alive and can survive until a potential rescue.

Name: Career Girls
One-line: 2 young women reunite and rekindle their friendship after having said goodbye at their college graduation, six years earlier.

Name: Kabhi Haan Kabhi Naa
One-line: A dreamer falls for a girl who is in love with someone else and tries to create a rift between her and the man she loves.

Name: 120 BPM
One-line: Members of the advocacy group ACT UP Paris demand action by the government and pharmaceutical companies to combat the AIDS epidemic in the early 1990s.

Name: Tony Takitani
One-line: When technical illustrator Tony Takitani asks his wife to resist her all-consuming obsession for designer clothes, the consequences are tragic.

Name: Serenity
One-line: The crew of the ship Serenity try to evade an assassin sent to recapture telepath River.

Name: Kizumonogatari Part 1: Tekketsu
One-line: Follows Araragi's encounter with the vampire Kiss-shot Acerola-orion Heart-under-blade and his journey back into humanity from being a vampire.

Name: The Eighth Day
One-line: An unusual and wonderful friendship develops between a busy but unhappy salesman and a resident of a mental asylum.

Name: April Story
One-line: In spring, a young girl leaves the island of Hokkaido to attend university in Tokyo.

Name: The Northman
One-line: A young Viking prince is on a quest to avenge his father's murder.

Name: The Maid
One-line: A drama centered on a maid trying to hold on to her position after having served a family for 23 years.

Name: Matinee
One-line: The teenage son of a navy sailor newly stationed in Key West gets some excitement with his friends when a small-time film producer comes to town to premiere a kitschy horror film during the Cuban Missile Crisis.

Name: The Broken Circle Breakdown
One-line: Elise and Didier fall in love at first sight, in spite of their differences. He talks, she listens. He's a romantic atheist, she's a religious realist. When their daughter becomes seriously ill, their love is put on trial.

Name: Silence
One-line: In the 17th century, two Portuguese Jesuit priests travel to Japan in an attempt to locate their mentor, who is rumored to have committed apostasy, and to propagate Catholicism.

Name: On the Beach
One-line: After a global nuclear war, the residents of Australia must come to terms with the fact that all life will be destroyed in a matter of months.

Name: Mission: Impossible - Fallout
One-line: Ethan Hunt and his IMF team, along with some familiar allies, race against time after a mission gone wrong.

Name: Once Upon a Time... in Hollywood
One-line: A faded television actor and his stunt double strive to achieve fame and success in the final years of Hollywood's Golden Age in 1969 Los Angeles.

Name: Food, Inc.
One-line: An unflattering look inside America's corporate controlled food industry.

Name: The Pearl of Death
One-line: When a valuable pearl with a sinister reputation is stolen, Sherlock Holmes must investigate its link to a series of brutal murders.

Name: Sweetie
One-line: An introspective young woman's life is upturned by the arrival of her maladjusted sister.

Name: Noises Off...
One-line: A travelling theater group find so much action going on behind-the-scenes, they almost ruin the performances.

Name: A Hidden Life
One-line: The Austrian Franz Jägerstätter, a conscientious objector, refuses to fight for the Nazis in World War II.

Name: Somewhere in the Night
One-line: George Taylor returns from WWII with amnesia. Back home in Los Angeles, while trying to track down his old identity, he stumbles onto a 3-year old murder case and a hunt for a missing $2 million.

Name: Barabbas
One-line: Governor Pontius Pilate gave the populace a choice to spare either Barabbas, a criminal, or Jesus, condemned as a heretic, from crucifixion. The masses chose Barrabas, and he is haunted by the image of Jesus for the rest of his life.

Name: The Outfit
One-line: Earl Macklin robs a bank owned by the mob, serves his prison time and is released, only to start a private war against the crime outfit that owned the bank.

Name: The Young Master
One-line: A talented martial arts student goes after his expelled brother, who get into bad company.

Name: Flamingo Road
One-line: A corrupt small town sheriff manipulates local candidates to the state legislature but he eventually comes into conflict with a visiting carnival dancer.

Name: Right Now, Wrong Then
One-line: A married film director falls for a young painter - twice.

Name: Troubled Water
Actors: ['Pål Sverre Hagen', 'Trine Dyrholm', 'Ellen Dorrit Petersen', 'Fredrik Grøndahl']
One-line: A man convicted in his teens for killing a child is released on parole. He struggles to build a new life, but his past is uncovered.

Name: The Pearl Button
One-line: Delving into the nearly-religious significance of water, this profound rumination on memory and loss bridges the gap between its mystical origins, Pinochet's coup d'état, and the secret of a mother-of-pearl button at the bottom of the sea.

Name: EO
One-line: Follows a donkey who encounters on his journeys good and bad people, experiences joy and pain, exploring a vision of modern Europe through his eyes.

Name: Laskar Pelangi
One-line: In the 1970s, a group of 10 students struggles with poverty and develop hopes for the future in Gantong Village on the farming and tin mining island of Belitung off the east coast of Sumatra.

Name: Born Free
One-line: The story of George and Joy Adamson and the orphaned lion cub, Elsa, they adopt.

Name: Pleasantville
One-line: Two 1990s teenage siblings find themselves transported to a 1950s sitcom where their influence begins to profoundly change that colorless, complacent world.

Name: Raining Stones
One-line: This Ken Loach film tells the story of a man devoted to his family and his religion. Proud, though poor, Bob wants his little girl to have a beautiful (and costly) brand-new dress for her ... See full summary »

Name: The Private Life of Sherlock Holmes
One-line: When a bored Holmes eagerly takes the case of Gabrielle Valladon after an attempt on her life, the search for her missing husband leads to Loch Ness and the legendary monster.

Name: The Inn of the Sixth Happiness
One-line: A tenacious British woman becomes a missionary and runs an inn for travelling merchants in China during the Japanese invasion and the tumultuous years leading up to the Second World War.

Name: The Night Strangler
One-line: A reporter hunts down a 144-year old alchemist who is killing women for their blood.

Name: The Women
One-line: A study of the lives and romantic entanglements of various interconnected women.

Name: Pink
One-line: When three young women are implicated in a crime, a retired lawyer steps forward to help them clear their names.

Name: Bad Genius
One-line: Lynn, a genius high school student who makes money by cheating tests, receives a new task that leads her to set foot on Sydney, Australia. In order to complete the millions-Baht task, Lynn and her classmates have to finish the international STIC(SAT) exam and deliver the answers back to her friends in Thailand before the exam takes place once again in her home country.

Name: The Thing from Another World
One-line: Scientists and American Air Force officials fend off a bloodthirsty alien organism while at a remote arctic outpost.

Name: Shiva Baby
One-line: At a Jewish funeral service with her parents, a college student runs into her sugar daddy and ex girlfriend.

Name: Play Dirty
One-line: During World War II a group of British commandos in North Africa disguised as Italian soldiers must travel behind enemy lines and destroy a vital German oil depot.

Name: Bound
Actors: ['Lilly Wachowski', 'Jennifer Tilly', 'Gina Gershon', 'Joe Pantoliano', 'John P. Ryan']
One-line: Tough ex-con Corky and her lover Violet concoct a scheme to steal millions of stashed mob money and pin the blame on Violet's crooked boyfriend Caesar.

Name: Ex Machina
One-line: A young programmer is selected to participate in a ground-breaking experiment in synthetic intelligence by evaluating the human qualities of a highly advanced humanoid A.I.

Name: Guy Ritchie's the Covenant
One-line: During the war in Afghanistan, a local interpreter risks his own life to carry an injured sergeant across miles of grueling terrain.

Name: Of Mice and Men
One-line: A nomadic farm worker looks after his dimwitted, gentle-giant friend during the Great Depression.

Name: The Last Days of Disco
One-line: Story of two female Manhattan book editors fresh out of college, both finding love and themselves while frequenting the local disco.

Name: Pi
One-line: A paranoid mathematician searches for a key number that will unlock the universal patterns found in nature.

Name: Why We Fight
One-line: Is American foreign policy dominated by the idea of military supremacy? Has the military become too important in American life? Jarecki's shrewd and intelligent polemic would seem to give an affirmative answer to each of these questions.

Name: Mighty Joe Young
One-line: A young woman who has raised a giant gorilla from an infant brings him to Hollywood years later seeking her fortune.

Name: Rain
One-line: A prostitute newly arrived in the South Pacific finds herself at odds with a stern missionary determined to save her soul.

Name: 71 Fragments of a Chronology of Chance
One-line: 71 scenes revolving around a recent immigrant, a couple that has just adopted a daughter, a college student and a lonely old man.

Name: Cha Cha Real Smooth
One-line: A young man who works as a Bar Mitzvah party host strikes up a friendship with a mother and her autistic daughter.

Name: Girlhood
One-line: A girl with few real prospects joins a gang, reinventing herself and gaining a sense of self confidence in the process. However, she soon finds that this new life does not necessarily make her any happier.

Name: Joyeux Noel
One-line: In December 1914, an unofficial Christmas truce on the Western Front allows soldiers from opposing sides of the First World War to gain insight into each other's way of life.

Name: Not Quite Hollywood: The Wild, Untold Story of Ozploitation!
One-line: The story of the Australian exploitation genre cinema of 1970s and 80s.

Name: Raatchasan

Name: Lisbon Story

Name: Bram Stoker's Dracula

Name: A Hijacking

Name: American Pop

Name: American Honey

Name: Knives Out

One-line: A detective investigates the death of the patriarch of an eccentric, combative family.

Name: The Specials
One-line: The story of two men, educators of children and adolescents with autism.

Name: The Bear

One-line: A documentary about writer and director Brian De Palma.

Name: Volver

Name: The Seven Year Itch

A freelance sleuth neighbor moves Don to embark on a cross-country search for his old flames in search of answers.

Name: Powaqqatsi

One-line: An exploration of technologically developing nations and the effect the transition to Western-style modernization has had on them.

Name: Robin Williams: Come Inside My Mind
One-line: An intimate look into the life and work of the revered master comedian and actor, Robin Williams.

Name: James White

Name: Phantasm

Name: Address Unknown

Name: The Miracle of Marcelino

Twelve jurors must decide the fate of a Chechen adolescent charged with murdering his stepfather.

Name: Salmer fra kjøkkenet

Name: Yazi Tura

In a totalitarian future society, a man, whose daily work is re-writing history, tries to rebel by falling in love.

Name: A Little Romance

Name: Crip Camp

Name: Herod's Law

Name: Flirting with Disaster

One-line: In the dead of a Wyoming winter, a bounty hunter and his prisoner find shelter in a cabin currently inhabited by a collection of nefarious characters.

Name: Shotgun Stories

Name: The Dish

Name: Hustle

Name: Ghost in the Shell 2: Innocence

One-line: In the year 2032, Batô, a cyborg detective for the anti-terrorist unit Public Security Section 9, investigates the case of a female robot--one created solely for sexual pleasure--who slaughtered her owner.

Name: Showing Up

Documenting this once in a life time performance and an intimate portrait of James Murphy as he navigates the lead-up to the show, the day after, and the personal and professional ramifications of his decision.

Name: Berlin Express
One-line: A multinational group of train passengers become involved in a post-World War II Nazi assassination plot.

Name: Zero Day

Name: What Time Is It There?

Name: Junior Bonner

Name: Tucker: The Man and His Dream

Name: The Treasure of the Silver Lake

Name: The Unknown Soldier

Name: Buck and the Preacher

Name: Four Lions

Name: Whirlpool

Name: Fences

Name: A Twelve-Year Night

One-line: 1973. Uruguay is governed by a military dictatorship. One autumn night, three Tupamaro prisoners are taken from their jail cells in a secret military operation. The order is precise: "As we can't kill them, let's drive them mad."

Name: Taboo
One-line: The new member of a samurai militia unit causes disruption as several of his colleagues fall in love with him, threatening to disturb the rigid code of their squad.

Name: Dead & Buried
One-line: Sheriff Dan Gillis investigates eerie deaths in a sleepy coastal town.

Name: The Flying Deuces
One-line: Ollie has fallen in love with the innkeeper's daughter in Paris. The only problem - she's very much in love with her husband. To forget her he joins the Foreign Legion with Stan. Bad idea.

Name: Asterix in Britain

Name: Dragons Forever
Actors: ['Corey Yuen', 'Jackie Chan', 'Sammo Kam-Bo Hung', 'Biao Yuen', 'Pauline Yeung']
One-line: Three successful Hong Kong lawyers are hired by a chemical company of questionable ethics and must eventually make a difficult decision when their employer's motives become clear.

Name: Kona fer í stríð
Actors: ['Halldóra Geirharðsdóttir', 'Jóhann Sigurðarson', 'Juan Camilo Román Estrada', 'Jörundur Ragnarsson']
One-line: Halla becomes a determined environmental activist, but this threatens a long-held hope of hers.

Name: Ulee's Gold
One-line: A reclusive beekeeper slowly pulls his dysfunctional family back together, but not without having to fight his son's previous dastardly cohorts.

Name: Transit
One-line: A man attempting to escape occupied France falls in love with the wife of a dead author whose identity he has assumed.

Name: Citizen X
One-line: During the 1980s, Soviet authorities hunt for a serial killer who picks his victims in railway stations and commuter trains and lures them into the woods.

Name: Never Look Away

Name: Hooper
One-line: Aging Hollywood stuntman Sonny Hooper wants to prove that he's still got what it takes to be a great professional in this risky, under-recognized line of work.

Name: Bes Vakit
Actors: ['Ozen Ozkan', 'Ali Bey Kayali', 'Elit Iscan', 'Bülent Emin Yarar']
One-line: The pain of growing up, as seen by three Turkish youths: Ömer, the son of the local imam, who wishes the death of his father; his best friend, Yakup, who's enamored with the village ... See full summary »

Name: Cars of the Revolution
One-line: In the years of military coup, Turkey was unable to produce its own cars. But Pasha believed that Turkish people can produce their own cars so he ordered 2 cars. Gunduz and engineers with him must produce 2 cars in only 130 days.

Name: The Aerial
One-line: This near-silent black and white film from Argentina tells the story of a city that has lost its voice, stolen by Mr. TV, and the attempts of a small family to win the voice back. Similar in design to early German expressionist films.

Name: Ödipussi
One-line: Gray-haired furniture retailer Paul Winkelmann still has his dinner cooked and his laundry done by his mother. He spends his evenings playing Scrabble with Mama's friends and discussing the... See full summary »

Name: Bittersweet
One-line: A 30-year-old Egyptian goes back to Egypt after living in America for 20 years, but he has a hard time coping with the difference, especially after he loses his identity and all his money and becomes stuck in Egypt.

Name: Love on Delivery
One-line: To prove himself to a love interest, a delivery boy learns dubious kung fu from an aging charlatan so he can challenge his archrival to a fight.

Name: Saint Frances
One-line: After an accidental pregnancy turned abortion, a deadbeat nanny finds an unlikely friendship with the six-year old she's charged with protecting.

Name: The Pink Panther
One-line: The bumbling Inspector Clouseau travels to Rome to catch a notorious jewel thief known as "The Phantom" before he conducts his most daring heist yet: a princess' priceless diamond with one slight imperfection, known as "The Pink Panther".

Name: Where the Green Ants Dream
One-line: A geologist employed by an Australian mining company finds himself disputing the rights of some aborigines who believe their land to be sacred.

Name: Hidden Agenda
One-line: When an American human rights lawyer is assassinated in Belfast, it remains for the man's girlfriend, as well as a tough, no nonsense, police detective to find the truth.

Name: The Same Love, the Same Rain
One-line: The fascinating love story between Jorge and Laura from 1980 to 1999, within a context in which Argentine politics and history transits between the dictatorship, the Falklands war and the nascent democracy.

Name: Fight Back to School
One-line: A SWAT team leader is forced by his captain to go undercover as a high school student to retrieve the captain's personal gun which was stolen during a school field trip to the police station.

Name: The Canterbury Tales
One-line: Pasolini's artistic, sometimes violent, always vividly cinematic retelling of some of Chaucer's most erotic tales.

Name: A Touch of Class
One-line: Romantic comedy about a pair of clandestine lovers in a London-Spain tryst.

Name: Godzilla, Mothra and King Ghidorah: Giant Monsters All-Out Attack
One-line: A reporter, notorious for working on pseudo-documentaries, must uncover the legend of the three guardian monsters who must rise to defend Japan from the vengeful spirits within Godzilla.

Name: Starship Troopers
One-line: Humans, in a fascist militaristic future, wage war with giant alien bugs.

Name: Peter's Friends
One-line: Six former college friends, with two new friends, gather for a New Year's Eve weekend reunion at a large English countryside manor after ten years to reminisce about the good times now long gone.

Name: The Hidden

Name: A Bug's Life
One-line: A misfit ant, looking for "warriors" to save his colony from greedy grasshoppers, recruits a group of bugs that turn out to be an inept circus troupe.

Name: Croupier
One-line: An aspiring writer is hired as a croupier at a casino, where he realizes that his life as a croupier would make a great novel.

Name: Black Robe

Name: La Vie En Rose
One-line: Biopic of the iconic French singer Édith Piaf. Raised by her grandmother in a brothel, she was discovered while singing on a street corner at the age of 19. Despite her success, Piaf's life was filled with tragedy.

Name: Sleepless in Seattle

Name: The Town

Name: Suzanne's Career
One-line: The friendship of Bertrand and Guillaume is complicated when the womanizing Guillaume begins to pursue a charming girl named Suzanne.

Name: The End of the Tour

Name: Rams

Name: Insomnia

Name: Marshland
One-line: Two cops lost in the deep south of Spain. One serial killer to catch. A lot of secrets and lies to disclose.

Name: Android Kunjappan Ver 5.25
One-line: Story of a conventional, conservative small town villager and his son who has to move away from home due to his profession. Their relationship gets an endearing twist when an AI humanoid enters their lives and fills in their emptiness.

Name: Atlantics

Name: Regular Lovers
One-line: 1968 and 1969 in Paris during and after the student and trade-union revolt. 20-year-old François is a poet dodging military service. He takes to the barricades, but won't throw a Molotov ... See full summary »

Name: Querelle
One-line: A handsome sailor is drawn into a vortex of sibling rivalry, murder, and explosive sexuality.

Name: There's Always Tomorrow
One-line: When a toy manufacturer feels ignored and unappreciated by his wife and children, he begins to rekindle a past love when a former employee comes back into his life.

Name: The Man from Snowy River

Name: Goodbye First Love

Name: Life and a Day

Name: The Blue Elephant
One-line: While trying to help an inmate at the mental hospital, a psychotherapist unravels mysteries he never thought existed.

Name: Jungle Fever
One-line: Friends and family of a married Black architect react in different ways to his affair with an Italian secretary.

Name: Chocolat
One-line: A French woman returns to her childhood home in Cameroon - formerly a colonial outpost - where she's flooded by memories, particularly of Protée, her servant.

Name: Polisse
One-line: A journalist covering police assigned to a juvenile division enters into an affair with one of her subjects.

Name: The Ghost Breakers
One-line: A radio broadcaster, his quaking manservant and an heiress investigate the mystery of a haunted castle in Cuba.

Name: Looking
One-line: Patrick returns to San Francisco in search of closure and resolution regarding his relationships with Richie and Kevin.

Name: Lakshya
One-line: An aimless, jobless, irresponsible grown man joins the army and matures into a battlefield hero.

Name: Death of a Salesman
One-line: An aging traveling salesman recognizes the emptiness of his life and tries to fix it.

Name: Is Paris Burning?
One-line: August 1944. The Allies are approaching Paris and resistance groups within the city start to plan an uprising against the Germans. However, Hitler wants the city destroyed if it looks like the Allies will take it.

Name: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
One-line: As Harry Potter begins his sixth year at Hogwarts, he discovers an old book marked as "the property of the Half-Blood Prince" and begins to learn more about Lord Voldemort's dark past.

Name: Udta Punjab
One-line: A story that revolves around drug abuse in the affluent north Indian State of Punjab and how the youth there have succumbed to it en-masse resulting in a socio-economic decline.

Name: Pigsty
One-line: A man wandering in a volcanic desert forms a band of murderous cannibals. A post-war German industrialist learns that his son is unable to make decisions or form relationships.

Name: The Big Steal
One-line: An army lieutenant accused of robbery pursues the real thief on a frantic chase through Mexico aided by the thief's fiancee.

Name: Gimme the Loot
One-line: When their latest work is buffed by a rival crew, two determined graffiti writers embark on an elaborate plan to bomb the ultimate location: the New York Mets' Home Run Apple.

Name: Jesus' Son
One-line: A young man, often high on drugs and alcohol, careens through life and makes his way toward recovery and redemption.

Name: Matador
One-line: A matador is wounded by a bull and can no longer kill in the arena. It is just one of the problems of one of the characters that unexpectedly collide in this film.

Name: 48 Hrs.
One-line: A hard-nosed cop reluctantly teams up with a wise-cracking criminal temporarily paroled to him in order to track down a killer.

Name: Major Dundee

Name: Scream

Name: Gallipoli

Name: Fedora

Name: The Spanish Prisoner

Name: Bedlam
One-line: Nell Bowen, the protégé of Lord Mortimer, wants to help change the conditions of notorious St. Mary's of Bethlehem Asylum (Bedlam). Though she tries to reform Bedlam, the cruel Master Sims ... See full summary »

Name: The Man from London

Name: Oye Lucky! Lucky Oye!

Name: Scott Pilgrim vs. the World

Name: Leave No Trace

Name: Baadasssss!

Name: The Miracle of P. Tinto

Name: Detective Conan: The Fourteenth Target
One-line: People who were linked with Mori Kogoro are being attacked or killed according to their names' number sequences.

Name: Simple Simon

Name: Homicidal

Name: 8 Mile

Name: The Square

Name: Bell Book and Candle

Name: Ménage
One-line: A bisexual petty criminal named Bob encounters a married couple arguing in a bar. Bob breaks up the fight and proceeds to seduce first the wife and then the husband. Then Bob teaches the ... See full summary »

Name: The Party
One-line: A clerical mistake results in a bumbling Indian film star being invited to an exclusive Hollywood party instead of being fired.

Name: The Decline of the American Empire

Name: Nightmare Alley

Name: Bedevilled

Name: Hara-Kiri: Death of a Samurai

Name: Summer 1993

Name: 500 Days of Summer

Name: Virgin Mountain

Name: Things Change

Name: Indie Game: The Movie

Name: The SpongeBob SquarePants Movie

Name: A Double Life

Name: Cairo 678
One-line: Unfolds the poignant story of three women and their search for justice from the daily plight of sexual harassment in Egypt.

Name: The Limey

Name: Cheyenne Autumn

Name: Silk Stockings
One-line: A Russian government official is sent to Paris to bring back her comrades; she soon gets a taste of Paris life and falls in love with an American movie producer.

Name: The Dark Horse
One-line: A brilliant but troubled New Zealand chess champion finds purpose by teaching underprivileged children about the rules of chess and life.

Name: When Marnie Was There
One-line: Anna, a shy 12-year-old girl, is sent to spend time with her aunt and uncle who live in the countryside, where she meets Marnie. The two become best friends. But Anna gradually discovers that Marnie is not quite who she appears to be.

Name: Holding the Man

Name: Italiensk for begyndere
Actors: ['Anders W. Berthelsen', 'Ann Eleonora Jørgensen', 'Anette Støvelbæk', 'Peter Gantzler']
One-line: Several lonely hearts in a semi-provincial suburb of a town in Denmark use a beginner's course in Italian as the platform to meet the romance of their lives.

Name: The Rainmaker
One-line: An underdog lawyer takes on a fraudulent insurance company.

Name: The Pink Panther Strikes Again
One-line: After escaping from an insane asylum, the bonkers Charles Dreyfus sends 26 assassins on the trail of the forever bumbling Inspector Clouseau.

Name: Love Me or Leave Me

Name: Tickled
One-line: Journalist David Farrier stumbles upon a mysterious tickling competition online. As he delves deeper he comes up against fierce resistance, but that doesn't stop him getting to the bottom of a story stranger than fiction.

Name: Sami Blood
One-line: A reindeer-breeding Sámi girl who is exposed to the racism of the 1930's at her boarding school, starts dreaming of another life. But to achieve it, she has to become someone else and break all ties with her family and culture.

Name: Under the Volcano
One-line: A day in the life of a self-destructive British consul in Mexico on the eve of World War II.

Name: Neighboring Sounds
One-line: The lives of the residents of a Brazilian apartment building and the security guards who get the job guarding the surrounding streets.

Name: The Wonders
One-line: A family of beekeepers living in the Tuscan countryside finds their household disrupted by the simultaneous arrival of a silently troubled teenage boy and a reality TV show intent on showcasing the family.

Name: We're No Angels

Name: Beat the Devil
One-line: On their way to Africa are a group of rogues who hope to get rich there, and a seemingly innocent British couple. They meet and things happen...

Name: Tales of the Grim Sleeper
Actors: ['Barney Broomfield', 'Marc Hoeferlin', 'Nick Broomfield', 'Lonnie David Franklin Jr.', 'Donna', 'Steve']
One-line: Nick Broomfield digs into the case of the notorious serial killer known as the Grim Sleeper, who terrorized South Central Los Angeles over a span of twenty-five years.

Name: Journey to the Center of the Earth
One-line: An Edinburgh professor and assorted colleagues follow an explorer's trail down an extinct Icelandic volcano to the earth's center.

Name: Mermaid
One-line: In Moscow, a young woman disappears after falling in love with a new man.

Name: You Are the Apple of My Eye
One-line: A group of close friends who attend a private school all have a debilitating crush on the sunny star pupil, Shen Jiayi. The only member of the group who claims not to is Ke Jingteng, but he ends up loving her as well.

Name: Sparrow
One-line: A gang of pickpockets roam the streets of Hong Kong.

Name: Rust and Bone
One-line: Put in charge of his young son, Alain leaves Belgium for Antibes to live with his sister and her husband as a family. Alain's bond with Stephanie, a killer whale trainer, grows deeper after Stephanie suffers a horrible accident.

Name: Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde
One-line: Dr. Henry Jekyll experiments with scientific means of revealing the hidden, dark side of man and releases a murderer from within himself.

Name: Opera
One-line: A young opera singer is stalked by a deranged fan bent on killing the people associated with her to claim her for himself.

Name: Import Export
Actors: ['Ekateryna Rak', 'Lidiya Oleksandrivna Savka', 'Oksana Ivanivna Sklyarenko', 'Dmytro Andriyovich Gachkov']
One-line: A nurse from Ukraine searches for a better life in Central Europe, while an unemployed security guard from Austria heads East for the same reason.

Name: Hereditary
One-line: A grieving family is haunted by tragic and disturbing occurrences.

Name: Bright Star
One-line: The three-year romance between 19th-century poet John Keats and Fanny Brawne near the end of his life.

Name: The Spider Woman
One-line: Sherlock Holmes investigates a series of so-called "pajama suicides". He knows the female villain behind them is as cunning as Moriarty and as venomous as a spider.

Name: Mother
One-line: A neurotic, twice-divorced sci-fi writer moves back in with his mother to solve his personal problems.

Name: Golgo 13: The Professional
One-line: After killing the son of a powerful oil tycoon, an infamous hit-man is targeted by American governmental forces and superhuman killers.

Name: Blue Jasmine
One-line: A New York socialite, deeply troubled and in denial, arrives in San Francisco to impose upon her sister. She looks like a million dollars but isn't bringing money, peace or love.

Name: Of Freaks and Men
One-line: Dariya the maid getting a boy to touch her large breast is just one incident that occurs when Yohan and Victor infiltrate two families, forcing young Liza and blind Ekaterina to appear in porn, but they are not so innocent themselves.

Name: The City of the Dead
One-line: A young college student arrives in a sleepy Massachusetts town to research witchcraft; during her stay at an eerie inn, she discovers a startling secret about the town and its inhabitants.

Name: Waterboys
One-line: In a Japanese high school, a class of adolescent geeks joins the new synchronized swimming teacher and takes up the challenge to take part in the competition, in spite of the mockeries of the "real sportsmen".
